His goal in the future is to buy his own home where he can set up his business, in a very busy commercial area.  This will mean he will no longer have to walk the streets every day selling his products and his work will become much easier.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, cassava, bananas and chicken in larger volumes

loans.name: Sambacoulibaly Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de 24 femmes très actives dans ce banc villageois créé en Décembre 2010. Elles sont toutes issues du même quartier et ont une bonne entente entre elles. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame l'emprunteur vedette du groupe assise à l’extrême droite avec la main droite levée est, âgée de 27 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfant (02 garçons et 01 fille).
Elle a une boutique et vend des produits alimentaires (riz, sucre, l’huile …) une activité qu’elle fait depuis 6 ans.

Avec ce prêt elle compte s’approvisionner en sucre, thé et riz au niveau des grossistes de Kolda pour revendre en détaille dans sa boutique.
-	Elle achète 02 sacs de sucre de 50 000F Cfa elle revend à 70 000F Cfa
-	Elle achète 10 grosse de thé à 8 000F Cfa pour revendre à 10 000F Cfa
-	Elle achète 01 sac de riz à 15 000F Cfa pour revendre au détail à 17 500F Cfa
-	Pour le transport et la manutention elle paie 5 000F Cfa
Apres vente et déduction des frais liés à l’exploitation elle se retrouve avec un bénéfice net hebdomadaire de 17 500F Cfa. 

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront d’épargner et de prendre en charge une partie de la dépense quotidienne et la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group comprises 24 women who are very active within their banc villageois, created in December 2010.  They all come from the same neighborhood and they get along well with each other.  Their main activity is small retail.

The group's featured borrower is 27 years old. (She is sitting on the right hand-side in the photo, and raising her hand).  She is married and the mother of three children, two boys and one girl.

She owns a shop and has been selling food products (rice, sugar, oil...) for six years.

With this loan, she is planning to purchase some sugar, tea and rice from wholesalers in Kolda, and then retail these merchandises in her shop.

She will buy:

- 2 bags of sugar, at a cost of 50,000 CFA francs, and will resell them at a price of 70,000 CFA francs,
- 10 large boxes of tea, at a cost of 8,000 CFA francs, and will resell them at a price of 10,000 CFA francs,
- 1 bag of rice at a cost of 15,000 CFA francs, and will resell it for 17,500 CFA francs.
She will pay 5,000 CFA francs for handling and transportation costs.

Once all merchandise is sold, and after deducting operating costs, she will end up with a net weekly profit of 17,500 CFA francs.

Profits from this activity will help her to put some money into saving, to contribute in part to the daily expenses and to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy sugar, tea and rice from wholesalers in Kolda and to retail these merchandises in her shop.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita de 52 años de edad, está dedicada al comercio de  prendas de vestir y accesorios femeninos,con los que complementa la buena presentación de su clientela y  que genera ingresos que apoyan su hogar; ella tiene una clientela fija, a quien le vende a crédito principalmente y donde quiera que Margarita se encuentre, identifica clientes potenciales que finalmente le compran, porque es muy consciente de las oportunidades y siempre está  aprovechándola. Su meta más adelante es tener una miscelánea, punto comercial donde agregue nuevos productos económicos, que su comunidad necesite y puedan encontrar en su negocio. Su mayor desafío es lograr obtener recursos para responder oportunamente a su creciente clientela, pues debe esperar recoger su dinero procedente de las cuentas por cobrar, para poder ser efectiva con sus compradores. Mientras trabaja esmeradamente y genera los principales ingresos de su hogar,  maneja una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menores del 21% y la rotación de sus cuentas por cobrar es no mayor de 20 días. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará  prendas de vestir informal femenina, masculina e infantil. Con ello responderá oportunamente a la clientela, que ha hecho sus pedidos, esperando de Margarita una servicial respuesta, como es la que ellos requieren.
texts.en: Margarita is 52 years old. She is a merchant who sells clothing and women's accesories. With these she helps her customers present themselves well and generates income to support her home. She has regular customers to whom she sells mostly on credit. Wherever Margarita is, she identifies potential customers who will eventually buy from her. She is aware of opportunties and allways taking advantage of them. Her goal for the future is to have a variety store, a commercial locale where she can add new economy products that her community needs and can find in her business. Her biggest challenge in is obtaining resources to respond to her growing clientele quickly. She has to wait to get her money from her accounte receivable to be able to be effective from her buyers. While she works hard and generates the main income for her home, she maintains a profit margin of no less than 21% and her turnover for her accounts receivable is no more than 20 days. Right now, she is applying for an account receivable, the first loan she has taken out with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it, she will buy informal women's, men's and children's clothing. This way, she will respond quickly to the customers who have made their orders and are expecting Margarita to respond promptly, which is what they want.

loans.use: to buy informal women's, men's and children's clothing.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es: Tomás de 39 años de edad, se dedicó desde muy joven a la actividad comercial, vendiendo productos lácteos en compañía de su hermana, allí les fue bien hasta que ella falleció y se fue a vivir a otra ciudad con su hermano, de quien aprendió el oficio de electricidad y mantenimiento, que a futuro empezó a desempeñar, cuando contrajo matrimonio al regresar a la ciudad de Barranquilla, donde actualmente trabaja en un hotel de la ciudad, como jefe de mantenimiento y desde hace 6 años con el fin de aumentar sus ingresos familiares, decidió invertir sus ahorros en la compra de calzado de marcas extranjeras, que le traen desde el vecino país de Panamá y que el vende a crédito a una clientela selecta. La esposa de Tomás es también una mujer de mucha capacidad emprendedora y se dedica al comercio de ropa y perfumería, apoyando la gestión de su hogar; ambos trabajan con el fin de proveer a su hijo de 14 años, todo lo necesario para lograr el bienestar actual y la posibilidad de éxito profesional futuro. En la actualidad Tomás requiere capital de trabajo, para hacer compras en mayor volumen de calzado Adidas, Nike, Reebok en el marco de pedidos que le han hecho y a los cuales desea responder de manera oportuna y también porque comprando en mayor cantidad, reduce los costos de ventas y esto lo traducirá en precios competitivos, para ganar aun mas clientes, pues es con ellos que conseguirá el aumento de sus ventas  y poco a poco logrará cumplir su sueño de tener un vehículo y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en: Tomás is 39 years old. Since he was very young he has worked as a merchant, selling dairy products in his sister's company. It was going well for them there until his sister passed away and he went to the city to live with his brother. From him he learned the trade of electrician and maintenance, which he started to work in. He married and returned to the city of Barranquilla where he now works in a hotel in town as chief of maintenance. Six years ago, in order to increase his family income, he decided to invest his savings in buying foreign brands of shoes that come to him from the neighboring country of Panamá. he sells them to a select group of customers. Tomás' wife is also a very capable entrepreneur who sells clothing and perfume to help the household income. They both work in order to provide for their 14 year old son and give him everything he needs for his wellbeing and for future professional success. At present, Tomás needs working capital to make purchases in larger quantities of shoes such as Addidas, Nike, and Reebok, which he has orders for. He wants to respond quickly and also buy in larger quantities to reduce the sales cost, thus resulting in competitive prices to gain more customers. This way he will increase his sales and little by little make his dream come true of having a vehicle and expanding his business.

loans.use: to buy Addidas, Nike and Reebok shoes in greater quantities

loans.name: Irma Edelmira

texts.es:
Irma es una mujer de 31 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Subtanjalla con sus padres, hermanos y su pequeña hija, a quien ama y es su razón para seguir esforzándose, lamentablemente por diversas razones es madre soltera; ella siempre ha sido una persona amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante junto con su pequeño, lastimosamente por la necesidad de trabajar y solventar sus gastos no puedo cursar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo; en sus ratos libre le gusta bailar, ella antes disfrutaba dar clases de baile a niños en una escuela cercana a su hogar. 
Por iniciativa propia y gracias al apoyo de sus padres, desde hace 4 años Irma puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, desde tempranas horas de la mañana  Irma se dedica a atender a sus clientes, ella trabaja un aproximado de 12 horas diarias y cree que su negocio marcha bien debido a sus buenos productos, precios y buena atención.
Irma se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá  realizar la compra de mercadería para su negocio, tales como: arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche, atún, golosinas, entre otros abarrotes de primera necesidad; de esta manera Irma contará con un negocio mejor abastecido y podrá aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales desea poder utilizar para asegurar la educación, futuro y bienestar de su pequeña hija.
texts.en:
Irma is a 31 year old woman. She lives in the city of Ica, in the district of Subtanjalla with her parents, sublings and her young daughter whom she loves and who is the reason she keeps working hard. Lamentably, for different reasons, she is a single mother. She has always been a friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic woman who always puts all of her effort into getting ahead with her child. Unfortunately, because she has had to work and pay for her expenses she was unable to go to college, but she would have really liked to do so. In her free time, she likes to dance. Before, she used to like to give dance classes to children at the school near her house.
 
On her own initiative and thanks to her parents' support, four years ago Irma started her little business selling groceries. She starts serving customers in the early morning hours, working approximately 12 hours a day. She thinks that her business is going well sue to her good products, prices and service.

Irma is very grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the help they have offered, she can buy the merchandise for her business such as: rice, sugar, oil, milk, tuna, snacks, and more basic necessity products. This way, Irma will have a better stocked business and will be able to increase her sales and her income, which she wants to use to ensure the education, future and wellbeing of her young daughter.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business such as: rice, oil, milk, tuna, snacks, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional crates of drinks and a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Sambacoulibaly Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de 23 femmes très actives dans ce banc villageois créé en Décembre 2010. Elles sont toutes issues du même quartier et ont une bonne entente entre elles. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Diènabou (assise à l’extrême droite avec la main droite), est l’emprunteuse vedette,  âgée de 36 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05  enfants (4 Garçons et 1 fille).
Elle a une place au marché ou elle vend des légumes et de la patte d’arachide, elle a une expérience de 06 ans dans ce domaine.

Avec ce prêt elle compte s’approvisionner en légume et patte d’arachide dans les marchés hebdomadaires du sud Est.
-	Elle achète 20 sacs d’oignon à 70 000F Cfa pour le revendre au détail à 120 000F Cfa
-	Elle achète 02 sacs d’aubergine à 10 000F Cfa pour le revendre au détail à 15 000F Cfa
-	Elle achète 10 seaux de patte d’arachide à 100 000F Cfa pour revendre à 130 000F Cfa
-	Pour le transport et la manutention elle paie 15 000F Cfa
Chaque 15 jours après déduction de ses charges liées à son commerce et la dépense quotidienne elle se retrouve avec un bénéfice net de 55 000F Cfa en moyenne tous les 15  jours.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront d’épargner, de soutenir son marie pour la dépense quotidienne et d’acheter un terrain.
texts.en:
This group comprises 23 women who are very active within their banc villageois, created in December 2010. They all come from the same neighborhood and they get along well with each other. Their main activity is small retail.

The group's featured borrower, Diènabou, is 36 years old. (She is sitting on the right-hand side in the photo, and raising her hand). She is married and the mother of five children, four boys and one girl.

She has a spot at the market, where she has been selling vegetables and groundnut paste for the past six years.

With this loan, she is planning to purchase some vegetables and groundnut paste at the weekly markets in the south-east. 

She will buy:

- 20 bags of onions, at a cost of 70,000 CFA francs, and will retail them for 120,000 CFA francs,
- 2 bags of eggplants, at a cost of 10,000 CFA francs, and will retail them for 15,000 CFA francs,
- 10 buckets of groundnut paste at a cost of 100,000 CFA francs, and will retail them for 130,000 CFA francs.
She will pay 15,000 CFA francs for handling and transportation costs.

After deducting operating costs and daily expenses, she will end up with an average net profit of 55,000 CFA francs every other week.

With the profits from her activity, she will be able to put some money into saving, assist her husband with the daily expenses, and buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and groundnut paste at the weekly markets in the south-east.

loans.name: Tsitsino

texts.en:
Tsitsino is 26 years old. She lives in the small village of Zugdidi with her family -- her parents, who are pensioners, two sisters and a brother. The family earns their living through the agricultural business. They have a milking cow, a calf, a horse and three pigs. They sell piglets in nearby villages. The family also owns a plot of land, where they grow maize, nuts, and laurels. They are especially busy on their plot during the spring and summer seasons to get a good harvest. They sell harvested products in the local open market. The total average monthly income of the family is 800 Lari. They still don’t have enough income to make some savings for purchasing additional household goods or renovating their house. Their income is hardly enough for food and everyday expenses for six members of the family. 

Tsitsino requested a loan for purchasing nuts. She plans to purchase nuts from local farmers and sell them in the Zugdidi market and in nearby towns. Thus, the family will get additional income. With the increased income they plan to renovate the house, because the existing one is very old and uncomfortable. Due to the above mentioned, the living conditions of the family will be improved and they will be able to spend their evenings after a hard working day in more comfortable environment.

loans.use: to purchase nuts.

loans.name: Latavra

texts.en:
Latavra is 34 years old. She lives in Senaki District, West Georgia, with her family -- her husband, Ramaz, two children, her parents and a sister. Her husband works in construction and gets service fees for the work, while her parents are pensioners. Latavra and her sister are busy in the agricultural business. They have four milking cows, five calves, a pig and five goats. Latavra milks cows and goats twice a day and produces dairy foods like cheese, curds, and yogurt and sells them in the local open market. They also sell piglets. In addition to cattle breeding the family is busy with farming. They own a plot of land, where maize, nuts, and mandarins are grown. They work hard on their plot to get a good harvest. Harvest products are sold in the local open market. 

Latavra requested a loan for purchasing a milking cow. She plans to expand the dairy farm through adding additional cows. She will be able to double production and sales of dairy food, and the income of the family will significantly increase. With increased income she will be able to renovate the house. Thus, she will be able to create better living conditions for her family members.

loans.use: to purchase milking cows.

loans.name: Veronica Cecilia

texts.es: Veronica con su anterior credikiva se sintió muy satisfecha, porque pudo comprar  productos energéticos, refrescos y artículos deportivos, que vendió rotando su inventario rápidamente. Ella está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, porque se prepara para las vacaciones de adultos, jóvenes y niños, que invadirán el gimnasio, para ponerse en forma y para ellos tendrá disponible prendas de vestir deportivas y bebidas energéticas, para recuperar la energía consumida mediante el saludable ejercicio, todo esta inversión la logrará gracias a un nuevo credikiva. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Muchas gracias porque con personas como ustedes muchos microempresarios tenemos mayor capital de trabajo y sacamos a nuestros familias adelante.“
texts.en:
With her previous Kiva loan, Veronica felt very satisfied because she could buy energy products, refreshments and sportswear that she sold, going through her inventory quickly. She is applying for a new Kiva loan because she is preparing for the for vacations of adults, youth and children that will invade the gym to get themselves fit. 

For them, she will have sportswear and energy drinks available to recuperate the energy lost through healthy exercise. This entire investment will be fulfilled thanks to a new Kiva loan. Her message to the Kiva lenders is the following: "Many thanks because with people like you, many micro-entrepreneurs like myself have greater working capital and can move our families forward."

loans.use: to buy sportswear and energy drinks.

loans.name: Izolda

texts.en:
Izolda is 56 years old. She lives in a small village of Senaki District with her husband, Pausi, and two children (29 and 31 years old). The elder child is a seller in the village store and gets a monthly salary. The other family members are busy with agricultural activities. 

They have four milking cows and five calves. They produce cheese and sell it on the local open market. The family also owns a plot of land where nuts and maize are grown. They sell approximately 100 kg. of nuts in a year. 

Izolda requested a loan for purchasing nuts. She plans to purchase nuts from local farmers and sell them in the Senaki market and in nearby towns. Thus, the family will get additional income. 

With increased income, they plan to renovate the house because the existing one is very old and uncomfortable. Due to the above mentioned, the living conditions of the family will be improved and they will be able to spend their evenings after a hard working day in more comfortable environment.

loans.use: to purchase nuts to resell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
This is Vilma, 42, resident of Caloocan, Philippines, a mother to her children. Her husband is Ronnie, a maintenance personnel.  She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business.

Vilma sells eggs for living. She earns by getting eggs at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more stocks of eggs. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Vilma hopes her business would expand and grow through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to give her children a good and quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of supplies and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.en:
Genoveva is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with eight children. 

Genoveva buys and sells corn in their local community. She has had this business for 16 years. She requested a loan for 6,000 PHP to buy more stocks of corn to re-sell.

Genoveva has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Genoveva hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of corn to re-sell

loans.name: Nato

texts.en:
Nato is 45 years old. She lives in a small village of Senaki district with her family: her husband – Murad, her father-in-law and her 14-year-old nephew. Nato and Murad are busy with their agricultural business. They have milking cows, calves, pigs and horses. They produce dairy foods: cheese, curds and yogurt and sell them on the local open market. They also sell piglets. In addition, to cattle-breeding, Nato and Murad are busy with farming. They own 2 hectares of land, where maize is grown. Part of it is used for feeding the cattle and the rest is sold on the local open market. 

Nato requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and to repair the tractor. Nato and Murad will repair the tractor and will cultivate the land. They will work hard on their plot. After cultivation, fertilization and properly done seasonal agricultural work, they hope to get a larger and better quality harvest. They hope to sell harvested product for a good price. As a result of the above-mentioned activities, they will get additional income. With increased income they will be able to repair the house because the existing one is old and uncomfortable. Thus, Nato and Murad will be able to improve living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and repair her tractor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticide for her flower garden

loans.name: Nesiel

texts.en:
Nesiel is from Pangabuan, Tangub City. She is 38 years old. Nesiel is married and has four children. To make a living, she manages a business buying and selling fish. She has been in her business for 10 years and earns PHP 4,000 a month from these activities. 

In 2009, Nesiel joined GDMPC. Nesiel is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 which will be used to buy additional fish to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
This is Marilyn, 46, a resident of Manila, Philippines. Her husband is Charlie, a security guard, and she is a mother to her child.  She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business.

Marilyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 600 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory and also for the maintenance of her sewing machine. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Marilyn hopes her business will expand and grow into a mini-grocery through all her hard work. She also hopes to give her child a good and quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en: Rosalie, who is married and has a ready-to-wear business in the Philippines, works hard to support her family. Rosalie is borrowing PHP 4600 through NWTF to buy a solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses. She is also aware that the purchase will help the environment and reduce health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn. a 25-year-old married mother of one child, works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a general store in the Philippines for three years and also earns an income from raising pigs. Roselyn, who has previously borrowed and repaid six loans from NWT, is requesting a new one for PHP 14500 to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store.

Roselyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Connie

texts.en:
Connie is married and operates a fishing and fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years and works hard to support her family.

Connie is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy materials to maintain her fishing boat. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials to maintain her fishing boat

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is very proud of her nationality. She likes all Tajik traditions and customs. Since childhood, she has dreamt of sewing traditional Tajik dresses, so 15 years ago she began her own business. She sewed dresses, but she had a very difficult life so she stopped sewing and began to work on a collective farm. She didn’t like this work, however, and always dreamt about sewing. Now she has begun her sewing activity again. She sews very beautiful dresses in a new style. She has many satisfied customers.

Amina has a big family. Her husband went to a foreign country to look for work. Amina's daughter helps her in her business. She is a hard-working girl. Amina is asking for a loan to buy a new sewing machine to help expand her business. She awaits your help and support.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma, of Pangabuan, Tangub City, has been raising pigs for more than 10 years and earns 15,000 per month. She’s 45 years old now yet continues to hang on with her piggery to give adequate support to her three children. 

She has been a member of GDMPC since 2011. In order to improve the value of her livestock, she has borrowed 16,000 from GDMPC micro-credit to purchase feeding supplies. Gemma hopes that someday her children will be successful in their careers.

loans.use: to purchase feeding supplies for pigs.

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza is a married parent with two children. She runs a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Annaliza works hard to support her family. She has been sustaining her business with her past 15 loans through NWTF.

Annaliza is requesting a 27,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts to maintain her motorcycle transport business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to maintain her motorcycle

loans.name: Normelita

texts.en:
Normelita is 45 years old and is married with seven children. She lives in the Philippines. For the past six years, Normelita has operated a business making school and office uniforms. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2008

Normelita is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to buy to make school and office uniforms. In the future, she hopes to improve her business and provide for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy textiles to make school and office uniforms

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Myrna owns and operates an electric coconut grater in the public market. She has had this business for seven years. She requested a loan of 5,000 to buy tools for the maintenance of the grater and to pay for the electricity needed to run it.

Myrna has been a member of HSPFI since 2007. In the future, Myrna hopes to improve her business for the education of her grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy tools for the maintenance of her coconut grater.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
This is Rose, who has previously accessed a 16,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more quantities of ingredients such as meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, and seasonings for the food stall she operates. The profits from her loan were a big help to both provide for the education of her children as well as for her personal, household and business expenditures. 

Rose is requesting another loan of 18,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients and supplies she needs in her business. Her increased profits will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and provide for the educational expenses of her children. Rose looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. She hopes her business will expand and grow with all of her hard work. Rose also hopes to give her children a good and quality education. She faithfully meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and products for her food stall

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is married with five children. She is 45 years old, and resides at Baybay, Bonifacio, Philippines. Julieta owns & operates a business venture, selling seafood products including fish in the local community to earn a living and she's been 10 years in this business. Each month, she earns 4,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more fish. 

Julieta has been a member of GDMPC since 2009. In the future, Julieta wants to build house and to see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy more fish.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is 31 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

She has been running the general store for five years. Flordeliza has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this. 

Flordeliza aspires to save enough money so that she can send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a wood-crafting business in the Philippines.

Carmelita has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more wood for her business, which she has run for 10 years.

In the future, Carmelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more wood for her wood-crafting business.

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.en:
Lucrecia is 42 years old and single. For the past 15 years, she has run a general store in the Philippines and she also earns an income from fattening pigs. Lucrecia works hard to provide for her family and has borrowed and repaid 21 previous loans from NWTF. 

Lucrecia is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store. She aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell in her general store

loans.name: Umeda

texts.en: Umeda is a young and successful woman. This year she is married and lives happily with her husband, but their income isn’t enough for improving their living. Umeda has experience with animal husbandry and that’s why she decided to engage in animal husbandry. Her business is developing day-by-day because she works with pleasure and a lot. In business, Umeda helps her husband. They haven’t any children yet. Umeda is going to develop her business further and you are the only ones who can help her. She is asking for a loan to buy young cattle. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy young cattle

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a meat-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years. Helen earns more income from selling coconut dried meat.

She is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to purchase pigs and cows for her meat vending business. Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase a pig and a cow

loans.name: Nollie

texts.en:
Nollie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 30 years. Nollie earns more income from food vending.

She is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase materials for her tailoring business. Nollie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Rocela

texts.en:
Rocela is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a meat-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 14 years. Rocela earns more income from farming rice.

She is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional meat to sell for her meat-vending business. Rocela has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional meat to sell

loans.name: Marito

texts.en:
Marito is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with two children. 

Marito is providing pedicab services. He has had this business for six years. He requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy tools & for the maintenance of the pedicab.

Marito has been a member of HSPFI since 2006.  In the future, Marito hopes to improve his services for the education of his grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy tools for his pedicab

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza works hard to support three children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 4600 loan through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.

Esperanza is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Cora

texts.en:
Cora is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with eight children. 

Cora buys and sells corn in their local community. She has had this business for 11 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy more stocks of corn to re-sell.

Cora has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Cora hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of corn to re-sell

loans.name: Teodirica

texts.en:
Teodirica is 47 years old, married and has 7 children, 3 are in school.

Teodirica is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs. Teodirica has been raising pigs for 2 years now, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Teodirica would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children college.

loans.use: To buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Gulsifat

texts.en:
Gulsifat is very hardworking woman who lives among successful people and tries to be as successful as they. She has some experience and skill sewing women's national dress. Gulsifat makes very wonderful dresses and has many fashionable women as her customers. All of them are glad for her work. Gulsifat uses her business to help her daughter and her husband.

Gulsifat is requesting a loan to buy fabrics to help develop her business. You are the only people who can help her. Please, help her to develop her business.

loans.use: to buy fabric to develop her tailoring business

loans.name: Lyn

texts.en:
Lyn is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Lyn buys and sells corn snacks in their local community. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to buy more corn snacks to re-sell.

Lyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Lyn hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more corn snacks to re-sell

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 44 years old and married with seven children. For the past 11 years, she has been earning a living raising pigs in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from selling food. 

Arlene is requesting a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and vitamins

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 30 years old and married with three children. For the past 10 years, she has been operating a business selling dried fish in the Philippines. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Evelyn is requesting an 11,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell. In the future, she would like to save money for her family.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish to sell

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 35 years old and married with five children. She lives in the Philippines. For the past six years, she has been selling sweet corn in her local community. Elma has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.

Elma is requesting a 7,000 PHP loan to buy sweet corn to sell. In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy sweet corn to sell

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is from Barangay IV, Tangub City. She is 35 years old. Margie is married and has one child. To make a living, Margie owns and operates a specialized retail store where she sells daily-use products, such as shampoo, candies, biscuits, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Margie has been engaged in her business for five years and earns 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.

 In 2007, Margie joined GDMPC. Margie is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand product offering. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 47 years old and married with 8 children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Gloria is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Gloria has been raising pigs for eight years and also earns additional income as a frame maker and from selling juice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more raw ingredients used in making snacks

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is a resident of Kitale, Western Kenya and is married with four children, three of whom are still schooling. He has been in farming for 15 years and produces maize, beans and milk for the local market.

Vincent has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds. He says this will boost his farming income by diversifying his produce and maintaining production both on and off seasons. He adds he will use the income to uplift the living standards of his entire family.

Vincent says lack of capital has been his major limitation.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Cresilda

texts.en:
Cresilda is 29 years old and is single with three children. She lives in the Philippines. For the past six years, Cresilda has been selling sweet corn in her local community. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.

Cresilda is requesting a 7,000 PHP loan to buy more sweet corn to sell. In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy sweet corn to sell

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 56 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a direct sales business of plastic ware in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional plastic ware to sell.

Juanita has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the direct sales of plastic ware for 15 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Juanita aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional plastic ware to sell

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Margarita has been in this business for 41 years. She earns more income from raising livestock and charcoal retailing.

Margarita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Necita

texts.en:
Necita is a widow. She is 62 years old and lives in the Philippines. Necita is a farmer and she operates a flowering production and  she also raises livestock to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years and every month she earns 2,000 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer and feeding supplies. 

Necita has been a member of GDMPC since 2009. In the future, Necita hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and feeding supplies.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou works hard to support her family. Marilou is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her fishing business.

Marilou has been in this business for 37 years now. In the future, Marilou would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 46 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Nelly is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers for her business.

Nelly has been farming rice for six years and also earns additional income from her sari-sari (variety) store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To construct a zero grazing unit

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is 47 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Nena has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Nena aspires to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Norceta

texts.en:
Norceta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a furniture-making business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her furniture-making business.

Norceta has been in this business for 24 years. Norceta earns more income from her sari-sari (variety) store and from raising pigs.

Norceta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for her business

loans.name: Buenaventura

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Buenaventura; la socia continua dedicandose al negocio de compra y venta de ropa como chompas,polos,casacas entre otros,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio ,la socia vende de forma ambulatoria ella viaja a Quillabamba ,Chumbivilcas entre otros lugares ,la socia reparte su mercaderia a sus clientes que le solicitan,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando por su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de casacas y chompas para su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Buenaventura is continuing to run her business buying and selling clothing such as sweaters, t-shirts, jackets etc. She's had this business for many years and all is going well thanks to the great effort she makes on a daily basis. She sells her wares on the streets of Quillabamba, Chumbivilcas, and other places to customers who seek her out. Buenaventura is a responsible, hardworking person with a great desire to continue working for the sake of her family.

She is seeking a loan to buy jackets and sweaters for her business.

loans.use: To buy jackets and sweaters

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Felicitas; la socia continua con su negocio de venta de leche de vaca,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio ,a la vez continua con su negocio de compra y venta de productos secos como trigo,maiz entre otros,la socia vende sus productos en las ferias que se realizan los fienes de semana,la socia es una persona responsable con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando por su familia.


La socia solicita el credito para la compra de maiz al por mayor para su negocio.
texts.en: This is member Felicitas. She continues to sell cow's milk and has been in this business for years. Her business is going well thanks to the effort she puts into it every day. At the same time, she continues with her other business, buying and selling dried products, such as wheat, corn, and others. Member Felicitas sells her products at the markets that are set up on weekends. She is a responsible person and is very eager to keep working for her family. She is requesting the loan in order to purchase wholesale corn for her business.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale corn for her business.

loans.name: Mamadoudiawara Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de 28 femmes très actives dans ce banc villageois créé Mai 2010. Elles sont toutes issues du même quartier et ont une bonne entente entre elles. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Aïssatou (assise à l’extrême droite avec la main gauche levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe,  âgée de 56 ans, elle est veuve et mère de 09  enfants (4 Garçons et 5 filles).
Elle a une place au marché ou elle vend du poisson fumé et séché, elle a une expérience de 02 ans dans ce domaine.

Avec ce prêt elle compte s’approvisionner en poisson séché et fumé dans la petite côte.
-	Elle achète les 02 paniers de poisson fumé à 40 000F Cfa pour le revendre au détail à 70 000F Cfa
-	Elle achète aussi le panier du poisson séché à 10 000F Cfa pour le revendre au détail à 17 500F Cfa
-	Pour le transport et la manutention elle paie 5 000F Cfa
Chaque 15 jours après déduction de ses charges liées à son commerce et la dépense quotidienne elle se retrouve avec un bénéfice net de 25 000F Cfa en moyenne tous les 15  jours.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront d’épargner et  en vu d’acheter une maison pour ces enfants.
texts.en:
This group is made up of 28 women who are very active in the Banc Villageois, which was set up in May 2010. They all come from the same district and get on well together. Their principal activities are small trading businesses.

Aïssatou (sitting on the far right with her left hand raised) is the top borrower of the group. She is 56 years old, a widow and mother to nine children (four boys and five girls). She has a spot in the market where she sells smoked and dried fish, and she has two years' experience in this field.

With this loan, she is planning to get fresh supplies of dried and smoked fish in Petite-Côte. She is going to buy two baskets of smoked fish for 40,000FCFA and resell it on a retail basis for 70,000FCFA. She is also going to buy a basket of smoked fish for 10,000FCFA and resell it on a retail basis for 17,500FCFA. She pays 5,000FCFA for the transport and handling costs. Each fortnight after expenses related to her business and daily expenses have been deducted, she ends up with a net average profit of 25,000FCFA for the 15 day period. 

The profits she makes from her business enable her to save with a view to buying a house for her children.

loans.use: to get fresh supplies of dried and smoked fish in Petite-Côte

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Julio  de 19 años de edad vive al sur de la ciudad y empezó un negocio con su madre dese hace dos años en la ciudad de Cartagena y lo continuó en Barranquilla cuando regresaron a su tierra natal. Ellos tienen un restaurante donde se dedican principalmente a la venta de  desayunos y almuerzos,  sus principales clientes son vecinos del barrio y empleados de empresas cercanas litografías, fabricas entre otros. Su meta principal es estudiar la carrera de Ingeniería Electrónica y hacer más grande y próspero su negocio, que constituye el generador de sus ingresos personales y familiares. En la actualidad planea lograr compras en mayor volumen para disminuir gastos de transportes, precios competitivos comprando en volumen y efectividad  en el tiempo dedicado a las tareas que requiere el proceso productivo del negocio. Estas son las razones por las cuales acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará materias primas, como arroz, aceite, pastas, sal, azúcar, salsa y una nueva vajilla para  mejorar su servicio en la mesa y la posibilidad de atender un mayor número de clientes. Su credikiva proyecta tener éxito, porque su negocio tiene un potencial de crecimiento, evidenciado en sus indicadores financieros  que son ajustados a las características de este tipo de negocios, mostrando una rotación de cuentas por cobrar de 18 días, una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor del 18% , la cual que proyecta aumentar con esta nueva inversión.
texts.en: Julio, 19, lives on the south side of Barranquilla.  He and his mother started a restaurant in Cartagena two years ago and moved it to Barranquilla when they returned there.  They open the restaurant for breakfast and lunch.  Their main customers are people who live in the neighborhood or workers at the factories nearby.  Julio wants to study for a degree in Electronics.  He hopes that his business will grow and prosper because it is the main source of income for him and his family.  He plans to buy bulk supplies of the goods he needs for the restaurant so that he can save on transportation costs, lower his costs for the goods and save the time he has to spend buying what he needs for the restaurant.  He will use this Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo loan, with help from Kiva lenders, to buy what he needs--rice, cooking oil, pasta, salt, sugar, sauce and tableware--to operate his business and provide a better service.  The investment will help him grow the business.  Our analysis shows that he can cover the costs of his monthly payments with only 18 days of revenue and that his profit margin is 18% or more.  This loan will help him improve both measures.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his restaurant business.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORTY YUNGAQUI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maruja; la socia continua dedicandose al negocio de compra y venta de ganados, la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia compra y vende en las ferias de los dias viernes,a la vez la socia se dedica a la compra y venta de leña y a la elaboracio de mates naturales vendiendo de forma ambulatoria ,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando por su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de leña al por mayor.
texts.en:
Our member, Sra. Maruja, belongs to the SENOR DE CCOYLLORTY YUNGAQUI community bank in Anta, a district in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco.  

Sra. Maruja still makes her living buying and selling cattle.  She has operated the business for many years and it has prospered thanks to the effort that she has put in to building it.  She buys and sells the cattle at local markets.  She supplements her cattle business by buying and selling firewood and working as a street vendor, selling mate that she makes herself.  She is a responsible person, committed to working hard to support her family.

Sra. Maruja will use this loan to buy wholesale supplies of firewood for resale.

loans.use: to buy wholesale supplies of firewood for her retail business.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORTY YUNGAQUI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Concepcion; la socia continua con su negocio de compra y venta de chanchos, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia cria a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes y en las ferias de los fines de semana,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando por su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de chanchos para su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Concepcion is a member of the Señor de Ccoyllorty Yungaqui Community Bank which is located in Anta district, Anta province, in the department of Cusco.

Concepcion continues to run her business buying and selling pigs. She's had the business for many years and all is going well thanks to the effort she puts in on a daily basis. She raises the pigs and then sells them to customers at weekend markets.

Concepcion is a responsible, hardworking person with a great desire to continue working for the sake of her family. The loan money will be used to buy more pigs.

loans.use: Buy pigs for her business

loans.name: Damacio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORTY YUNGAQUI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Damacio;el socio continua dedicandose a la agricultura,el socio continua sembrando maiz,papa para luego venderlo a sus clientes que le solicitan y en las ferias de los fienes de semana ,el socio lleva años ejerciendo este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio,a la vez el socio continua trabajando en una empresa estatal, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.

El socio solicita el credito para la compra de semillas para su chacra.
texts.en:
This is member Damacio. He belongs to the communal bank Señor de Ccoyllorty Yungaqui. The bank is located in the district of Anta, whithin Anta province, in the department of Cusco.

Member Damacio continues to work in agriculture. He is still growing corn and potatoes so that he can later sell them to the customers who request them from him and at the markets on weekends. He has been in this business for years, and it is going well thanks to the effort he puts into it. At the same time, he also continues to work for a state company, which is how he provides for his family.

He is requesting the loan in order to purchase seeds for his farm.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for his farm.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
Don Marcos, tiene 39 años de edad, es casado, tiene 3 hijos, vive con ellos  y su esposa en el municipio de Santa Cruz de Yojoa.
Don Marcos siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, tiene 16 años de cultivar café, maíz, frijoles, hortalizas como ser: rábano, ayote, mostaza y pepinos. Esta producción la vende en el mercado local. El solicita 5,000.00 para comprar abono, fertilizantes, semillas y para darle mantenimiento a los cultivos para sacar buenas cosechas y aumentar las ventas en la próxima cosecha. Su objetivo es mejorar el cultivo para que se mejoren sus ingresos, para  darles el estudio a sus hijos y una buena calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marcos, age 39, is married and has three children.  He lives with his wife and children in the Santa Cruz de Yojoa municipality.

Marcos has always been a farmer.  For 16 years he has been growing coffee, corn, beans, and vegetables like radishes, squash, mustard greens, and cucumbers.  He sells this production at the local market.

He is requesting a loan for 5,000 lempiras to buy natural and chemical fertilizers and seeds.  He will also use the loan for crop maintenance in order to get good harvests and increase sales in the next harvest.

His objective is to improve his crops so that his income improves, to give his children an education, and to have a good quality of life

loans.use: to buy supplies like natural and chemical fertilizers and seeds.  He will also use the loan for crop maintenance

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Luisa;la socia continua con sus negocios de crianza de animales menores,elaboracion de chicha,compra y venta de maiz y cereales,la socia lleva buen tiempo en sus negocios el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia,la socia es una persona alegre y responsable con muchas ganas  de continuar adelante por su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de maiz al por mayor.
texts.en:
Sra. Luisa is continuing to run her businesses raising animals, making chicha, and buying and selling corn and cereals. She's had these businesses for a while now, and all is going well thanks to the effort she puts in on a daily basis. The income is used to help her family get ahead. Luisa is a cheerful, responsible person with a great desire to continue making progress for the sake of her family. 

The loan she is seeking will be used to buy corn at wholesale prices.

loans.use: Buy corn at wholesale prices

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LOS SOLIDARIOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia trabaja en una empresa donde realiza trabajos en artesania como pinturas,cuadros y collares,ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este trabajo la socia quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es terminar de construir su casa.La socia solicita el credito para comprar materiales de construccion como arena,cemento,yeso y clavos para que termine de construir su casa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank Los Solidarios. The bank is located in the district of Urubamba, within Urubamba province, in the department of Cusco.

She works for a company where she makes arts and crafts such as paintings, pictures, and necklaces. She works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm. She wants to be able to get ahead with this work, and her dream is to finish building her home. She is requesting the loan in order to purchase construction materials such as sand, cement, plaster, and nails, so that she can finish building her home. 

She is happy with the loan and committed to paying her installments.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as sand, cement, plaster, and nails, in order to finish building her home.

loans.name: Apresse Doumassou Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois d’APRESS est  Créé en   Juin 2009 le  jour de  son inauguration. Les femmes qui le composent sont très engagées dans le développement de leur organisation,  toutes issues du même quartier. Elles ont un esprit d’entre aide et de solidaire très remarquable.  Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Diènabou  (assise à extrême droite avec la main droite levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 39 ans, est mariée et mère de 04 enfants trois garçons et une fille, elle prend en charge son petit fils. Cela fait plus cinq qu’elle s’active dans la vente de tenues vestimentaires.

En vue de préparer la Korité, elle compte acheter 30 paires de chaussure à la capitale à 2 000 FCFA l’unité pour la revente à 4 000 FCFA.

Pour les bénéfices réalisés elle souhaite acquérir un terrain et en même temps améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
The Apress [group] has been created in June 2009, the day the local banc villageois  opened. The group’s members are women who all live in the same neighborhood and are very involved in developing their organization. They have a remarkable spirit of solidarity and mutual aid. They mainly work as vendors.

Mrs. Diènabou (seated on the far right raising her right hand) is the star borrower of the group. She is 39 years old, married and the mother of four (three boys and one girl). She takes her of her grandson. She has been selling clothing for over five years.
In order to prepare for Korité [the holiday that follows the fasting of Ramadan], she plans to buy 30 pairs of shoes at 2,000 West African francs a pair, in order to resell them at 4,000 francs.

With revenues from her business, she would like to purchase a land plot and at the same time improve the life conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy 30 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
La socia continua dedicandose al negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas,ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio cada dia ,la socia continua tambien con su negocio venta de granos y su tienda de abarrotes,siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia,la socia es una personba resposnable con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando por su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de cuyes para su negocio.
texts.en:
Our member, Sra. Alejandra, still makes her living raising and selling pigs, chickens and other farm animals.  She has operated the business for many years and it has prospered thanks to the effort that she has put in to building it. She supplements her farm animal business with a grain sales business and a small corner store, all of which provide an income that helps to support her family.. She is a responsible person, committed to working hard to get ahead.
 
Sra. Alejandra will use this loan to buy pigs for her animal sales business.

loans.use: La socia solicita el credito para la compra de cuyes para su negocio.

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.es:
El Sr. Asunción, tiene 52 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos con su pareja y vive en una aldea suburbana de San Pedro Sula.
Don Asunción siempre se ha dedicado a la venta de verduras, tiene 12 años de haber establecido su negocio en el mercado local, allí vende tomates, papas, chiles, zanahorias, cebollas, limones, yuca, lechuga, repollo etc. estas verduras y vegetales se las compra a los productores cercanos al por mayor y el las vende al detalle a otros vendedores minoristas. El negocio es rentable porque la rotación del producto es a diario. El está solicitando un préstamo por 7,000.00 Lempiras para comprar más producto para la venta y tener siempre que ofrecer a los clientes. Su meta es hacer crecer el negocio y llegar a trabajar con buena solvencia económica.
texts.en:
Asunción, age 52, and his life partner have four children.  He lives in a suburban village in San Pedro Sula.

Asunción has always sold vegetable.  He established his business at the local market 12 years ago.  He sells tomatoes, potatoes, hot peppers, carrots, onions, lime, yucca, lettuce, and cabbage.  He buys these vegetables wholesale from nearby producers.  He sells them retail to other retail sellers.  The business is profitable because the product rotation is daily.

He is requesting a loan for 7,000 lempiras to buy more products to sell and to always have product to offer his customers.  His goal is to make his business grow and to reach the point of working with good financial solvency.

loans.use: to buy fresh vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LOS SOLIDARIOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio trabaja en una empresa que vende artesania,el socio hace trabajos como chompas,guantes,mantas y trabajos en artesania,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante,el sueño del socio es mejorar en su trabajo.El socio solicita el credito para comprar materiales como arcilla y pinturas para que haga trabajos de artesanias.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the LOS SOLIDARIOS community bank in Urubamba, a district in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco.

He operates a crafts business, making and selling sweaters, gloves, blankets and other merchandise that he makes himself.  He works from 8:00 in the morning until 7:00 at night.  The business is his means of supporting himself and getting ahead in the world.  For the future, he wants to improve his business.  He is applying for a loan that he will use to buy clay, paint and other supplies for his crafts business.

Our member is grateful for your support and committed to repaying this loan in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his crafts business.

loans.name: Rosa Alicia

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora Rosa,  nuestra socia sigue dedicándose a la venta de comida en su pensión familiar, y es esta actividad la que le permite sacar adelante a su familia, por ello invertirá el préstamo solicitado para implementar su comercio y comprar utensilios e insumos para cocina y así capitalizar su comedor.
Rosa está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle mantenerse en su actividad y ayudarla a invertir en el mantenimiento de su casa.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Our member, Sra. Rosa, still makes her living making and selling prepared meals.  The business is her means of supporting herself and helping her family get ahead in the world.  She will use this loan to continue her business and to buy the supplies she needs to operate it.  
Rosa is very grateful to KIVA for investing in her business and helping her to support her family.
She is grateful for your loan and committed to repaying it in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to improve her café and buy supplies for her business.

loans.name: Mery Luz

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora Mery, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Sol Naciente” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú, nuestra socia sigue dedicándose a la compra y venta de productos de artesanía al por mayor, y es esta actividad la que le permite sacar adelante a su familia, por ello invertirá el préstamo solicitado para comprar mercadería y exportar sus productos a mercados extranjeros.
Mery está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle mantenerse en su actividad y apoyando a su familia.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
This member is Mery who belongs to the 'Sol Naciente' community bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.  She continues buying and selling handicrafts wholesale and this business allows her to provide for her family.  She will invest the loan she has requested in buying merchandise and exporting her products to foreign markets. 

Mery is very grateful to Kiva for helping her to remain in her business and support her family.  She is grateful for the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy handicrafts wholesale

loans.name: Julia Josefina

texts.es:
La socia trabaja en una empresa donde realiza trabajos de ceramica,ella realiza adornos,aretes y collares,ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia por medio de este trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es mejorar en su trabajo.La socia solicita el credito para uso personal para que compre un televisor para su casa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member works for a company where she does work with ceramics.  She makes decorations, earrings, and necklaces.  She works from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.  It is through this work that she gets her children ahead.  Her dream is to improve her work.

The member is requesting a loan for personal use.  She will buy a television for her house.

The member is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy a television for her house.

loans.name: Luz Dary

texts.es: Luz Dary de 47 años de edad es una mujer casada que vive al sur de la ciudad con su esposo y sus dos hijos en las edades de 18 y 21 años de edad. Su trabajo diario es comercializar bolsos, correas y calzado desde hace 15 años, época en la cual inició su negocio, para generar una alternativa de  un segundo ingreso familiar, con el cual aumentara cada vez más el bienestar de su hogar. Luz Dary vende diariamente y directamente bolsos y artículos de cuero a consumidores finales, en las modalidades de crédito principalmente, aunque también vende de manera ocasional de contado. Así mismo compra directamente a productores, de contado los artículos a sus clientes, quienes son  trabajadores de empresas que devengan un salario   con los cuales les ha ido muy bien, pues en los días de pago,  se acerca a ellos para lograr que su cartera tenga un cobro efectivo. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, séptimo crédito que recibe de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual ha logrado tener un capital de efectivo disponible, que aumentó sus posibilidades de comprar  mercancías,  con las cuales logró el aumentó en su volumen de ventas. Con su credikiva responderá a compromisos de pedidos adquiridos con sus clientes nuevos, que han sido referidos y con los cuales fortalecerá aun más su actividad, comprando calzado, bolsos, billeteras en mayor volumen. Su meta de trabajo y crecimiento de negocio, está fundamentada en la ilusión de lograr apoyar la finalización de los estudios universitarios de sus hijos y su mayor desafío es encontrar nuevos productores, que le faciliten  diversificar los diseños en el marco de la moda,  pues esto atrae clientela, conveniente para lograr sostenerse siempre en el mercado..
texts.en: Luz Dary is 47 years old.  She is a married woman who lives in the south of the city together with her husband and her two children who are 18 and 21 years old.  She has been selling bags, belts and footwear for 15 years since she started her business to make a second income for her family and improve the welfare of her household.  Luz Dary sells bags and leather goods every day direct to end consumers.  She mainly sells on credit although she also occasionally sells for cash.  She buys directly from manufacturers for cash.  Her customers are company workers who make a salary and so her business has done very well.  On pay days she goes to visit her customers in order to collect payment.  She is currently applying for a Kiva loan.  It is her seventh from  Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and previous loans have enabled her to have capital available.  This has increased her possibilities for buying merchandise and increased her sales volumes.  Luz Dary will use her Kiva loan to respond to orders that her new customers have promised to place with her.  These are customers who have been referred to her and who will help her to strengthen her business even further.  Luz Dary will buy footwear, bags and wallets in larger quantities.  She plans to grow her business as she hopes to support her children in finishing their university studies.  Her biggest challenge is finding new manufacturers so that she can diversify the fashionable designs she sells as this attracts customers.  It also helps her to stay in the market.

loans.use: to buy footwear, bags and wallets in larger quantities

loans.name: Jose Orlando

texts.es:
José, se dedica a la venta de productos farmacéuticos siendo dependiente de una farmacia, el administra este negocio en el centro de la ciudad, trabaja de lunes a sábado y aprendió la farmacia a través de un trabajo que anteriormente realizó, él tiene 30 años de edad tiene dos hijos quienes están estudiando primaria y vive también al lado de su esposa.

Solicita un préstamo para poderlo invertir en la compra de medicinas farmacéuticas en variedad, ya que necesita variar e incrementar algún otros productos en la farmacia ya sean vitaminas, antibióticos, que le permitan mejorar el servicio a sus clientes, esta compra ayudará a incrementar su inventario.

El objetivo de José es fortalecerse a través de los préstamos crecer en el negocio, ya que depende toda su familia de él, esto le permitirá tener los ingresos necesarios.
texts.en:
José sells pharmaceutical products as he is a pharmacy employee.  He manages this business in the center of the city.  He works Monday through Saturday.  He learned pharmacy work from a previous job he had.

He is 30 years old, and he has two children who are in elementary school.  He also lives with his wife.

He is requesting a loan to be able to buy a variety of pharmaceutical medicines.  He needs to vary and increase some of the other pharmacy products like vitamins and antibiotics.  This will allow him to improve customer service.  This purchase will help him increase his inventory.

José’s objective is to, through the loans, strengthen and grow in the business.  This is because his whole family is dependent upon him.  This will allow him to have the income he needs.

loans.use: to buy medicines like antibiotics and vitamins.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.es:
La socia Jovita continua dedicandose a su negocio de  compra y venta de granos como trigo, cebada, entre otros; a la ves la socia se dedica a la compra y venta de llantas y productos de ferreteria,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia es una persona responsable con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando por su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de trigo al por mayor.
texts.en:
Jovita continues with her business of buying and selling grains like wheat and barley, among others.  She also buys and sells tires and hardware products.  She has been in this business for a good amount of time.  It is going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day.  She is a responsible person with a great desire to continue working for her family.  

She is requesting the loan to buy wheat wholesale.

loans.use: to buy wheat wholesale.

loans.name: Soopousmanediallo Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de 28 femmes très actives dans ce banc villageois créé en Décembre 2009. Elles sont toutes issues du même quartier et ont une bonne entente. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Jacqueline (assise à l’extrême droite avec la main gauche), est l’emprunteur vedette du groupe,  âgée de 27 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 02 filles.

Elle prépare et vend le petit déjeuné dans son quartier, une activité qu’elle fait depuis plus 5 ans.
Avec ce prêt elle compte s’approvisionner en denrée au niveau des grossistes du marché central en vue d’éviter toute rupture de stock durant l’hivernage dans ses préparations.
Pour un mois elle a besoin de :
-	½ sac de sucre de 12 000F Cfa 
-	Un bidon de 20 litres d’huile à 14 500F 
-	Un carton d’aile de 5 kg à 2 700F 
-	Un sac d’oignon à 8 000F Cfa 
-	Deux kg de café à 4 000F Cfa
-	3 Tablettes d’œufs à 6 300F Cfa
-	05 kg d’haricot à 3 500F Cfa
-	Epices et transport à 4 000f

Apres chaque journée de vente elle déduit 3 000F Cfa pour le prêt et 2 500F pour sa dépense et autres frais elle se retrouve avec un bénéfice net journalier de 3 000F Cfa.
 
Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront d’épargner et de prendre en charge une partie de la dépense quotidienne et la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group is composed of 28 women who are very active in their banc villageois created in December 2009. They are all from the same neighborhood and have a good rapport. They mainly work as vendors.

Mrs. Jacqueline (seated on the far right [raising] her left hand) is the star borrower of the group. She is 27 years old, married and the mother of two girls.
