She cooks breakfast dishes for sale in her neighborhood. She has been in this line of business for over five years. With this loan she will stock up on staple foods from wholesalers at the central market, in order to avoid any stock shortages during the winter season.
For one month, she needs the following:
--half a bag of sugar at 12,000 West African francs
--a 20-liter [about 5 gallon] jug of vegetable oil at 14,500 francs
--a 5-kg [11 lbs] box of garlic at 2,7000 francs
--a bag of onions at 8,000 francs
--two kilograms [about five pounds] of coffee at 4,000 francs
--three trays of eggs at 6,300 francs
--half a kilo [about one pound] of beans at 500 francs
--spices and transportation costs at 4,000 francs

After each day of sales, she deducts 3,000 francs to repay the loan and 2,500 francs for her expenses and other charges, and is left with a net daily revenue of some 3,000 francs. The revenues from her business will allow her to grow her savings and to provide for part of the everyday family expenses and her children’s education.

loans.use: to stock up on staple foods from wholesalers.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 24 years old and married. She resides in Kapalaran, Tambulig, Philippines.

Janeth own and operates farm land. She plants and harvests rice as well as bananas and vegetables for a living and has been in this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns 8,000 PHP doing this type of business. 

Janeth requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and seedlings. In 2010, Janeth joined GDMPC. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 60 years old and married with four children.

Perlita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Perlita has taken out and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 18 years and also earns an income from retail rice sales.

Perlita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to resell.

loans.name: Dadojon

texts.en:
Dadojon is very kind, cute, and successful. He has a lovely wife and 3 children. Dadojon is a man with good business skills. He began his own business in animal husbandry 8 years ago. 

From childhood he liked animals very much and that’s why he chose this kind of business. Dadojon has many customers in the local market. He wants to develop his business, so he is asking for a loan to buy cattle. He is waiting for your help and mercy.

loans.use: to buy cattle for developing business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of corn and bananas to re-sell.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 29 years old. She is married and has three children. Maricel lives in Kapalaran, Tambulig, Philippines. 

Maricel owns and operates farm land. She plants and harvests rice for sale to earn a living and has been in this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns 6,000 PHP doing this type of business. 

Maricel requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next cropping. In 2011, Maricel joined GDMPC. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next cropping.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is 24 years old and is married with one child. She operates a beauty salon to earn a living. She has been in this business for 4 years and employs two people in her business. Besides the salon, she also operates a butcher shop to make extra income.

Dorcas has learned how to save through Faulu Kenya because she has been trained on financial management. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

Dorcas is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy hair braids and oil.

loans.use: to buy hair braids and hair oil.

loans.name: Linus

texts.en:
Linus is a farmer in Nkubu, Central Kenya, and is married with two children aged four and two years. He lives with his family in their rural home, where he operates his farm and sells his produce of maize, beans and milk at the local market. He runs his farm with the help of one farmhand.

Linus has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a water tank and water pipes in order to install an irrigation system on his farm. He says this will enable him to improve his farming, which is always curtailed by shortage of rain, and to help him feed his dairy animals, too.

Linus says sourcing of funds to do more commercial farming has been a real challenge, but is looking better with the availability of farming loans for small holder farmers.

loans.use: to buy a water tank and water pipes for irrigation.

loans.name: Kamu Kamu Tereka Bwowola Group

texts.en:
The group started as a Rosca (Savings and rotating Credit group), but with time their own savings were limited so they opted for the Ugafode loan because it was accessible and affordable.

Jane, a single mother of six children, has a grocery shop in a trading centre within the outskirts of Lyantonde town. The small loans from Ugafode have helped her to meet the needs of her children and also to acquire small assets like goats and home appliances.

Jane is grateful to Ugafode because the loans have improved her standard of living and she has gained leadership skills as the group chairperson. She is very hardworking and honest.

loans.use: To buy vegetables for sale

loans.name: Tweyambe Development Group-Kabowa

texts.en:
The group was started by mainly vendors so that they could up lift each other to developmnnt. The members are grateful because they think UGAFODE loans will help them achieve their dreams.

Scovia is a 28-year-old married woman with three children aged between 3 and 5 years. She sells soft drinks in the outskirts of Kampala town. She works all the days of the week so that she can break even. She sells mainly to vendors and people within the market. Scovia's main challenge is stiff competition from the vendors. She wants UGX 300,000 to buy soda, juice and fruits. She works very hard and is shrewd in order to beat the competion. Her dream is to become successful in business and build a house for her family.

Vincent, aged 23 also a member of the group who rides a motorcycle ("boda boda") wants the loan to pay school fees for his brother.

loans.use: To buy soda, juice and fruits for making juice

loans.name: John Bosco

texts.en:
John Bosco is one of Ugafode's good clients, who works in the photo printing business and transport (boda-boda). This is his fourth cycle and has been graduating gradually. He has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 shillings for a period of six months to buy a photo printer to expand his business. The biggest part of his income is earned from taking and developing photos of students and other members of the community, and he supplements his income with his boda-boda business.

Through the business he has been able to build a house for his family and is sending his children to average schools. He hopes to buy equipment for video coverage using the next loan. John is very hard working.

loans.use: To buy a photo printer

loans.name: Saulo

texts.en: Saulo is an old client of Ugafode microfinance ltd dealing in farming. He applied for a loan of 1,500,000 shillings to improve his banana plantation. Saolo has been in this business for the last eigtht years and due to this he has been able to buy a bigger piece of land where he is planning to plant a new banana plantation for commercial purposes. Saulo wants to buy mulches and fertilisers to improve his yields. By doing so Saulo hopes to double his sales in the next two years. He describes himself as a hardworking and ambitious man and this can be evidenced by his achievements. Saulo works for six days in aweek that is to say from Monday to Saturday. However, he complains of challenges of price fluctuations, lack of good storage facilities, poor means of transport but he is optimistic that one day all these one day will be solved and  he becomes the largest supplier of bannanas in the whole of Kyotera. His customers are schools, hospitals and individuls within Kyotera and the neighbouring areas.

loans.use: To improve his banana plantantion

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.  Charito requested a PHP 26000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other equipment.  She has been in this business for seven years.

In the future, Charito would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to make bread and pastries.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose, who sells fruits and vegetables for a living, also sells clothes to make extra money. Her previous loan of 40,000 KES from Faulu Kenya helped her to buy vegetables, tomatoes and Irish potatoes for her business, and she is now requesting a new loan for 80,000 KES to buy more vegetables, potatoes, fruits and clothes to sell.

Through the training conducted by Faulu Kenya in business management skills, Rose has been able to more effectively conduct her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, potatoes, fruits and clothes.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is 59 years old and widowed with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Eden has a fishing business in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 29000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Eden has been in this business for eight years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Soopousmanediallo Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de 24 femmes très actives dans ce banc villageois créé Décembre 2009. Elles sont toutes issues du même quartier et ont une bonne entente entre elles. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Ousmane (assise à l’extrême droite dans la photo), est l’emprunteuse vedette  du groupe,  âgée de 44 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 03  enfants (2 Garçons et 1 fille).
Elle a une place au marché ou elle vend des fruits et des œufs, elle a une expérience de 06 ans dans ce domaine.

Avec ce prêt elle compte s’approvisionner en fruits dans les vergers et plantations et vendre en gros aux détaillants du marché central de Kolda.
-Elle achète 800 kg de banane à 96 000F Cfa pour le revendre en détail à 215F Cfa le kg soit 172 000F Cfa
-Elle achète aussi les 25 paniers de mangue à 2 000f Cfa/U soit à 50 000f Cfa pour les revendre à 2 800F Cfa soit à 70 000F Cfa
-Elle paie aussi des frais de transport et de manutention à 14 000F Cfa
Chaque semaine après déduction de ses charges liées à son commerce et la dépense quotidienne elle se retrouve avec un bénéfice net hebdomadaire de 30 000F Cfa en moyenne.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront d’épargner et  en vu d’acheter une maison pour ces enfants.
texts.en:
This group consists of 24 women who play an active role in this Banc Villageois, which was created in December 2009. The group members all live in the same neighborhood and get along nicely. Their main activity is small trade. 

Mrs. Ousmane (sitting at the far right in the photo) is the featured borrower. Age 44, she is a married mother of three children, two boys and a girl. She has a stall at the market where she sells fruits and eggs. She has six years of experience in this activity. 

She will use this loan to buy fruits from orchards and plantations to sell wholesale to the retailers of the central market of Kolda. She will buy 800 kg of bananas for 96,000F CFA to sell for 215F CFA per kilo, for a total of 172,000F CFA, and 25 baskets of mangos at 2,000F CFA per unit totaling 50,000F CFA to sell for 2,800F CFA each for a total of 70,000F CFA. She will also pay the transportation and handling costs of 14,000F CFA.

Each week, after deducting business expenditures and daily expenses, she earns an average net profit of 30,000F CFA. 

The profits earned through her activity will help her to save to buy a house for her children.

loans.use: to buy fruits from orchards and plantations to sell wholesale to the retailers at the central market of Kolda.

loans.name: Nory

texts.en:
Nory is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a sea-shells retail business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to buy more sea-shells to sell.

NWTF is relisting Nory's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more sea-shells to sell.

loans.name: Lisa

texts.en:
For 20 years in New Village, Tambulig, Lisa, a 46-year-old married mother of 3 children, has made a living through the operation of a general store selling a variety of food and home-use products. She earns 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.
In 2009, Lisa joined GDMPC. She is now requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps etc. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps etc.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is 38 years old, married and with one child. He sells charcoal to make a living in a busy environment with readily available customers. He has been in the business since the year 2008. He had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped him to grow his business. He has also learnt the benefits of saving because he has been trained on financial management. He dreams of buying a pick-up for easy transportation of his supplies. He needs a loan of 60,000 KES to buy 50 bags of charcoal.

loans.use: To buy 50 bags of charcoal

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 32 years old and married with 2 children.

Rosalie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like snack foods, noodles, sardines and other miscellaneous items.

Rosalie has been in this business for 15 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Rosalie aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like snack foods, noodles, sardines and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Bernade

texts.en:
Bernade is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 1 child. 
Bernade is providing motorela or motorcycle services. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for 5,000 to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services.
Bernade has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future,Bernade hopes to improve his services for the education of his child.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline

loans.name: Nuridin

texts.en: Nuridin is a clever man with high degree. He is a doctor and has good skills as a doctor. He likes his profession very much but his income doesn’t enough for improving his living. That’s why 17 years ago he began own business deal. He is busy with growing of potatoes and wheat. Also he has additional income from animal husbandry. He has a big and friendly family. His wife and children help him in business. He wants to develop business but his income doesn’t enough for it. He is asking a loan to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. He waits your help and support.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is 39 years old, married and with three children who are in school. He operates a grocery store to earn a living. He has been in the business for six years and has employed one person in his business. He had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped him to educate his children. He has also learnt how to save because he has been trained on financial management. He dreams of expanding his business and start making supplies in the future. He needs a loan of 30,000 KES to buy tomatoes, cabbages and kale.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, cabbages and kales

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora Rosmery, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Sol Naciente” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú, nuestra socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de Fotocopias, y trabajos en computadora, y es esta actividad la que le permite sacar adelante a su familia, por ello invertirá el préstamo solicitado para comprar repuestos y suministros de computo como tóner y papelería en general.
Rosmery está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle mantenerse en su actividad y apoyando a su familia.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Our member is Rosmery; she belongs to the Sol Naciente Communal Bank from the city of Cusco, Peru.  Our member is still pursuing her photocopy and computer business and this is the business that allows her to get her family ahead.  That is why she will invest the loan she requested in computer parts and supplies, such as toner and general paper goods.

Rosmery is very thankful to Kiva for allowing her to keep up her business and for supporting her family.

This member is thankful for her loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy paper goods and supplies

loans.name: Norberta

texts.es:
La socia Norberta sigue dedicandose a la ganaderia,la socia cria a sus ganados para luego venderlo a sus clientes que le solicitan,la socia continua tambien dedicandose a la venta de leche ,siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de alimento para sus vacas como alfalfa y cebada.
texts.en:
Our member Norberta still works in livestock.   She raises her livestock to later sell them to her customers, who order from her.  This member also continues to sell milk for a living, which is how she gets her family ahead. 

She is asking for this loan to buy feed for her cows, such as alfalfa and barley.

loans.use: to buy feed for her cows, such as alfalfa and barley

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Onesmus

texts.en: Onesmus is 31 years old, married and has three children who are in school. He operates a retail shop for a living and has been in the business since the year 2006. Besides, he also does farming to generate extra income. He had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped him to grow his business. He has also learnt how to save because he has been trained on financial management. He dreams of owning a wholesale business in the future. He needs a loan of 50,000 KES to buy sugar, soft drinks, maize flour and rice.

loans.use: To buy sugar, soft drinks, maize flour and rice

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is 25 years old and married with 1 kid.

Jonalyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like soap, sugar, cooking oil and other miscellaneous items.

Jonalyn has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Jonalyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like soap, sugar, cooking oil and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Johna

texts.en:
Johna is 48 years old and married with 6 children.

Johna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a General store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

Johna has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the General store for 5 years and also earns an income from frozen foods and E-loading.

Johna aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en: Dennis is a hardworking 23 year old businessman. He operates a mobile business where he sells doughnuts and scones for a living. He has been in the business for three years and has two employees. Through Faulu Kenya, he has known how to keep his business records and how to save because he has been trained on financial management. He dreams of making supplies in different locations and opening another outlet in a different location. He needs a loan of 20,000 KES to buy cooking oil, wheat flour and sugar.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, wheat flour and sugar

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina is 49 years old and married with 3 children. Merlina works very hard to provide for them.

Merlina runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy more grocery products to sell.

Merlina has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, egg, cooking oil, sardines and other groceries. 

In the future Merlina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products to sell.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok, aged 28, is married and has three children. She works in a garment factory in a suburb area of Phnom Penh. Sewing clothes is her daily tasks that she needs to complete at a limit on the amount of clothes required by her employees. Occasionally she works overtime to get finished on time and also to obtain extra bonus. Her husband works in various chores in this factory. Sok has known her husband ever since she started working there.

Sok is now asking for a loan from HKL, a longstanding Kiva partner, to purchase construction supplies to get her house repaired such as timbers, wallboard, floorboards, and other needed materials. Sok hopes have a suitable house and experience good living conditions. Sok plans to provide her children a further education, so they might become professional someday.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies to get her house repaired.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food stall business in the Philippines.

Margie requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy more ingredients and sea-foods to sell in her food stall.

She has been in this business for 12 years.

In the future, Margie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients and seafoods to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Wakati

texts.en:
Married to a primary school teacher, Wakati is 40 years old and has six children. For the past three years she has been selling omena (small dry fish) as well as kerosene to increase her income. She learned these skills while she was helping her sister, who has a similar business, eventually going into business for herself after saving up some capital. She buys her ingredients from one of the busy area markets.

Wakati is seeking this loan to purchase a gallon of kerosene and a stock of dry fish. She wants to increase her stock in order to attract more customers and earn greater income. Her underlying goal is to be able to provide her children with everything they need.

loans.use: to purchase a gallon of kerosene and a stock of dry fish.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is a hardworking 55-year-old businesswoman. She operates a grocery store to earn a living. She has been in the business for five years and has one employee. She also depends on her husband's salary. Since becoming a client of Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to save because she has been trained in financial management. She dreams of building rental houses in the future. She needs a loan of 10,000 KES to buy vegetables for resale.

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Rafaela Antonia

texts.es:
Rafaela, vive con sus cuatro hijos, realiza las actividades agrícolas cultivando maíz junto a sus hijos, ella aprendió el proceso de sus padres cuando era joven, hoy en día lo realiza con el apoyo de su familia ya que esto le permite tener los granos básicos para la alimentación.

Ella necesita comprarse el abono, herbicidas, pago de mano de obra, para poder realizar el proceso de la siembra, para esto necesita un préstamo que le cubra el gasto necesario y poder realizar el trabajo de una buena manera, con la oportunidad de a futuro tener una mayor producción de granos básicos.
La aspiración de Rafaela es mejorar la economía en su familia, aumentar la producción en sus cultivos ya que esto le permitirá también poder tener los recursos necesarios para su familia.
texts.en:
Rafaela lives with her four children.  She works in agriculture for a living, growing corn with her children.  She learned the process from her parents when she was young.  Nowadays she does it with the help of her family, as this allows her to have staple grains for food.

She needs to buy fertilizer and herbicides, and to pay for labor to carry out her planting.  In order to do this, she needs a loan that will cover her necessary expenses in order to get the work done well and have the opportunity to have a greater yield of staple grains.

Rafaela aspires to improve her family's finances and increase the yield from her crops, as this will allow her to have resources she needs for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides and to pay for labor.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James charges batteries and also sells car batteries for a living. He had previously acquired a loan of 15,000 KES from Faulu Kenya which helped him to expand his business. He has also learnt how to manage his business because he has been trained on business management. He hopes to open another outlet in the future. He needs a loan of 35,000 KES to buy more batteries.

loans.use: To buy batteries.

loans.name: Jahanne

texts.en:
Jahanne is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 
Jahanne is an employee of HSPFI Balingasag branch she and her husband are buying and selling motor parts. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 to buy some motor parts to re sell.
Jahanne is a new member of HSPFI.In the future, Jahanne hopes to improve her business for the education of her child.

loans.use: to purchase motor parts to resell

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina works hard to support 5 children. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Marcelina requested a PHP 1800 loan through NWTF to buy an ENVIROFIT COOKSTOVE.

She is getting the envirofit cookstove because she wants to make the firewood that she buys last longer because the Envirofit stove needs less fuel to cook food.

Marcelina is aware that by using the envirofit cookstove, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for her business

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 39 years old and married with 3 children.  With 2 children in school, Jocelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future Jocelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica works hard to support her family. Veronica is widowed and has a selling of dried coconut meat business in the Philippines.

Veronica is borrowing PHP 1800 through NWTF to buy an ENVIROFIT COOKSTOVE.

She is getting the envirofit cookstove because she wants to lessen the amount of firewood that she uses when cooking food for her family.

Veronica is aware that by using the envirofit cookstove, she is saving money, she helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To purchase of envirofit cookstove

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna works hard to support her family. She is married and has a vegetable retail business in the Philippines.

Edna has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of vegetables to sell.

Edna has been in this business for three years now, and earns additional income from food sales.

In the future, Edna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is aged 42 and married, with seven children; the eldest is 16 years old and the youngest less than two years. He has been farming for 12 years in his rural home area. His farm produce currently includes milk, tea, coffee, maize, and pigs.

Christopher has made a loan request of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry for a venture into a poultry farm. He aspires to expand his pig farming as well, and believes the loan will have a great impact on his family.

Christopher says the poor road network and undeveloped local markets in the area are the biggest impediments to his farming business.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
This is Josephine, 47, resident of Caloocan, Philippines. Her husband is Rodrigo, a vendor, and she is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Josephine operates a buy and sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers, sell them with a little profit. Her products are men and women’s clothes and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offered. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy RTW products and merchandise items to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Josephine hopes to be able to expand her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of supplies and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 36 years old and widowed with 2 children who are in school, Mary Ann works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Ann runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her general store.

Mary Ann has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, soap, milk, sugar, spices, etc.. 

In the future Mary Ann would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 46 years old and married with 3 children. With one child in school, Mercedita works very hard to provide for them.

Mercedita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Mercedita has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, soap, bread, canned goods, etc.. 

In the future Mercedita would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Kassim

texts.en:
Kassim is from Samburu, Kenya. He lives with his wife and three kids. He operates a food stall and for more than eight years has also been doing farming.

He is a very hardworking person who always strives to give to his family supporting them in everything they need. His dream is to give the best to her family and better education to his children.

He’s asking for the loan to stock his food stall and also to do some improvements because his locale needs some fixing up. He thanks Kiva and Yehu Microfinance for the opportunity he’s getting.

loans.use: to buy supplies and to make improvements to his food stall.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El comité lleva por nombre “Maria Auxiliadora”, don de las miembros  agradecen la oportunidad que le brinda la Fundación  Paraguaya,  ya que las mismas tendrán nuevas oportunidades para emprender un mejor trabajo, colaborando con los ingreso de su hogar y ser más independientes.
Maria es una de las miembros y también es la presidenta, es una mujer que se destaca por el gran espíritu de liderazgo y compañerismo que tiene, gracias al incentivo que da a sus compañera es que están saliendo adelante. Maria se dedica a la confección de prendas, con lo cual ayuda a su familia y les da lo que necesitan para no pasar por necesidad.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, ya que quiere poder seguir trabajando y cumpliendo con el pedido de sus clientes. Agradece por la ayuda que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
The committee has taken the name "Maria Auxiliadora" (Maria of Succor) in recognition of the committee members' gratitude for the opportunity that the Fundación Paraguaya is providing them. With the support of the Fundación, they will have new opportunities to undertake better work, to contribute to their family income, and to be more independent. 

Maria is one of the committee members and also its president. She stands out for her great spirit of leadership and her sense of comradeship. Thanks to her encouragement, her fellow members are making great strides. Maria makes her living sewing garments. With her profits, she supports her family and gives them what they need in order not to live in necessity.

She is requesting this loan in order to buy fabric, since she wants to be able to continue working and meeting her clients' requests. She is grateful for the support that she is receiving.

loans.use:
Comprar telas.
to buy fabrics

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es:
El comité  “El Progreso, se conformo con la iniciativa de la señora  Miguela, todas ellas son de la ciudad de Curuguaty. Actualmente se encuentran  en el tercer ciclo, con diez  integrantes, donde todas ellas trabajan dentro de un marco de ayuda y respeto.
Miguela es la presidenta del grupo, y cuenta que ellas con mucho sacrificio están pudiendo salir adelante y desean crecer por medio de su trabajo. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropas de segunda mano, en lo que le va muy bien porque tiene buena clientela porque sus ventas han aumentado mucho.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de segunda mano, con lo cual podrá seguir trabajando y ofreciendo variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The El Progreso Communal Bank was formed through Miguela's initiative.  All of the women are from the city of Curuguaty.  They are currently in their third loan cycle with ten members, all of whom work in an atmosphere of help and respect.

Miguela is the president of the bank and she tells us that all the members are getting ahead through great effort and that they all want to grow through their work.  She sells secondhand clothing for a living, which goes very well for her because she has a good clientele and because her sales have increased greatly.

She is asking for this loan to buy secondhand clothing, with which she will be able to keep working and offering her customers variety.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothing

loans.name: Alicia Enida

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora Alicia, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Sol Naciente” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú, nuestra socia sigue dedicándose al comercio de artesanías, y es esta actividad la que le permite sacar adelante a su familia, por ello invertirá el préstamo solicitado para comprar joyas de oro y plata.
Alicia está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle mantenerse en su actividad y apoyando a su familia.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Our member is Alicia.  She belongs to the Sol Naciente Communal Bank from the city of Cusco, Peru.  She is still making craftwork for a living and this business allows her to get her family ahead.  That is why she will invest the loan she is requesting in gold and silver jewelry.

Alicia is very thankful to Kiva for allowing her to keep up her business and support her family.

She is thankful for the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her craftwork business, such as jewelry

loans.name: Octavia

texts.es: La socia Octavia sigue dedicandose a la ganderia y brindando servicio de transporte interprovincial siendo su pareja quien maneja su carro,la socia es una persona responsable con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando por su familia,la socia desea el credito para la compra de llantas para su auto.
texts.en: Octavia's business is still cattle farming and providing inter-provinces transportation services. It is her partner who drives the car. Octavia is a responsible person who is very willing to continue working for her family. She wants the loan to buy tires for her car.

loans.use: to buy tires for her car

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is 73 years old and married, with eight children.

Marietta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Marietta has made and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from food sales.

Marietta aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is 43 years old, married and has two children. He is a hardworking newspaper vendor and has two employees. He has been in the business since the year 2000. Since he became a client of Faulu Kenya, he has learnt how to save because he has been trained on financial management. Since he does not have a permanent shop for his business, he dreams of owning a wholesale business and sell his newspapers. He needs a loan of 20,000 KES to construct a shop for his business.

loans.use: To construct  a shop

loans.name: Ermitaña

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora Ermitaña, ella sigue en el negocio de de comercialización de productos derivados de lácteos como helados, yogurt, y es esta actividad la que le permite sacar adelante a su familia, por ello invertirá el préstamo solicitado para comprar insumos como cultivos  para su actividad transformadora.
Ermitaña está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle mantenerse en su actividad y apoyando a su familia.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Ermitaña continues with her business of selling dairy products such as ice cream and yogurt. This business has enabled her to carry her family forward. She will use the requested loan to buy supplies such as cultures for her transforming process..

Ermitaña is very grateful to Kiva for permitting her to maintain her business and continue supporting her family.

She is grateful for the loan and promises to comply with the payment of her debts according to the agreed-on payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make ice cream and yogurt

loans.name: Darwin Milton

texts.es:
Darwin, atiende un taller de estructuras metálicas, el cual inició desde muy joven, lo tiene instalado en su vivienda y no tiene un horario establecido para atender las necesidades de sus clientes, él vive con su esposa y dos hijos, solamente sus hijos dependen de sus ingresos económicos.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de material para el taller como el hierro, láminas, electrodos, que son los que le permiten realizar sus actividades en la elaboración de balcones, puertas y ventanas, esta compra le permitirá crecer y tener a su alcance todo lo necesario para poder trabajar.

El objetivo de él es a futuro poder a través del buen funcionamiento del negocio adquirir su propia casa, ya que esto le ayudará a vivir con su familia y generar una mejor condicion familiar, además de querer ganar también mayor número de clientes para hacer más productivo el taller.
texts.en:
Darwin runs a metal shop that he started when he was very young.  It is set up in his home and it does not have a set schedule in order to see to his customers' needs.  He lives with his wife and two children.  Only his children depend on his income.

He is asking for this loan to buy material for his shop, such as iron, sheet metal, and electrodes, which are what allow him to do his work making balconies, doors, and windows.  This purchase will allow him to grow and have everything he needs to do his work at hand.

His goal is to be able to get a home of his own through his business's success, as this will help him live with his family and create a better home life.  He also wants to win a greater number of customers to make his shop more productive.

loans.use: to buy iron, sheet metal, and electrodes.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en: Ludmila is a very beautiful woman with a kind nature. She likes to work in the garden after her workday. She has worked in a factory for more than 26 years. She is one of the best workers. Her colleagues know her as kind, glorious and clever. She has two smart daughters. She is bringing them up alone because she is a widow. Her house is in bad condition and Ludmila has begun building a new house, but her salary is so small and she can’t continue building the new house. She is asking for a loan to buy building materials. She and her daughters are waiting for your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice operates a laundry business to earn a living. She had previously acquired a loan of KES 20,000 from Faulu Kenya that helped her to buy a washing machine for her business. She has also been able to improve her business because she has been trained in business management. 

She dreams of expanding her business in the future. She needs a loan of KES 50,000 to buy another washing machine.

loans.use: To buy a washing machine for her laundry business.

loans.name: Noemy

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS SOLIDARIOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia trabja como profesora del nivel primario,la socia trabaja en un colegio en el distrito de Urubamba,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m,por medio de este trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es mejorar en su trabajo.La socia solicita el credito para pagar los estudios de sus hijos que estan en el colegio.

  La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "Los Solidarios," (In Solidarity). The bank is located in the Urubamba district of Peru, in the Urubamba province and Cuzco department.

She works as a primary school teacher in a school in the district of Urubamba. She works from 8:00 am to 4:00 pm. Through her work, she has been able to get her children ahead. Her dream is to improve in her work. She requests the loan in order to pay for her children's studies, both of whom are in high school.

She is happy for the loan and she promises to comply with the payment of her debts.

loans.use: to pay for her children's studies in high school

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
Reina, es comerciante de ropa, esto lo inició por la necesidad de recibir ingresos para su familia siendo iniciativa propia, trabaja de forma ambulante, no se ha establecido un horario para sus ventas ya que depende de la demanda, vive con su esposo y dos hijos, todos trabajan en la familia para poder solventar las necesidades en el hogar.

Solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de ropa en variedad como blusas y faldas, ropa interior, pantalones, ropa para caballeros y para damas, con esto se dispondrá a tener mayor mercadería para salir a vender a la ciudad, el crédito le ayudara con los recursos económicos, para que ella pueda realizar la inversión que sean necesarias en el negocio.

El objetivo de  Reina es crecer en el negocio a través de los préstamos, aumentar su clientela ya que esto le dará una mejor condición frente a su familia.
texts.en: Reina sells clothes. She started this activity out of necessity to get an income for her family; it was an initiative of her own. She works as a mobile vendor; she doesn't have a fixed schedule for the sales, since it depends on the demand. She lives with her husband and two children, they all work to be able to meet the home's needs. She requests a loan to invest it in the purchase of a variety of clothes such as, blouses and skirts, underwear, pants, gentlemen's and ladies' clothes. Thanks to this, she will have more merchandise to go out and sell it in the city. The loan will help her with the financial resources she needs to be able to make the investment the business needs. Reina's objective is to grow her business through loans and increase her customer base, since this will put her family in a better position.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, underwear and pants

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora Sonia, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Sol Naciente” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú, nuestra socia trabaja sirviendo en un hotel, y es esta actividad la que le permite sacar adelante a su familia y pagar sus estudios universitarios de turismo, Sonia invertirá el préstamo solicitado para pagar algunas deudas adquiridas anteriormente e invertirá en su educación, ya que está a punto de graduarse de la universidad.
Sonia está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle mantenerse en su actividad y apoyando a su familia.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
This is our member, Sonia.  She belongs to the Sol Naciente Communal Bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.  She works in a hotel and this is the job that allows her to get her family ahead and to pay for her university education in tourism.  Sonia will use the loan she is requesting to pay off some debt she accrued in the past and to invest in her education, as she is about to graduate from her university.

Sonia is very thankful to Kiva for allowing her to keep working and support her family.

She is thankful for the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to pay off preexisting debt

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS SOLIDARIOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia trabaja en una empresa donde vende artesanias,la socia hace trabajos de artesanias como joyas,mantas y ceramicas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender artesania.La socia solicita el credito para comprar un equipo de sonido para su casa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Los Solidarios Communal Bank.  This bank is located in the district of Urubamba, which belongs to the province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.

She works at a business that sells craftwork.  She does her own craftwork, making things such as jewels, blankets, and ceramics.  She works from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  Through this business, this member gets her children ahead.  Her dream is to have a place of her own where she can sell craftwork.  She is asking for this loan to buy a sound system for her home.

She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy a sound system for her home

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 40-year-old married man, the father of five children.   Ahmad is a hard worker, and he owns an iron lathe, which is a highly requested business in the region, for 25 years.

Ahmad is well known, with a good reputation.  One of the services he provides to customers is that he transports the machines they want him to work on to his workshop and back to their place free of charge.  That's why he has to fix his car's engine and why he has applied for a new loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua. 

This is Ahmad's second cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower, with a good credit history.

loans.use: to replace his car's engine for picking up and delivering machinery.

loans.name: Jeffrey

texts.en:
Jeffrey is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married, with one child. 
Jeffrey is an employee at a motorcycle store, and at the same time he buys and sells personal care and home products, for which his wife takes  responsibility. Jeffrey is just starting the business. He has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more products, such as home cleaner, soap, and home disinfectant.
Jeffrey has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Jeffrey hopes to improve his business, to pay for the education of his child.

loans.use: to buy products for a family business

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia Luz Marina continua dedicandose a su negocio de tienda de abarrotes ,la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz,azucar,leche,golosinas,gaseosas entre otros,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de mercaderia como gaseosas.
texts.en:
Luz Marina continues to make her living through her grocery store business. She sells different types of products such as rice, sugar, milk, candies, and soft drinks, among other things. She has been running this business for a long time and it continues to go well for her, thanks to the effort that she puts into it every day.

She requests the loan in order to buy merchandise such as soft drinks.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as soft drinks

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora Natividad, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Sol Naciente” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú, nuestra socia se dedica a la actividad del comercio de artesanías, principalmente a la elaboración de tejidos como chompas, chalinas, guantes etc, Natividad invertirá el préstamo solicitado para pagar la educación de su hijo quien está postulando a la universidad.
Natividad está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle mantenerse en su actividad y apoyando a su familia.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
This is our member, Natividad.  She belongs to the Sol Naciente Communal Bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.  She makes and sells craftwork for a living, mainly knitting things such as sweaters, scarves, gloves, etc.  Natividad will use the loan she requested to pay for the education of her son, who is applying to attend university.

Natividad is very thankful to Kiva for allowing her to keep up her business and support her family.

She is thankful for the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: pay for her son's education

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.en:
Suhrob is a man of taste -- he prepares very tasty foods.  He is smart, clever, and handsome.  He likes to work very hard.  He has his own café and a lot of customers. Many people like to eat the food that Suhrob cooks because this food gives them more energy. 

His lovely wife Zarina helps Suhrob with his busiiness.  Zarina loves her husband very much. They have four children, and they want to develop their business further. 

He is asking a loan to buy a refrigerator and a stove for his café. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator and a stove for his cafe.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a mother of six adult children and is aged 56, with 25 years of experience in mixed farming in her rural home in the Nkubu area of Central Kenya. Her farm produces mangoes, milk, maize, and beans, among other cereals, which she sells at local markets.

Lucy has made a loan request of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says increased farming income will help her meet her daily needs, together with those of her husband, and make both fully dependent on their income and not on their children, who also have families. She hopes to grow the business and increase the number of her dairy cows, to enjoy economies of scale.

Her major problem remains the poor climatic conditions in the off-seasons.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en: Thorn has been an honest client of HKL for more than four years. To solve financial difficulties in her life, Thorn has made four loans already, and she has mentioned that they were very helpful in her farming business. As with the previous loans, Thorn would like to obtain her fifth loan to pay for her farm operating expenses. She will purchase seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides, and pay labor costs. Although she is from a low-income family, Thorn wants to take a peaceful and faithful path in life. She has never made any late payments on her previous four loans. Thorn is now 50 years old, married, and is responsible for 10 children, five of whom live independently with their new families.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides, and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy forma parte del Banco Comunal “Esperanza Requinoa” perteneciente a la ciudad de Rancagua.
Ella se dedica al rubro de negocio específicamente venta de abarrotes y paquetería. Se desempeña en sus labores desde hace 8 años, comenta que trabaja con la ayuda de su esposo y algunas veces de su hijo, trabaja de lunes a domingo  y su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
Su mercadería la compra en supermercados y distribuidoras, y los artículos de paquetería los compra en la ciudad de Santiago a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará aceites, bebidas, masas, pantys, calcetas, camisetas, para abastecer su negocio.
Una de las metas de Nancy en su negocio, son continuar con el negocio, para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Nancy vive junto a su esposo quien le ayuda con las ventas del negocio y su hijo quien se encuentra trabajando. Sus sueños son que su hijo quede a cargo del negocio cuando ella o su esposo no puedan trabajar.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades, intereses, lo cual también le ha servido como un momento de distracción. 
Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera.
Rancagua pertenece a la región del Libertador Bernardo O´Higgins. Es una moderna ciudad que regula el principal proceso productivo y exportador agrofrutícola y vitivinícola de Chile. Es también una ciudad minera, debido a que en su cordillera se encuentra la mina subterránea más grande del mundo “El Teniente”, con 4.500 km. de túneles.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the Communal Bank “Esperanza Requinoa” which is located in the city of Rancagua. She works in the business trade, specifically selling groceries and managing a package shipping center. Nancy began working in these businesses eight years ago. She says that she works with the help of her husband. Nancy works Monday through Friday and her delivery schedule is based on her availability.

Nancy buys her merchandise from supermarkets and distributors. The supplies for her package service are purchased in the city of Santiago at low cost, which is financially convenient. With this loan, she will buy oils, beverages, pastries, undergarments, knitted items, and T-shirts to restock her business. One of Nancy’s goals is to continue her business so that she can generate more income and choose a better quality of life.

Nancy lives with her husband and son. Her husband helps with the sales in her business and her son is working. Her dreams include seeing her son in charge of the business when she and her husband are not able to work.

Nancy is very pleased and appreciative of the opportunity provided by Fondo Esperanza so that she can invest in her business. In addition, she feels very comfortable to be in the company of other entrepreneurs in her Communal Bank group with whom she shares different activities and interests. Their meetings also provide her with a moment of distraction. With respect to the training classes conducted during their meetings, she has learned how to manage her business better.

Rancagua is part of the Libertador Bernardo O’Higgins region. This modern city is one of the main producers and exporters of fruits and wine in Chile. It is also a mining city because it is the home of “El Teniente”, one of the largest underground mines in the world with 4500km of tunnels.

loans.use: to buy oils, beverages, pastries, undergarments, knitted items, and T-shirts.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS SOLIDARIOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia trabaja como docente en un colegio,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este trabajo la socia quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es mejorar sus conocimientos como docente.La socia solicita el credito para pagar las mensualidades de sus hijos que estudian en colegio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "Los Solidarios" (In Solidarity). The bank is located in the Urubamba district, in the province of Urubamba and the department of Cuzco.

She is a high school teacher, and works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm. She wants to get ahead through her work. Her dream is to increase her knowledge and improve as a teacher. She is requesting this loan in order to make the monthly payments on her children's high school educations.

She is happy for the loan and promises to comply with the payments of her debt.

loans.use: to make the monthly payments on her children's high school fees

loans.name: El Rincon De Las Amigas Group

texts.es:
El rincon de las amigas es el grupo formado por 13 mujeres de la ciudad de Luque, donde todas ellas son amigas y vecinas, es por eso mismo que este grupo ella ese nombre. Gracias a su trabajo el grupo ya esta en el ciclo numero 15.
La Sra Laura es miembro del grupo,  tiene 44 años de edad esta casada con el señor Melanio quien es pintor de obras juntos tienen 2 hijos.
La  Sra Laura es vendedora, y solicita el credito para la compra de verduras y frutas, ya que ese es su trabajo y quiere poder tener un buen stock que ofrecer a sus clientes.Tiene una meta que es ampliar su negocio dentro de su casa.
texts.en:
“Rincon de las Amigas” (Friends’ Corner) is a group made up of 13 ladies from the city of Luque, where all of them are friends and neighbors.  It’s for this reason that this group has this name.  Thanks to its work, the group is already in its 15th cycle.

Laura is a member of the group.  She is 44 years old and married to Melanio who is a painter.  They have two children.

Laura is a merchant and is requesting this loan to buy vegetables and fruits, as this is her job and she wants to be able to have a good assortment to offer to her customers.  Her goal is to expand her business, located in her home.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis, vive con su familia sus esposa y dos hijos, administra una tienda de productos de primera necesidad el comenzó gracias al apoyo de su esposa quien está colaborando para poder echar a andar el negocio, está instalado en la vivienda donde residen, no tiene un horario establecido para atender a sus clientes.

Él solicita un préstamo pues considera necesario la inversión en mercadería para el negocio, comprándose la variedad de aquellos productos que son más demandados por sus clientes como el arroz, frijol, queso, aceite, pastas, entre otras que son necesarias y que al momento de la compra sus clientes demandan, el crédito le permitirá realizar esta inversión a través de los recursos económicos, en espera tener una mejor aceptación por parte de los clientes.

La aspiración de Luis es a futuro poder surtir mucho más el negocio haciéndolo más rentable, también tiene el proyecto de adquirir su propia vivienda donde vivir con su familia, esta aspiración espera lograrla a través de su esfuerzo y de los préstamos que se le puedan brindar.
texts.en: Luis lives with his family, his wife and his two children and runs a convenience store items shop. He started this thanks to the support of his wife, who is helping to get the business up and running. The store is located in their home, it doesn't have a fixed schedule of working hours. He requests a loan, since he thinks it's necessary to invest in products for the business, buying a variety of those that customers demand the most, such as rice, beans, cheese, oil, pasta, among others that are also necessary and requested by customers. The loan will allow him to make this investment by providing the financial resources. In return he hopes to receive more acceptance from customers. Luis' aspiration for the future is to be able to further supply the business making it more profitable. He also has the project of acquiring a house of his own to live with his family. He hopes to realize this aspiration through the effort he makes and the loans he can get.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, cheese, oil and pasta

loans.name: Raul De Jesus

texts.es:
Raúl, es agricultor dedicado desde muy joven a la actividad, ya que se le inculcaron sus padres, por el momento la realiza para su familia, no tiene horario para atender las labores que demanda la agricultura, el vive con su esposa y tres hijos todos trabajan en la familia.

Actualmente Raúl inicia su proceso de la siembra agrícola, para esto solicita un préstamo que le facilite los recursos económicos e invertir en los insumos como el abono y los herbicidas, para sembrar el maíz en dos manzanas de terreno, también realizará la siembra de yuca en dos manzanas de terreno, por lo mismo a través del préstamo espera adquirir los recursos necesarios que le permitan crecer y tenerlo a la mano para poder mejorar sus cosechas y que éstas estén libres de plagas.

La aspiración de Raúl es que su trabajo agrícola sea más productivo, adquiriendo mejores cosechas, esto también le permitirá una mejor condición económica para su familia.
texts.en:
Raúl has been a farmer since his parents introduced him to farming at a very young age. He is currently working to support his family. Farming is a demanding job with no fixed timetable. Raúl lives with his wife and three children; the whole family works. 

At the moment Raúl is beginning to sow crops, so he has applied for a loan to help him manage his costs and invest in supplies such as fertiliser and herbicides. This will allow him to sow maize on two plots of land and yucca on two other plots of land. He hopes that the loans will also help him to grow his business and eventually put money aside for improving his harvests and eliminating crop diseases.

Raúl aspires to make his farm more productive, with better harvests. This, in turn, will improve his family’s economic situation.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser and herbicides.

loans.name: Edgar Alexander

texts.es:
Don Edgar tiene 40 años de edad, es casado y tiene un hijo. Él es motorista de profesión; pero también se dedica al oficio de albañilería; lo aprendió desde hace 21 años con un amigo que le enseño, debido a que juntos construían casas para ganar dinero y poder subsistir. Posteriormente, don Edgar se fue perfeccionando en la construcción y hoy en día él realiza los contratos con la ayuda de un grupo de personas. 

Él esta solicitando un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar 75 yardas de maya que cuestan $5.80 cada una, 30 postes de cemento que cuestan $15 dólares cada uno y 10 bolsas de cemento a $8.15 cada una. Para construir una cerca de maya ciclón; con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda, proporcionando tranquilidad y la seguridad que no ingresen animales a su propiedad y que esta siempre luzca bonita. Su deseo es mejorar su vivienda para cuando crezca su hija, viva en una casa digna.
texts.en:
Edgar is 40 years old, married, and has one child.  He is a driver by trade but also does construction work; he learned the trade 21 years ago from a friend who taught him when they used to build houses together to earn a living.  Edgar later perfected his craft in construction and now and days he fulfills work contracts with a group of people.

He is soliciting a loan from Fundación Campo to purchase 75 yards of fencing at a cost of $5.80 per yard, 30 cement posts at a cost of $15 dollars each, and 10 bags of cement at a cost of $8.15 each in order to build a barbed-wire fence.  The goal is to make improvements to his home, giving him peace of mind that no animals will come on to his land and that his property will look good.  He wishes to improve his home so that his daughter will grow up in a decent home.

loans.use: to purchase 75 yards of fencing at a cost of $5.80 per yard, 15 cement posts at a cost of $15 dollars each, and 10 bags of cement at a cost of $8.15 each

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora Guillermina, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Sol Naciente” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú, nuestra socia se dedica al servicio de habitaciones en un hotel, Guillermina invertirá el préstamo solicitado para comprar utensilios y cubiertos para la proxima apertura de su restaurante.
Guillermina está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle abrir su propio comercio y por apoyarla con su familia.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
This is our member, Guillermina.  She belongs to the Sol Naciente Communal Bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.  She cleans hotel rooms for a living.  Guillermina will use the loan she requested to buy utensils and cutlery for the upcoming opening of her restaurant.

Guillermina is very thankful to Kiva for allowing her to open her own business and for helping her support her family.

She is thankful for the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy kitchenware and cutlery to open her restaurant

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es:
La socia Yanet sigue dedicandose a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes, gallinas entre otros,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia ,a la vez continua con la compra y venta de maiz ,la socia es una persona responsable con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando por su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de maiz al por mayor.
texts.en:
Our member, Yanet, is still raising small animals, such as guinea pigs and hens, among others.  She has been in this business for years and it is going well for her thanks to the effort she puts in every day.  She is also still buying and selling corn.  She is a very responsible person with a great drive to keep working for her family.

She is requesting this loan to buy corn wholesale.

loans.use: to buy corn wholesale

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Estrellas” perteneciente a la ciudad de Temuco.
Ella se dedica al rubro de la costura, específicamente confección, y algunas veces venta de ropa, desde hace 40 años. Comenta que realizó algunos cursos y con el tiempo se perfecciono para emprender en su negocio.
Maria se desempeña en sus labores de Costuras de lunes a viernes y su horario de trabajo lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
Su mercadería la compra en la ciudad de Temuco y en Santiago por la gran variedad y a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará específicamente géneros, tijeras, hilos y agujas.
Una de las metas de María en su negocio son continuar con las costuras, ya que  le gusta mucho el rubro en el cual se desempeña, además para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Maria vive junto a su padre. Sus sueños son a nivel personal comprar un casa, y a nivel laboral e poder trabajar con su sobrina, ya que le ha enseñado bastante el rubro.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras el grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades, interese, lo cual le ha servido como un momento de distracción. 
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the 'Las Estrellas' community bank in the city of Temuco.

Maria's business is sewing, specifically dressmaking.  She also sometimes sells clothing.  She has been in this business for 40 years.  She says that she took some courses and, over time, she perfected her skills and started her business.

Maria does her sewing work from Monday to Friday and her work hours very according to her availability.  She buys her merchandise in the cities of Temuco and Santiago because of the wide range of goods there and the low prices which are financially convenient for her.  She will use her loan to buy material, scissors, threads and needles.

One of Maria's goals for her business is to continue sewing because she really likes the work she does.  She would also like to make more income so that she can enjoy a better quality of life.

Maria lives together with her father.  Her dreams on a personal level are to buy a house.  On a business level, she would like to be able to work with her niece as she has trained her in this field.

Maria is very happy and grateful for the opportunity that Fondo Esperanza have given her because it has allowed her to invest in her business.  She feels very comfortable in the company of the other entrepreneurs in her community bank because they share different activities and interests which has helped to keep her occupied.

Temuco is the capital of Araucanía region.  The city is 670 kilometers to the south of Santiago (the capital of Chile).  In the surrounding areas there are a series of lake resorts (Pucón, Villarrica) and very attractive native flora and fauna which are concentrated in nearby natural reserves.  This region is home to 50% of the Mapuches, the indigenous people who live in our country.

loans.use: to buy material, scissors, threads and needles

loans.name: Francisco Orlando

texts.es:
Francisco tiene 28 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos de 12, 8 y 5 años respectivamente. Él tiene más de 10 años de dedicarse ha prestar servicios en su molino de dos tolvas que se encuentra ubicado en caserío a unos 50 metros de la calle principal, que conduce a una cuidad. Este servicio lo presta a las personas que viven en la comunidad y las comunidades vecinas en horarios de 4.00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m. el negocio es administrado por su esposa, debido a que Francisco se dedica ha prestar servicio de trasporte realizando viajes a una ciudad del oriente del país 3 veces por semana a comprar frutas y verduras con las señoras que venden. Programa los viajes a la cuidad, cuando las persona se lo solicitan con dos días de anticipación.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo es para complementar el dinero para la compra de un vehículo, por que el que tiene es de gasolina y le consume mucho combustible cuando realiza los viajes. Él quiere comprar otro y ya lo tiene negociado es de diesel y es mas económico se lo venden en $3,500.00 y le faltan $1,000.00 para el complementó.

Al comprar el vehiculó con sistema diesel los ingresos serán mayores, por la razón, que es menos el valor de compra del combustible y es mas económico de esta manera podrán hacer un ahorro para futuras inversiones. Su deseo es poder comprar un terreno para la construcción de una vivienda por que donde están viviendo actualmente es alquilada.
texts.en:
Francisco is 28 years old; he is married and he has three children who are 12, 8, and 5 years old, respectively.  He has been lending his services at his two-chute mill for over ten years now.  It is located in a small village about 50m from the main road that leads to a city.  He renders his services to the people who live in that community and neighboring communities from 4:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m.  His wife manages that business, as Francisco also offers transportation services by making trips to a city in the west of the country three times a week to buy fruits and vegetables with the women who sell them.  He plans his trips to the city when people request them two days in advance.

The loan Fundación Campo is requesting is to cover the cost to buy a vehicle because the one he has runs on gasoline and it uses a lot of fuel when he makes his trips.  He wants to buy a different one and he has already negotiated for a diesel one that is more economical.  They are selling it to him for $3,500 and he needs $1,000 to make the full payment.

After buying a diesel vehicle, his income will be greater because gas will be cheaper and it is a more efficient vehicle.  This will allow them to save for future investments.  His wish is to be able to buy land to build a home because their current home is rented.

loans.use: to cover the cost of buying a new vehicle

loans.name: Amy's Group

texts.fr:
Ce BV a été créé depuis le 04 juin 2011 et est composé des  femmes habitant le même village et les villages alentours. elles font comme activité principale le commerce.
Fatou debout sur la droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 45 ans est marié et mère d'un garçon; elle a en charges 2 petites filles et une belle fille.
Elle fait comme activité principale l'embouche bovine; elle achète un bœuf qu'elle engraisse et au bout de 6 mois le revend dans les marchés hebdomadaires.
Elle fait en parallèle du petit commerce: vente de poisson fumé et séché, de légumes.
Avec les Bénéfices générés elle aide son fils à entretenir la famille; elle renforce son épargne; et achète des fournitures scolaires pour ses petits enfants.
texts.en:
This BV (Banc Villageois) was created on June 2, 2011 and is made up of women living in the same village and neighboring villages. Their main business is commerce.
Fatou, standing up on the right in the photo and raising her hand, is 45 years old and married, mother of a son. She also has two granddaughters and a daughter-in-law in her care.
As her main business she practicing beef fattening: she buys a cow, which she fattens, and after six months resells it at the weekly markets.
At the same time, she also runs a small business selling smoked and dried fish, and vegetables.
With the profits she makes she helps her son take care of the family, she strengthens her savings and she buys school supplies for her grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy one cow, smoked fish, dried fish, and vegetables.

loans.name: Choeurn's Group

texts.en:
Choeurn lives in a rural village in the Ratanak Mondul district of Battambang, Cambodia. She is 49 years old and a widow, with two daughters, both of whom are dependent on her and are still in school. To support the family, Choeurn has been growing paddy rice on two hectares of farmland. To better feed the family, she also plants red corn and works for others for pay. She has been with her businesses for 10 years and can earn about KHR 8,200 per day. For her, insufficiency of working capital is the main challenge.

Choeurn has been with VisionFund for two cycles and has successfully paid back the loans. The past loans have helped her have enough food and keep her children in school. Now she leads this group and is applying for a loan of KHR 1,000,000 with VisionFund; one of the members is requesting the same amount as she is and another is seeking KHR 500,000. As the group leader, Choeurn will use her portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to improve the family’s condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seed for her farmland

loans.name: Ma. Marilyn

texts.en:
This is Ma. Marilyn, 46, resident of Manila, Philippines. Her husband is Gilberto, a security guard, and father to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business.

Ma. Marilyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 600 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 14,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory and maintain her sewing machine. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Ma. Marilyn hopes her business will expand and grow into a mini-grocery through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to give her children a good and quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week; here she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.
