*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 45 years old and has four children. She operates a cereal shop to earn a living. She has been in the business for four years and has one employee. She has been able to improve her business through the trainings she received from Faulu Kenya on business management. She dreams of operating more outlets in different locations in the future. She needs a loan of 20,000 KES to buy cereals like maize, beans and green grams for resale.

loans.use: To buy cereals like maize, beans and green grams

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is aged 48.  She is married and has two children, aged 11 and 5 years. She lives with her family in their rural home in Nkubu where she carries out her farming. She sells her produce, which includes maize, beans and sorghum, to the local market.

Mary has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a water tank and irrigation pipes. She believes this will improve her income  since her dairy cows will have enough water, and will enable her educate her children and make life much better.

She reiterates lack of rains is a major challenge, coupled with poor markets locally which compels farmers to access distant markets.

loans.use: To buy a water tank and irrigation pipes

loans.name: Gie-Ann

texts.en:
Gie-Ann is 25 years old.  She is single and lives in the Philippines. Gie-Ann is an employee of a motorcycle store.  At the same time, she also sells beauty products. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 to buy more beauty products like facial cream, facial foam and body lotion.
Gie-Ann is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Gie-Ann hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products to sell

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 60 years old and married, with six children. She operates a cereal shop to earn a living. She has been in the business since 2008. 

Through Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to save because it trained her in financial management. 

She dreams of expanding her business and becoming successful in the future. She needs a loan of KES 20,000  to buy two sacks of maize and beans for resale.

loans.use: To buy two sacks of maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Davronjon

texts.en:
Davronjon lives in very beautiful place, among high mountains and green nature. There is a river that the local people use for watering their land. 

Davronjon has his own land where he grows watermelon and vegetables.  As he is very hard working, his business has developed year by year. He sells his harvest to local people. His products have many customers. His wife and brothers help Davronjon in his business. Davronjon’s five children love him very much because he is very careful father. 

He must buy mineral fertilizers for the new planting season, but he has not the money. He wants to develop his business, and you are the only ones who can help him. Davronjon awaits your help.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers ffor his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice, baking flour, maize flour, and washing powders for her shop.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 28 years of age and the married mother of one child.  Nowadays, Fatuma patiently runs a tailoring business from which she generates about KES 300 each day on average. She uses her income to meet her daily needs and to care for the family, especially her school-age kid.

Fatuma would like to take out a loan of KES 10,000 to purchase clothing materials and thread.   She hopes to obtain this loan so she can better her family’s living condition, increase her profits, and save some more for emergencies. 

Fatuma has been in this business for the past five years. She dreams of opening a boutique in future.

loans.use: to purchase clothing materials and thread for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 37 years old, she and lives in the Philippines. She is single with one child. 

Rosalie sells hot dogs and longganisa and chorizo sausages in her local community. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy more stocks of hot dogs, longganisa, and chorizo to resell.

Rosalie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy more hot dogs, longganisa and chorizo to resell.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en: Jacob is 29 years old and has two children. He sells onions to make a living. He has been in this business for three years and has two employees. Besides this, he also generates extra income from his salon business. He has previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya, which helped him to expand his business. He has also learned how to manage and repay his loan effectively, because he has been trained in financial management. He hopes to start making supplies for schools and hotels in the future. He needs a loan of 70,000 KES to buy 1,500 kg of onions.

loans.use: To buy 1,500 kg of onions

loans.name: Judy

texts.en: Judy is 27 years old, married, and has two children who are in school. She sells clothes in a high-traffic area and has reliable customers. She has been in this business for four years. Since she has become a client of Faulu Kenya, she has improved her savings skills, because she has been trained in financial management. She dreams of opening another outlet in a different location and buying a piece of land in the future. She needs a loan of 20,000 KES to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Mary is a mother of four children who are aged between 18 and 12 years and has been in farming for 15 years in her rural home in Nkubu, Central Kenya. She produces bananas and cereals, mainly maize and sorghum, and sells them at the local market. 

Mary has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to buy piglets. She says pork has become a popular delicacy due to high cost of beef and now provides a ready market for the farmers. She will use her farming income to educate her children and improve their living standards. 

Mary reiterates Juhudi Kilimo loans have improved the lives of many farmers in her area.

loans.use: To buy piglets

loans.name: Elly

texts.en: Elly is married and has two children. He operates a cafeteria to earn a living. He has been in the business for two years and has two employees. He operates his business in a conducive environment with regular customers. Previously, he used to operate a retail shop. Through Faulu Kenya, he has learnt how to save because he has been trained in financial management. He dreams of expanding his business in the future. He needs a loan of 80,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to buy a chips warmer.

loans.use: To buy a chips warmer

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has nine children. 

Leonila is selling different kinds of fish in her local community. She has had this business for eight years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy a variety of fish to resell, like sardines, milk fish and flying fish. 

Leonila is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Leonila hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy fish to resell

loans.name: Sak's Group

texts.en:
Residing in the Ratanak Mondul district of Battambang province, Cambodia, Sak is a married mother of seven children, six (two daughters and four sons) of whom are still under her responsibility and are helping the family's business, which is rice farming and corn planting. She is able to earn about 30,000 Riel (KHR) per day from her current business that she has had for 12 years. 

This is the second loan for Sak with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. She has used the first loan successfully which has helped her to maintain the current business and keep her children in school. She now leads a group consisting of four members; one member is also taking a second loan whilst the other two are newly joined clients. 

She is seeking a loan and will use her portion as the group leader to buy fertilizers and pay the plowing fee. She hopes to earn more income so that she can buy a mini-tractor for her rice field as well as improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Nhu

texts.en: Nhu, 43,  a divorced woman living with her family in Ho Chi Minh City, supports them by running a business buying and selling recycled materials. She is now requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a larger quantity of waste materials to recycle and resell. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy recycled materials to resell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 58 years old and married. She operates a retail store to earn a living. She has been in the business for nine years and has two employees. Through Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to manage her business because she has been trained on business management. She dreams of opening another business in the future. She needs a loan of 100,000 KES to buy buckets, plastic chairs, and basins for resale.

loans.use: To buy buckets, plastic chairs, and basins

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Carmen sells corn snacks in the local community. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for 5,000 to buy raw ingredients in making corn snacks, such as cheese, sugar, and corn syrup.

Carmen has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Carmen hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients used in making corn snacks

loans.name: Nyiro

texts.en: Mr. Nyiro lives in Tiribe, Kenya. He is married and has six children. He runs a kiosk,  which he started in 2003. He sells a variety of consumer goods in order to earn a living. His goal is to develop his business and to maximize his profits and his personal income. He is requesting a loan of Ksh 20,000 from Yehu, where he is an active member. The money from this first loan will allow him to stock rice, sugar, and flour in order to meet the growing demands of his customers. He hopes to increase his turnover and to raise the level of his savings. His ambition is to become an important businessman, and to operate several wholesale businesses.

loans.use: to stock rice, sugar, and flour

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is 46 years old, married, and a father of three children. He sells DVDs in a busy business environment with reliable customers. He has been in the business since 2005. Through Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save because he has been trained on financial management. He hopes to operate a fleet of lorries in the future. He needs a loan of 20,000 KES to buy DVDs and CDs for resale.

loans.use: To buy DVDs and CDs

loans.name: Soun

texts.en:
Soun is 42 years old. She had her photo taken with her husband in front of her house, which is located in the Baray district, Kompong Tom province. Soun makes a living through farming rice and raising hogs, while her husband devotes his time to the fishing business. Soun has been working in this business for many years, and it provides her family with an appropriate income to meet their needs. Soun has four school-aged children who are still in need of her care.

With the loan she has requested through HKL, Soun would like to purchase a water pump to carry water to her crop fields and to purchase chemical fertilizers used to ensure healthier crops. This purchase will enable Soun to go far in developing her current business, and she hopes to have an abundant harvest this coming season.

loans.use: to purchase a water pump to carry water to crop fields and to purchase chemical fertilizers used to ensure healthier crops.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en: Huong is a 57-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has two children. Her husband is working as a supervisor for a school. Huong earns a living running a general store, which she has done for four years. Huong would like to take a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of products (such as juice, beverages, and confectionaries) to stock her store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and increase the turnover of her stock. She also hopes that through the loan, her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to set aside some savings.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety and quantity of products (such as juice, beverages, and confectioneries)

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
El comité se Denomina “Fortaleza”, y está integrado por 18 mujeres de Ciudad del Este, ellas son personas muy trabajadoras y con ganas de salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias.
La Directora es la Sra. Ramona, quien gracias a su trabajo y dedicación está saliendo adelante y ayudando a su familia. Ella tiene una despensa bien surtida, en la cual trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana, su deseo es poder seguir trabajando y ayudando a su familia.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de carne, lácteos, hortalizas y demás insumos para poder seguir ofreciendo variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “Fortaleza” ("Fortress") committee consists of eighteen women from Ciudad del Este.  They are all hardworking, with a desire to get ahead and to help their families. 

The group's director is Ramona, who is getting ahead and helping her family, thanks to her work and dedication.  She has a well-supplied grocery where she works every day from early in the morning.  She wants to keep working and helping her family.

She is seeking a loan to buy meat, milk products, vegetables and other products so she can offer her clients a greater variety of goods.

loans.use: to buy meat, milk products, vegetables and other groceries.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en: Judy is a hardworking 33-year-old business lady. She has one child who goes to school. She operates a beauty salon to earn a living. She has been in the business for three years and has one employee. Since she became a client of Faulu Kenya, she has improved on her saving skills because she has been trained on financial management. She dreams of opening another outlet in a different location in the future. She needs a loan of 20,000 KES to buy hair braids and hair oil.

loans.use: To buy hair braids and hair oil.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Hong is a 55-year-old married man living in Ho Chi Minh City. He has 4 children. He and his wife earn a living running a general store, which they have done for 10 years. Hong would like to take out a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods to stock his store, such as traveling shampoo, snack foods and confectionery. He hopes this will enable him to better meet the needs of his existing customers and attract additional customers. He also hopes that through the loan his business will generate a higher income and will help him to improve his family's living conditions and enable him to save money to meet any future difficulties.

loans.use: To purchase more products, such as shampoo, snack foods and confectionery.

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Long is a 48-year-old married man living in Ho Chi Minh City. He and his wife earn a living running a general store, which they have done for 5 years. Long would like to take out a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of foods, such as powdered milk, snack foods and confectionery, to stock his general store. He hopes this will enable him to better meet the needs of his existing customers and attract additional customers. He also hopes that through the loan his business will generate a higher income and will help him to improve his family's living conditions and enable him to save money to meet any future difficulties.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of foods, such as powdered milk, snack foods and confectionery.

loans.name: Anh

texts.en: Vang is requesting a new loan to buy materials for producing floor mops. Vang's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make mops.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Phuong is requesting a new loan to expand his business by buying more household electrical products and appliances from different suppliers to satisfy his customers. Phuong's previous loan enabled him to expand his business and earn a higher income to support his family. He hopes that another loan will assist him in increasing the size of his business, attract new customers and increase his sales. He also hopes that through the loan he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase household electrical products and appliances.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
With her previous Kiva loan, Salome bought bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar, which she sold and increased her working capital slightly. Now she is applying for a new Kiva loan, because she wants to purchase a motorcycle to establish a transportation business. Salome's working capital is insufficient to establish her transportation business. The reason her Kiva loan will be successful is that she will expand to the transportation sector.  

Salome says that her Kiva loans have been very useful to her. She says thank you, and hopes they continue helping her.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to establish a transportation business

loans.name: Chi

texts.en: Chi is requesting a new loan to buy cosmetic and beauty products and materials. Chi's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic and beauty products.

loans.name: Nu

texts.en: Nu is requesting a new loan to buy fish feed and fish to raise and sell. Nu's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fish feed and fish to raise and sell.

loans.name: Avliyo

texts.en:
Avliyo is a very clever man. In the light of his experience, he is the best businessman. For more than 21 years he has been busy in the agriculture business. He has broad business interests, as he grows corn and vegetables and also fruits. He is also engaged with animal husbandry. 

If you go to Avliyo’s house you would be happy to see cattle which are very interesting, different kind of fruits which are very sweet, and land full of growing vegetables. He has a friendly family. With his business, Avliyo helps his 3 children and his wife. 

Avliyo wants to develop his business with cattle. He is asking for a loan to buy young cattle. He awaits your help and support.

loans.use: To buy young cattle.

loans.name: Anh

texts.en: Anh is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, milk and confectionery to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy many kinds of foods to sell, such as eggs, milk and confectionery.

loans.name: Sophan's Group

texts.en:
Sophan is aged 30 and married. She lives in a rural area of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. She has two daughters to support as they are still at school. 

To strive for a living, she has been in potato planting and food selling for twenty years, earning about KHR 53,400 per day.

Sophan joined her first loan with VisionFund one year ago. The past loan, which she completely repaid, has enabled her to well-manage her household. 

She now forms a group consisting of two other members. She is applying for a new loan as a second-cycle client in the amount of KHR 1,200,000. As the group leader, she will use her loan’s portion to buy fertilizer for her potato field. 

She hopes to earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her potato field.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is applying for her third loan cycle from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Lucy will use the loan to buy green vegetables and fresh fruits for her business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits to add to her stock.

loans.name: Hem

texts.en:
Hem, aged 27, is an experienced farmer who has been operating a rice farming business for almost ten years. She is married to Kong, her spouse as well as her business partner. Together, they have given birth to two lovely young kids. Hem would like to send all her children to attend school because she wants them to become well-educated people in the society. For instance, they might have good jobs and this will help to alleviate the poverty in the future.

As of now, Hem has borrowed a loan amount of KHR 1,000,000 to supplement her capital to purchase a water pump coupled with hosepipes for carrying water to her fields. Hem won’t be afraid of drought any longer because she can pump water from the nearby river whenever she needs it. She believes that she will be able to maintain her business well and achieve good yields to support her living.

loans.use: to purchase a water pump coupled with hosepipes for carrying water to her fields.

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en:
Sidi has been a traditional herbalist, selling in her home, an activity she has been running for 30 years. She started the business from her savings which has worked very well, and she has earned income to provide for her family, something she achieved with great effort and by working hard. She is married and has seven children, all of whom are adults.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more products, as she receives many requests. In the future she wishes to have a bigger shop.

loans.use: to purchase medicine for resale.

loans.name: Katiba

texts.en:
Katiba is a hardworking man who lives with just his wife. He has operated a hardware store for some time, after working as a carpenter. His business is quite stable and he wants to invest in it in order to earn higher profits.

Katiba is asking for a loan to buy timbers, nails, etc. With this Katiba hopes to have good income. He’s very happy because he’ll have the resources necessary to reach his goals, and life alongside his wife will be more prosperous.

He has shown great interest in prospering in business. He is so grateful for the previous loan given.

loans.use: to buy timbers, nails, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install pipes to channel water and to purchase two water pumps.

loans.name: Yusub

texts.en:
Yusub has a very interesting character. He is jolly and kind. Also, he is a very successful businessman. 

For more than ten years he has been engaged with his own business deal. He grows onions. His business has developed year by year because he is hardworking and smart. 

Yusub has additional income from animal husbandry. He has a big family. His wife and children help him in his business.

 Yusub wants to develop his business but his income isn’t enough for it. He is asking for a loan to buy mineral fertilizers for the land where he works. He awaits your help and support.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Odette

texts.en:
Odette is 37 years old and is married with four children. She purchases and sells various foods and items like: biscuits, soap, rice, sugar, bread, etc. 

She has been in this business for three years, and she works from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m. every day per week.

Odette has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various foods and items like: biscuits, soap, rice, sugar, bread, etc. for resale. 

With any profits, she will be able to save for her future and she will be able to build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase various foods and items like: biscuits, soap, rice, sugar, bread, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Rosejean

texts.en:
This is Rosejean, 36, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Zacarias, a driver, and mother to their daughter.  At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rosejean oversees operations of their Tricycle transportation business. They have one "tricycle" that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. In her business the regular customers are the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 300 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts, accessories and also for the maintenance of her motorcycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Rosejean dreams of being able to give her daughter a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle unit.

loans.name: Providence

texts.en:
Providence is 30 years old and is a married woman with three children aged between 1 and 9 years old. She purchases and sells mattresses. She has been in this business for eight years, and she works from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. every day. She currently employs one person to help her.

Providence has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy more mattresses for resale. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future, and she will be able to buy her own house.

loans.use: To buy more mattresses for resale.

loans.name: Mab's Group

texts.en:
Mab, 43, is living in the rural area of Sangke district, Cambodia.  He is a father of three dependent children who are students. To support their family, Mab and his wife have been selling dried fish and raising pigs for 24 years. He is able to earn about KHR 20,000 per day from his current businesses. 

Mab has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan while the other member of his group is a newly joined client for this cycle. He is leading this group to apply for a loan of KHR 900,000 each. He, the group leader, is going to use his portion to buy more piglets to raise and fish for making dried fish for sale.  With this loan, Mab hopes to earn more income to allow his family to live in a better lifestyle and keep the children in school.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and fish

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en:
Sylivia is a 22-year-old lady from Nyamasaria Kisumu, West of Kenya and is married to Caleb. They have one child aged four years.

She operates a clothes selling business, which she has been doing for the last one year, and makes a monthly income of KES 12,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy more stock of clothing for sale. 


Her profits will be used to buy household items and provide for her family's basic needs. Her dream is to be a successful business lady.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to stock and sell.

loans.name: Faida

texts.en:
Faida is 28 years old and is a married woman with two children aged 5 and 7 years old. She purchases and sells chairs, tables, etc. 

Faida has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more chairs, tables, etc. for resale. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future, and she will be able to buy a house.

loans.use: To buy more chairs, tables, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Manzura

texts.en:
Manzura is a woman of taste and fashion. She has some experience in sewing national dresses. She sews very beautifully and all her customers are glad about her work. 

Her customers like her very much because she is very cute, glorious, and kind-hearted. She knows all aspects of her business very well. 

She has a lovely husband and two smart children. No one helps her in business. She must work hard to feed and keep her family. 

She wants to repair her house, which is in bad condition. When it rains, the roof of her house is dripping. Please, help her to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy building materials to repair her house.

loans.name: Chibendo

texts.en:
Chibendo is a very hardworking person who always wants to try whenever opportunities come along. He has been operating a restaurant for several years and is still in this business. This is his third loan with Yehu and his second loan with Kiva. He has a good repayment history and this is why he is requesting another loan of Ksh 40,000 to buy stock of items for his restaurant. 

This is due to the increase in the number of clientele and customer demand. He hopes to make more profits out of it. Thanks to Kiva and Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy items to stock in his restaurant.

loans.name: Beatha

texts.en:
Beatha is 40 years old and is a widow. She purchases and sells various goods like: books, juice, sugar, soap, etc. She has been in this business for two years and currently employs two persons. She works from 6 a.m. to 12 p.m. every day.

Beatha has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods like: books, juice, sugar, soap, etc. for resale. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future, and she will be able to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To expand her supermarket by buying various goods like: books, juice, sugar, soap, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia forma parte del Banco Comunal “Caminando Juntos” perteneciente a la ciudad de Rancagua.
Ella se dedica al rubro de la peluquería, desde hace 35 años. Realizo cursos de especialización, lo que le permitió perfeccionarse y emprender en su negocio. Específicamente en corte de pelo, peinados, tinturas entre otros.
Patricia se desempeña en sus labores de peluquería 4 veces a la semana y su horario de trabajo lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad, ya que su peluquería  la ubica en su propia casa y a veces se dirige a los domicilios particulares de sus clientes.
Su mercadería la compra en distribuidoras que se especializan en vender productos para el cabello, y otra veces compra en Santiago al por mayor a bajo costo, por tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará tinturas, lacas, descolorantes, peinetas, shampo, para abastecer su peluquería.
Una de las metas de Patricia en su negocio son perfeccionarse e incorporar maquinas de masajes corporales.
Patricia vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja de jefe de bodega y su hijo de 21 años de edad quien se encuentra trabajado. Sus sueños a nivel laboral es poner una pastelería ya que también realizo un curso de este rubro, y su sueño a nivel familiar es tener su casa propia.
Ella se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio.
Respecto al grupo del Banco Comunal el cual forma parte, comenta que éste existe muy buena comunicación. Por otro lado las capacitaciones, le han servido para aprender nuevas estrategias de venta y contabilidad.
Rancagua pertenece a la región del Libertador Bernardo O´Higgins. Es una moderna ciudad que regula el principal proceso productivo y exportador agrofrutícolas y vitivinícola de Chile. Es también una ciudad minera, debido a que en su cordillera se encuentra la mina subterránea más grande del mundo “El Teniente”, con 4.500 km. de túneles.
texts.en:
Patricia is a member of the Caminando Juntos community bank located in the city of Rancagua.  She has worked as a hairdresser for 35 years.  She took specialized courses which allowed her to perfect her skills and start her business.  She does haircuts, hairstyles, and dying, among other things.  

She works at her salon four times a week, and her schedule is distributed according to her availability, since the salon is located in her home, and she sometimes goes to her customers' homes.  She purchases her merchandise at distributors that specialize in hair care products, and sometimes she purchases at inexpensive wholesalers in Santiago, which is financially beneficial.  With this loan, she will purchase dyes, hairspray, bleach, combs, and shampoo to stock her salon.  One of Patricia's goals for her business is to perfect and incorporate body massage machines.  

Patricia lives with her husband, who works as a manager of a grocery store, and her 21 year old son, who works.  Her dream for her work is to start a bakery since she has also taken courses in this area.  Her dream for her family is to have their own house.  

She is very happy and thankful for the opportunity provided by Fondo Esperanza since it has allowed her to invest in her business.  She says that the community bank she is a part of has very good communication.  The trainings provided have allowed her to learn new sales strategies and accounting.  

Rancagua is located in the Libertador Bernardo O'Higgins region.  It is a modern city that produces and exports fruits and Chilean wine.  It is also a mining city, since its mountains have the largest underground mine in the world, El Teniente, which has 4,500 kilometers of tunnels.

loans.use: to purchase dyes, hairspray, bleach, combs, and shampoo to stock her salon.

loans.name: Luis Guillermo

texts.es:
Luis vive en una pequeña ciudad al norte de Ecuador conocida como Atuntaqui. A pesar de ser una ciudad de tan solo 21,000 habitantes, es conocida por la industrial textil, la ropa, y la moda. Hay una feria industrial y artesanal los viernes y sábados donde gente de todo el país visita el lugar para comprar ropa de todo tipo de calidad y precios. La ciudad es famosa por los cuyes, un plato típico del país preparado a base de animalitos conocidos como “conejillos de indias”. La temperatura promedio es de 18°C. El lugar también atrae turistas para observar monumentos hechos por la antigua tribu de los Atuntaquis. 
Luis tiene 18 años de edad y ya es un emprendedor. Gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre y su pasión por los animales, hace un año Luis creó un criadero de cerdos. El sueño con poder generar su propio empleo. Para cumplir su meta él trabaja los mañanas, el medio día y las noches. Sin embargo, los ingresos no son suficientes para hacer su negocio más eficiente, por lo tanto, por medio de Fundación Alternativa, el pide un préstamo a Kiva para poder comprar mejor alimento para sus animales. De esta manera los cerdos crecerán más sanos y le permitirán producir más generando más ganancias. Así, el tendrá un negocio más estable que le va a permitir empezar con el pie derecho su vida de adulto.
texts.en:
Luis lives in a small city in the north of Ecuador known as Atuntaqui.  Though it is a city of only 21,000 inhabitants, it is known for its textile industries, the clothing and their fashion.  There is an industrial and crafts market each Friday and Saturday where people from all around the country come to the area to buy clothing of every kind and price point.  The city is famous for its "cuyes," a typical dish of the country prepared from the small animals known as "Indian Rabbits" or guinea pigs.  The average temperature is 18°C.  The locale also attracts tourists who want to see the monuments made by the ancient tribe of the Atuntaquis. 

Luis is 18 years old and is already an entrepreneur.  Thanks to the teachings of his father and his passion for animals, about a year ago, Luis began raising hogs.  His dream is to be able to be his own boss.  To reach his goals, he works morning, noon, and night.  Even so, his income is not enough to make his business more efficient, for which reason, he his asking for a loan via Fundación Alternativa from Kiva to enable him to buy better feed for his animals.  This will help his hogs to grow up healthier and will allow him to make a better profit.  Thus, he will have a more stable business, allowing him to put the right foot forward in starting his adult life.

loans.use: to be able to buy better feed for his animals.

loans.name: Phan's Group

texts.en:
Phan is from the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She is 59 years old and has four children; two daughters are still dependent on her and work as garment workers. She has been involved in rice farming for 42 years and supplements family’s income by working as a paid worker to support her family. She is able to earn about KHR 34,200 per day. 

Phan has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for three cycles while the other members have been with Kiva’s partner for one cycle. The past loans have made her family a better living. Now she is asking for a loan of KHR 800,000. As the group leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizers, a plowing machine, and use a portion of it to buy one sewing machine. She hopes that this loan will enable her to raise her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, a plow, and use a portion of it to buy one sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy various goods such as: juice, water, biscuits, soap, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Cris Rosario

texts.es:
Cris es una mujer de 28 años, vive con sus padres y hermanos en la ciudad de Chincha, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación y muchos deseos de ayudar a sus padres, ya que ellos siempre han estado con ella y le han brindado su apoyo incondicional; en sus ratos libres le gusta dedicar un poco de tiempo a la lectura y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Pachamanca para compartir con su familia.
Gracias al apoyo de sus padres Cris pudo estudiar su carrera profesional de Educación, ella se desempeña como profesora de educación inicial, aun no es una profesora nombrada por el estado, ella trabaja por contratos; Cris labora un aproximado de 6 horas diarias, desde tempranas horas de la mañana asiste a un pequeño centro educativo donde atiende y enseña a través de juegos, cantos y dinámicas la educación básica a niños de 1 a 5 años de edad; ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor ya que siempre le han gustado los niños y le gusta ayudarlos y verlos feliz.
Cris se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de sus materiales de estudios, tales como libros, folletos, cuadernos, papelería, entre otros; de esta manera Cris contará con los materiales necesarios para poder seguir cursando sus estudios de educación para así poder postular a un nombramiento, con ello pronto espera poder ocupar una plaza vacante como profesora nombrada en algún centro educativo de su ciudad y así con esa estabilidad desea poder terminar  de construir su vivienda y seguir apoyando a sus padres.
texts.en:
Cris is a woman of 28. She lives with her parents and siblings in the city of Chincha. She is a kind, hard-working, and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to excel and many wishes to help her parents, since they have always been with her and have offered her their unconditional support. In her free time she like to spend a little time reading and sometimes cooks a delicious pachamanca (a traditional Peruvian stew) to share with her family.

Thanks to the support of her parents, Cris has been able to study for a career in education. She works as a preschool teacher but she is not a teacher appointed by the state. She works on contract. Cris works about 6 hours a day. From the early hours of the morning she assists at a little educational center where she cares for and teaches basic education to children ages 1 to 5 through games, songs, and movement. She feels at ease doing her work since she has always liked children, and she likes to help them and see them happy.

Cris is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help they have offered she will be able to purchase her necessary school materials, such as books, pamphlets, notebooks, and stationery items, among other things. In this way, Cris will have the materials necessary to be able to continue her courses in education and thus be able to apply for an appointment. She hopes to soon fill a vacant position as an appointed teacher in some education center in her city, and with this stability she hopes to be able to finish building her house and continue supporting her parents.

loans.use: to purchase her school supplies such as books, pamphlets, notebooks, stationery, etc.

loans.name: Idalia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Idalia, vive con su esposo y tres hijos de 5, 2 y 1 año de edad, realizan junto con su esposo las actividades de la siembra de maíz y la crianza de cerdos, ella aprendió estas actividades con sus padres desde muy pequeña, y desde hace seis años esta trabajando al lado de su esposo en estas actividades, ya que de ellas logran obtener lo necesario para la familia.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de cuatro sacos de abono, dos de fórmula y otros materiales que son necesarios para aplicarlos a la siembra, ya que éstos fortalecen la planta y le previene de las plagas, el préstamo ayudará a aumentar la cosecha de granos básicos aplicándole los materiales antes mencionados.

El objetivo en ella es a través del préstamo poder realizar una siembra ordenada,  que pueda ser más rentable a futuro sus cosechas, ya que esto le permitirá también ofrecer una mejor condición a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Idalia lives with her husband and three children, who are 1, 2, and 5 years old.  Together with her husband, she plants corn and raises pigs.  She learned these activities from her parents when she was very young, and for the last six years, she has worked alongside her husband, since they want to obtain the necessities for their family.

She is asking for this loan to purchase four sacks of fertilizer, two of formula, and other materials that are necessary to apply to the crop since they strengthen the plants and prevent plagues.  The loan will help increase the harvest of basic grains by applying the mentioned materials.  

Her objective for the loan is to have an orderly planting, which can make future crops more profitable.  This will allow her to offer better conditions to her children.

loans.use: to purchase four bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Rene David

texts.es:
René, es agricultor en pequeño, vive con su esposa y un hijo, él realiza las actividades agrícolas desde hace seis años, lo aprendió de su padre y hasta el momento se ha mantenido produciendo los granos básicos para el alimento familiar.

Él solicita un préstamo para realizar la compra de insumos agrícolas como lo es el abono, herbicidas, también pagará el alquiler del terreno e iniciará los procesos para preparar la tierra, el crédito le ayudará dándole los recursos económicos y tener todo listo para la siembra de maíz, esperando tener una producción abundante y sana que le ayude a generar ingresos a su familia y la alimentación necesaria.

Su aspiración es mejorar la producción de granos básicos, agregar más cultivos a las tierras, poder ofrecerle su familia una mejor estabilidad.
texts.en:
René is a small-scale farmer who lives with his wife and one child.  He has been farming for about six years.  He leaerned the trade from his father and up to now he has been raising staple grains and beans to feed his family.

He is asking for a loan to buy agricultural inputs like fertilizers, herbicides, and also to pay the rent on a plot of land and being preparing the land for planting.  The loan will help by giving him economic resources so as to have everything ready for the planting of the corn, hoping to have an abundant and healthy crop that will generate a profit for his family and also their necessary food source.

He aspires to improve his production of basics, find more land to cultivate, and to be able to offer his family greater stability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides, and to rent land.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: Maria Mercedes , de 34 años de edad, casada con 3 tre hijos menores todos estan estudiando, tiene por actividad economica la  venta de mercaderia en general  tiene  15 años de experiencia , el cual lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitacion del fianancimiento lo esta solicitando para invertir en mercaderia en general para la comercialzacion como: pantalones, vestidos, faldas, camisetas, ropa interior, calzado, entre otros, Maria Mercedes  ya ha tenido credito con leon 2000 e cual ha demostrado ser capaz, responsable y buena paga, el cual estos financiamiento le han permito cumplir parte de sus sueños y metas personales como, terminar de construir su vivienda para darle seguridad y estabilidad  a sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
Maria Mercedes is 34 years old and married with three dependent children whom are all in school. She works selling general merchandise, which she has 15 years of experience doing. Her work is located in her house. The loan she is requesting will be used to invest in general merchandise to sell: pants, dresses, skirts, t-shirts, underwear and footwear, among other items.

Maria Mercedes has already received loans with Leon 2000, which has proved her to be capable, responsible and honest to pay back. These loans have allowed her to fulfill a part of her dreams and personal goals of finishing the construction of her house to give her children safety and stability.

loans.use: to buy pants, dresses, skirts, t-shirts, underwear and footwear, among other items.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, age 56, maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, and other products through popular direct-selling brands like Avon, Fullerlife, Natasha, Boardwalk, and Marikina Shoe Exchange. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. The dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing in as their income. Grace's regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community. She earns a minimum of 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PhP) in sales every week.

Grace lives in Cavite City with her husband and business partner Dano. The two of them manage their household together while operating the business. They work hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses.

To help Grace continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PhP 16,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy merchandise items and orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Grace hopes to grow her business and increase her client base in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy merchandise items and orders for her direct-sales customers

loans.name: Marie Gorette

texts.en:
Marie Gorette, 28 years old, is married and has two children. She has owned a sewing business for four years and currently employs seven people to help her. She works from 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. every day of the week.

Marie Gorette has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her sewing business by buying more machines and materials. She will use any profits to save for her future and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To expand her sewing business by buying more machines and materials.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Keo, 24 years old, is married. She doesn’t have any children but wishes to have one soon. Keo is from Baray district where she and her husband own and manage a farming business as the family's major source of income. She grows and sells rice and vegetables for profit each harvesting season. To supplement their income, Keo’s husband goes through the community collecting recycled materials which he can resell for a profit. He noticed that this type of business is beneficial for his family and provides a suitable income to meet their daily needs. 

Keo is requesting a loan of KHR 1,000,000 for her husband to invest in his recycling business. This will be sufficient capital for him to purchase more recycled materials and make this business more profitable. Keo plans to use the additional revenue generated from this loan to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more recycled materials for her husband's business

loans.name: Teang's Group

texts.en:
Teang, 40, lives in a rural area located in the Sangke district, Battambang province. She is married and has two daughters; the youngest one is still in school and the oldest daughter works at the family business. Teang plants soybeans and sells vegetables while her husband works as a paid laborer in Thailand.

This is the fourth loan with VisionFund for Teang’s group, which consists of three members. Teang has successfully used her previous loans, which allowed her afford to buy a motorbike for her family. She now earns about 40,000 KHR per day. Teang, the group leader, will use her portion of this loan to buy soybean seeds. She hopes to make more income from her current business and make a better living.

loans.use: to buy soybean seeds

loans.name: Leni

texts.en:
Leni, a 34-year-old entrepreneur, is married to Melanton, a 37-year-old employee. Leny has been blessed with three children: Richard, 17 years old, is attending first grade of senior high school; Valsi, 15 years old, is attending third grade of junior high school; Lian, 10 years old, is attending fifth grade of elementary school.
Leni initiated a kiosk business 5 months ago. The business capital was taken from her husband and her savings. Residing near a hospital motivated her to commence the business. There are many customers who come to buy several daily necessities i.e. candies, snack, shampoo, soap, and cigarette from her kiosk. In addition, she also receives orders to make coffee, tea, and instant noodles.
Recently, Leni’s husband received an order to repair 600 folding chairs, while Leni would also like to improve her kiosk business by adding more stock to sell. Leni needs capital assistance to buy more kiosk stock as well as the repairing materials i.e. rubber foam, wrapping gloves, stapler gun and sizing for her husband. This was the reason why she applied for a loan of IDR 4,500,000 from TLM. She is expecting that the loan assistance would help her and her husband meet their business needs.

loans.use: to buy more kiosk stock for her to sell and repair materials for her husband's business

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es: La Sra. María tiene 26 años  2 hijos que son de las edades de 5 y 7 años, ella se dedica  a la venta  de frutillas y también mermelada de frutilla en su puesto de venta que s encuentra en la localidad de El Torno,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. María va utilizar este préstamo de para la compra de mas frutillas y azúcar por mayor para la elaboración de mermeladas,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo la falta de capital de trabajo, la Sra. María  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son salir de la pobreza y  va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida y la  de su familia, la Sra. María es una persona joven y trabajadora sola saca adelante a su familia y su deseo con el tiempo es tener una tienda donde pueda vender variedad de mermeladas  y conservas, se siente muy agradecida con la institución por la oportunidad brindada en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
María is 26 years old and has two children of the ages of 5 and 7 years old.  She is a seller of berries and also berry jams at her sales point, located in the area of El Torno.  This loan is her first with the institution.  María will use her loan to buy more berries and sugar in bulk to create jams out of them, and her reason for asking for the loan is her lack of working capital.  María faces challenges in her work which include getting out of poverty and using her gains to better her life and that of her family.

María is a young and hardworking single person who is trying to help her family move forward, and her wish is to in time have a shop where she can sell a variety of jams and jellies.  She feels very glad for the institution and the opportunity they have given her and the offer of a loan.

loans.use: to buy fruits and sugar in order to make jams.

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora Maura, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Sol Naciente” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú, nuestra socia tiene un restaurante, Maura invertirá el préstamo solicitado para comprar insumos como víveres en general para capitalizar su restaurante.
Maura está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle seguir con su comercio y por apoyarla con su familia.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Maura is a group member with the community bank “Sol Naciente” from the city of Cusco, Perú.  This member has a restaurant.  Maura will invest the loan monies in buying comestibles like general produce to stock up her restaurant.

Maura is very thankful to Kiva for allowing her to continue in her line of work and supporting her and her family.

This member is thankful for the loan and promises to complete her payments of the loan is strict accordance with the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy comestibles like rice in bulk for her restaurant.

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes de este comité se dedican a variadas actividades. La  mayoría   son madres de familia y  cabezas de hogar por lo que día a día se sacrifican mucho para salir adelante. Este comité se encuentra en su 14º ciclo y desean poder llegar al máximo nivel del programa por medio de su esfuerzo.
Celina es miembro de este grupo, ella se dedica al reciclado de plásticos, cartones, aluminio y demás, con lo cual mantiene a su familia. Ella está muy orgullosa de lo que hace, ya que es un trabajo digno y honesto con el que ha podido salir adelante.
Solicita el crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de cartones, plásticos y demás, los cuales desea poder revender y de esa forma tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
The members of this communal bank work in various businesses. The majority are mothers of families and heads of households, and so every day they make many sacrifices to advance. This group is in its 14th loan cycle, and they want to reach the highest level of the program through their efforts.

Celina is a member of this group. She recycles plastic, cardboard, aluminum, and other materials, and with this she supports her family. She is very proud of what she does, since it is dignified and honest work through which she has been able to advance.

She is applying for the loan so that she can invest it in the purchase of cardboard, plastic, and other items, which she wants to be able to resell and in this way have greater earnings.

loans.use: to buy cardboard, plastic, and other materials.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is a young entrepreneur who began, at a very young age, to work as a hired motorcycle operator. Slowly he started saving money. Thanks to the experience that he acquired, he decided to purchase a motorcycle for business purposes to progress financially. With his own business, he has had the opportunity to generate a better income for his household, allowing his 3-year-old son to have a better quality of life.

Since he wants to provide better services and maximize profits, Juma is looking for a loan to service his motorcycle and purchase new tires. This will allow him to have better income in his business and, little by little, he will continue to improve the quality of life in his household and have better financial opportunities to progress. Juma's biggest dream is to have a retail shop.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle and purchase new tires

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is married to Mwatele and they have 5 children, all still in primary school. Chizi has a well-stocked store, a business she began with some money that she had saved from her previous job. With the money she earns from this job, Chizi is able to cover the household costs and provide for her children's education.

Chizi explains that she has requested this loan because the only way of being able to develop the business is through loans, since it is very difficult to secure sufficient capital through other means. She wants to use the loan to buy rice, flour, noodles, sugar, and other basic foods. Chizi is a very responsible person who wants to succeed. She has a jovial spirit and is enterprising.

loans.use: to buy rice, flour, noodles, sugar, and other basic foods.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia sells clothing for women and men. This is the sole means of support for herself and her family. She tells us that she begins her work day very early every day, returning home when it is very late. Her goal for her business is for it to allow her to be able to get ahead and give her family a proper and honorable life.

Sophia is from Samburu, Kenya. She is a returning client of Yehu Microfinance, and has always fulfilled her obligations very well.

She wants to continue to invest in her business so that it will continue to  flourish and expand.

Sophia is requesting this loan in order to buy a variety of types of clothing items so that she will be able to fill her customers' orders. She thanks Yehu Microfinance for the opportunity it is offering her, since receiving this loan will be a big help.

loans.use: to buy clothing to offer for sale

loans.name: Puth

texts.en:
Puth is a vendor selling vegetables in a local market to supplement her husband’s income. Through her effort, Puth hopes to provide opportunities of education to her three dependent children. Puth has been in this business for four years and she is able to earn in the vicinity of KHR 14,000 each day. Puth is now 36 years old and is married to Men, her husband, who works as a paid worker in a plantation and also a tractor operator. 

Puth needs a vehicle to support her selling business. Due to not having one, she has had a lot of expenses in transferring her vegetables to the marketplaces. In connection with this, she decided to take out additional capital of KHR 2,500,000 to purchase a used motorcycle that is connected to a trailer in the back. Puth is very happy with the given loan because it has a positive impact on her current business. She will be able to transport a greater amount of vegetables at a time.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for her vegetable selling business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a client of Yehu. She lives in her own home, in the village of Samburu, together with her husband and one child. Elizabeth has been in the sewing business for more than four years and has a good, well-established customer base. She also sells clothes independently. She would like to take out a new loan to buy fabric since she has an offer and would like to make the most of the rainy season.

Elizabeth's business will make better income for her family and help her to enjoy a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fabric for her sewing business.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 30-year-old divorced man and father of one son. He lives in Tiribe, coastal Kenya. To accommodate his household expenses and provide a decent living for his son, Hassan decided to start a goat meat business where he sells animals at the market. In addition, he has a small garden in his home where he grows a variety of vegetables. 
Now he wants to focus on his business, so he is applying for a loan from Kiva’s partner, Yehu. He intends to use the money to buy five goats. In the future, he intends to further grow the business and open a butchery.

This is Hassan’s first loan with Yehu and he is optimistic about it. With his serious hard work, he is positive that his business diversity and growth will generate more revenues for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy five goats

loans.name: Brenda Maria

texts.es: Brenda Maria de 32 años de edad soltera sin hijos, tiene por, actividad economica servicio de transporte selectivo ( taxi)  y mercaderia en general, desde hace 8 años,  el cual esta ubicado de forma ambulante, el financiamiento lo quiere para comprar  repuesto para la unidad de taxi e invertir en mercaderia en general como: pantalones, camisas, short, blusas, sabanas, zapatos, toallas, jugos de sabanas entre otros
texts.en: Brenda Maria is 32 years old. She is single and has no children. Her business activities are transportation service (taxi) and general merchandise. She has been selling as a walking vendor for 8 years. She wants a loan to buy replacement parts for her taxi and to invest in general merchandise such as pants, shirts, shorts, blouses, sheets, shoes, towels, sets of sheets, and other items.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for her taxi and invest in general merchandise such as pants, shirts, shorts, blouses, sheets, shoes, towel, and sheet sets, among other items.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a farmer and a mother of four adult children. She has been in farming for over forty years and currently runs her farm with the help of one farmhand and produces bananas, maize and avocados.

Jane has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a chuff cutter (animal feed cutter) which will ease the feeding of her dairy cow and in turn improve the milk production capacity. She will use the additional income to improve the business and her living standards.

She reiterates she will maximize the benefits of the loan to ensure she attains financial security.

loans.use: To buy a chuff cutter

loans.name: Jemima

texts.en:
Jemima is married and has one child who attends school. She has operated a home-based poultry business for 4 years, selling chickens to established customers. Her husband works as a businessman. In this way, they all pitch in to meet the family expenses.

Jemima is asking for this loan in order to buy chicks, which she can buy at better prices in quantity, and feed for the animals. This will also allow her to do better business. She also wants to buy flour, sugar, and other ingredients in order to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy chicks, feed and supplies.

loans.name: Munavara

texts.en: Munavara is a clever woman with a high degree of education. She has worked in many places but her salary was very small, so she decided 2 years ago to start her own business. She is now a successful businesswoman who sells women's clothes. Munavara has her own selling place in the local market and a lot of customers. Her experiences have helped her develop her business but her income is still small, so she needs your help. She has no husband to help her. Her 3 children have no money and can’t support her. Munavara is asking for a loan to buy goods for the new season. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy goods for the new season

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married and has one child; she’s from Samburu. Elizabeth buys and sells all sorts of products to neighbors in her area and on order. She comments that she’s been able to gradually expand her micro business thanks to the loans from the institution. She says that through this business she can help her husband with household expenses and to support their children. The sacrifice she makes is for her family and that’s why she puts such effort into it.

Elizabeth has asked for this loan to buy merchandise such as sheets, blankets, clothes and other items to stock up and have a good variety to offer her customers. She thanks Yehu Microfinance for the opportunity it gives her because the loan will be of much help to her.

loans.use: to buy sheets, clothes, blankets and other products.

loans.name: Nyambula

texts.en:
Nyambula is married and has four children. She has had a store on the main street in Samburu for about the last seven years. Nyambula tells us that she started her store because this business seemed to her to be a very profitable one. Two years after she opened, she feels very happy with her customer base, but has ambitions to grow it a little further and so grow her business.

She is requesting the help of Yehu Microfinance and Kiva for the purchase of fruits, potatoes, and green vegetables for her store. She knows that this will help her greatly in her micro-enterprise.

loans.use: to purchase fruits, potatoes, green vegetables

loans.name: Kum

texts.en:
Kum, aged 47, is raising five children. Kum does various kinds of farm work on her own farm to provide for her children's basic necessities. For an additional income for the family, Kum acts as a paid laborer working in potato plantations of local villagers. However, her husband is still the main income provider of the family, providing motorcycle repair services to people in his community.

Due to inadequate capital for home repair and for the purchase of timbers, Kum now is requesting a loan in the amount of KHR 2,000,000. She hopes to provide good living conditions for her family with the help of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase timbers for repairing her house.

loans.name: Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
Niño Jesús se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Itá donde todas las miembros son mujeres trabajadoras y luchadoras que se esfuerzan por dar lo mejor a los suyos y ayudarse las unas a las otras.
Katherin es parte de este trabajador grupo, y nos cuenta que por medio de la venta de lencería que hace esta pudiendo ayudar a su familia y sentirse útil. Tiene muchos sueños y metas y es por ellos que siempre se esfuerza al máximo.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de lencerías, como para hombre y mujeres y de esa forma poder seguir trabajando y estar cada vez más cerca de sus metas y sueños.
texts.en:
"Niño Jesús" is the name of this excellent group of women located in the city of Itá. The members are hard-working women who strive to give the best to their own and to help one another.
Katherin is part of this hard-working group. She tells us that she is able to help her family and feel useful by selling lingerie. She has many dreams and goals; for this reason, she always gives one hundred percent.
She is requesting this loan for the purchase of lingerie for men and women. This way, she will be able to continue working and get closer and closer to her goals.

loans.use: to buy lingerie for men and women for sale.

loans.name: Walter Antonio

texts.es:
Walter, es propietario de un microbús escolar, hace tres años adquirió este  negocio de transporte, teniendo ya definidos los estudiantes a quienes tiene que llevar y traer de la escuela, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 10 y 6 años de edad.

Ésta solicitando un préstamo para completar la reparación de un microbús, en el cual realizan los viajes estudiantiles, el préstamo le ayudara para el pago de mecánico y en la compra de algunos repuestos que sean necesarios, con esto podrá brindar un servicio más seguro a sus clientes con una mejor comodidad y evitando cualquier percance.

El objetivo de él es a futuro a través de la rentabilidad del negocio, poder adquirir una nueva unidad de transporte que le ayude a mejorar ingresos.
texts.en:
Walter owns a mini school bus which he acquired three years ago, with the students he would be driving to school already identified. He lives with his wife and two children ages 6 and 10. He is requesting a loan for repairs for his school bus. This loan will help him to pay the mechanic and to buy some necessary spare parts. With this, he will be able to offer a safer, more comfortable service to his clients and avoid any mishaps.
His goal for the future, for when his business is more profitable, is to acquire a new vehicle to help him improve his income.

loans.use: to pay the mechanic and buy spare parts.

loans.name: Ismoilhuja

texts.en:
Ismoilhuja runs a minibus transportation business. For more than eight years, this very hard-working man has offered transportation services to members of the local community. 

Since he is very smart and cheerful, his business has been developing year by year. He is very good-natured and his customers appreciate that quality. He has a lot of friends, and often meets with them after his workday is over to talk about the news of the town. He is also a loving husband and the caring father of two children. 

Ismoilhuja wants to support his family with all modern conveniences, but his income is not sufficient to allow for making much-needed repairs to the family home at this time. He is requesting a loan to buy building materials for repairing the family house. 

He is grateful for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy building materials for making essential repairs to the family house

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is married and has six children. She used to sell vegetables and fruits. In 2003, she was able to use her savings to open a small store within her home.

Now Joyce manages her small store and has steady customers. Most of her neighbors buy from her. Joyce is characterized as one who puts forth a lot of effort and this is how she obtained everything she has. One of her dreams is to have a somewhat larger store where she can have more merchandise and attract more customers.

Joyce is asking for this loan in order to stock her store with food, drinks, noodles, and various other items in order to satisfy her customer demand.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her store.

loans.name: Peterson

texts.en:
Peterson is 28 years old and married. He supplies water to earn a living and also does livestock farming. Peterson has been in this business for four years and employs one person.

Peterson had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya, which helped him to grow his business. He has also improved on his saving skills because he has been trained in financial management. He dreams of expanding his business in the future. Peterson needs a loan of 50,000 KES to buy a water tank.

loans.use: To buy a water tank

loans.name: Irish

texts.en: Irish, 32 years old, is from Corella, Bohol. She is married and has one son who is 3 years old. Irish works in a pension house while also raising hogs for an income. She is asking for a loan to buy feed, piglets and supplements for her hogs. This will help her to increase the number of hogs that she is raising and be assured that they will grow healthy and profitable in a few months. Her income will be for the family's daily consumption, savings and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy feed, piglets and supplements

loans.name: Ebelio Vidal

texts.es: Ebelio Vidal de 42 años de edad de chinandega, el cual se desempeña como maestro de obra, casado con tres hijos menores de edad, esta solicitando el financiamiento para la construccion de un cuarto, el cual quiere realizarlas desde hace varios años, Ebelio ya ha tenido creditos con fundacion el cual ha demostrado su responsabilidad y solvencia de pagos, los financiamiento que fundacion y el programa kiva le han brindado han sido de mucho beneficio para construir poco a poco su vivienda, el esta solicitando el financiamiento para comprar  material de construccion como: bloques, arena, cemento zinc, clavos, piedrin, hierro, alambre, entre otros.
texts.en: Ebelio Vidal, age 42, is from Chinandega. He is a foreman, married with three young children. He is requesting a loan so that he can build a room; he has wanted to do this for several years. Ebelio has already taken out loans from the Fundacion and has demonstrated his responsibility and solvency. His loans from the Fundacion and Kiva have been very helpful for him in building his home bit by bit. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of construction material such as: blocks, sand, cement, zinc, nails, gravel, iron, wire, and other items.

loans.use: to buy: blocks, sand, cement, zinc, nails, gravel, iron, wire, and other items.

loans.name: Virgen De Guadalupe Group

texts.es:
El comité Virgen de Guadalupe, se conformó con la iniciativa de una de las miembros. Actualmente se encuentran  en el segundo ciclo, con diez miembros.  El grupo empezó, demostrando unión y solidaridad entre las compañeras; quienes poseen actividad  económica y son muy trabajadoras.
Norma forma parte del grupo, y ella cuenta que se dedica a la peluquería, tiene un modesto salón de belleza donde da todo tipo de servicios a quienes acuden a su negocio.  Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y con ganas de salir adelante y ser alguien en la vida por medio de su trabajo.
Solicita el crédito para poder surtir su local con spray, shampoo, enjuagues, cremas, gel y demás insumos, ya que quiere poder seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Virgen of Guadalupe committee was formed through the initiative of one of its group.  There are ten members and they are in their second cycle.  The group began by showing unity and support among the women who all have businesses and are very hard-working.
Norma is a member and she has a modest beauty shop where she offers all types of services to those who come.  She is a very hard-working woman with desires to get ahead and to be someone in her life through her business.
She is requesting the loan to supply her shop with spray, shampoo, rinses, creams, gels and more items since since she wants to be able to give good service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy spray, shampoo, rinses, creams, gels and more items

loans.name: Chin

texts.en:
Chin, age 58, is a domestic farmer who has been living in the Baray District of Kompong Thom province.

From her current business, Chin is able to make an income around $5 US dollars each day. She uses her income for other expenses for the entire family. Chin’s husband is the primary person to generate finances. Besides assisting Chin with her farming business, he additionally works as a wooden house construction worker.

The couple is blessed with four single children, three of whom are employed in a variety of jobs in order to help and support them for daily expenses. Chin will be using her loan to buy a plot of farmland from a relative so that she can enlarge her crop-planting business.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland on which she can grow seasoning crops.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a single mother of six children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members.

Jane has a business of a bakery and sells to all categories of people on retail. She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) to buy more cooking oil, baking flour, cow peas (black-eyed peas), and charcoal. She has been in this business for 10 years and works 6 days a week.  Besides this bakery business she generates additional income through selling piped water and raising pigs.

Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality. She aspires of seeing her business grow big so that she becomes a wholesaler, and also of building rental rooms. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil, baking powder, and cow peas.

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.en:
Ignacia raises pigs to make a living. She is a very hard-working woman who has been engaged in this work for the past 30 years. She and her husband have three children. Her husband is a farmer. Their combined income is sometimes not sufficient for the family's needs. 

Due to recent financial difficulties, Ignacia has not been able to provide proper nutrition for her pigs. She is therefore asking for a loan in order to buy pig feed. By offering them a higher volume of pig feed, she can be assured of a better return on her investment. 

She will use her income to ensure a healthy diet for her family and to reinvest in her pig-raising business.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs

loans.name: Taing Oun's Group

texts.en:
Taing Oun, aged 37 years, is originally from a village of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has three children, one son and two daughters, all of them still dependent and in school. To make a living, Taing Oun has been farming rice for four years and her husband is a taxi driver. Together, they earn about 16,000 KHR per day.

This is the first loan with VisionFund for Taing Oun’s group of two, who are applying for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, Taing Oun is going to use her portion to pay for car repairs. She hopes that this loan will enable her to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To pay for car repairs

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Vy's Group

texts.en:
Vy, 32 years old, is a rural villager from the Sampov Meas district of Pursat province, Cambodia. She is a married mother of three daughters, all still dependent and in school. To earn a living, Vy has been involved in rice farming for twenty years. She has supplemented her income by raising pigs for four years and selling grocery items for one year. Vy also sometimes works for others for pay. She is able to earn approximately 22,500 KHR per day from her current businesses.
