Vy’s group consists of two female members. She has been with VisionFund for three cycles and has completely repaid her past loans, while the other member has been with VisionFund for two cycles. Vy's previous loans have enabled her to afford to buy basic household necessities for her family. She is now leading this group to apply for a loan of KHR 1,000,000 each. Vy will use her portion of this loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland and to buy more grocery items for selling. She hopes that her crop business will become profitable so as to earn more income to support her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Sinat's Group

texts.en:
Sinat, 29 years old, lives in a rural village in the Sa Ang district province, Cambodia. She is married and has no children yet. To make a living, she has been working in the rice fields for twenty years, earning about 17,800 KHR per day. Sinat's main challenge is lack of capital for her rice field business.

Sinat’s group consists of four members, all female. She and two other members have been with VisionFund for one cycle and the fourth is just starting out with VisionFund. Sinat completely repaid her last loan. She used it successfully to better support her family. As the group leader, Sinat is going to use her portion of this loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to grow her business so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Sarim's Group

texts.en:
Sarim, 41 years old, lives in a rural area located in the Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province. She is married and has one son, who is dependent on her and still in school. Sarim has been a rice farmer for 25 years, earning about 12,500 KHR per day.

Sarim’s group consists of two female members who are first-time borrowers with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Sarim is requesting a loan of 200,000 KHR and Meth is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. As the group leader, Sarim is going to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will help her to earn more income to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao, age 57, is a rice farmer. She has been working in the rice field for 50 years. Mao is able to earn about US $26 per day from her current business to help meet the family’s needs. Her husband earns an income by offering battery-charging services. They have five children, two of whom are still their dependents. The family lives in the Kror Lanh district of Siem Reap province in Cambodia. 

Mao has been working with Kiva’s partner VisionFund for two cycles and has successfully paid back her loans. These past loans have helped her to successfully pay the fees related to her children’s education. 

She is requesting a new loan in the amount of $1,000 US dollars. She will use part of her loan to buy fertilizers and part of it to fix the battery charger so as to allow the family's battery-charging business to continue to generate income. She is confident that this loan will enable her to grow these two businesses so that she can help to improve the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to fix the battery charger so as to allow the family's battery-charging business to continue to generate income

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Kror Lanh district

loans.name: Heang's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural area of the Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, Heang is a 63-year-old widower. He is the father of one son who works as a phone repairer to make a living. 

Rice farming has been the only source for earning a living and for his family’s income for forty years. The main challenge is the lack of water supply for the crop yields in his business.

Heang is the group leader of three members who live in the same village. Now he is leading his group to apply for the first microloan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. 

As the group leader, he is going to use his portion to buy fertilizers for his farmland and use a portion of it to buy materials for his son’s business. He hopes this loan will enable his family to make more income to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a single mother of four children. None of her children go to school. She has been in her business for 20 years. She has a business selling mats, handwoven caps and baskets. She has applied for a loan of 1,200,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more baskets, mats and handwoven caps. She goes from door-to-door selling those crafts and works six days a week. Mary generates additional income by selling tomatoes. Her major business challenges include the rainy season and thieves. She hopes to see her business grow big so that she can own a permanent place for it.  

Mary lives in her own house. Her family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include food for feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more baskets, mats and handwoven caps.

loans.name: Chayleat's Group

texts.en:
Chayleat is 41 years old and married.  She lives in a rural villager in the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has two daughters who are dependent and in school. 

To earn a living, Chayleat has been farming rice for sixteen years, earning about 16,500 KHR per day.  Lacking a water supply for her farmland is her main challenge. 

Chayleat is leading her group of three female members who are applying for the first micro loan from VisionFund for 1,000,000 KHR each.  As the group leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and for a fee to carry water into her rice field.  She hopes to earn more income to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and spend for a fee to carry water into her rice field.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Savin's Group

texts.en:
Savin is 48 years old man living in a rural village of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province.  He has four children, three (one daughter and two sons) of whom are still dependent. 

He has been farming rice to support her family for twenty years.  The main challenge is a lack of water for the farmland.  Savin earns about 10,000KHR per day.
. 
Savin is leading the group of two to apply for their first micro loan from VisionFund of KHR1,000,000 each.  Savin will use his portion to buy fertilizer and to pump water into the farmland.  He hopes to make more income to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pump water into the farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Naiheng's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural area located in the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Naiheng is 62 years old, married and has two sons. 

To earn a living, she has been involved in rice farming for forty years, to support her family.  She is able to earn about 21,000 KHR per day.  Low prices of her rice products are her main challenge.  

Naiheng’s group consists of two women who live in the same village.  She is leading her group's application for 1,000,000KHR each.  She is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and for labor.  Naiheng hopes to earn more income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland and for labor.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Channy's Group

texts.en:
Sinat is 29 years old, living in a rural village of the Sa Ang district province of Cambodia.  She is married and has not children, yet. 

To make a living, she has worked in the rice field for twenty years.  She is able to earn about 17,800 KHR per day.  Her main challenge is a lack of capital to run her rice field business.

Sinat’s group consists of four women, and she has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle.  Two members have been with VisionFund for one cycle and the other is just with VisionFund.  Sinat completely paid back the past loan.  She used her first loan to support her family.

Now Sinat is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund.  As the group leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland.  She hopes to grow her business so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Brigildo

texts.en:
Brigildo is 49 year old and from the town of Baclayon, Bohol.  He is a food vending.  He bakes cakes and pastries and delivers to his customers and other bakeries for resale. 

Brigildo is asking for a loan to buy ingredients such as flour, sugar, margarine, cooking oil, baking powder and flavorings to bake his cakes. The loan will allow Brigildo to have ample time to focus on his production without having to worry about additional capital for his ingredients. 

Brigildo will be able to buy nutritious food for his family and reinvest in his business out of his profit.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, margarine, cooking oil, baking powder and flavorings to bake his cakes.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 29-year-old lady from Kisumu and is married to Cosmas. They have two children aged 10 and one year, but they also support Ruth's nieces aged 25, 20, and 19 years.

Ruth sells window curtains and nets, a business she has been doing for the last six months and makes a monthly income of KES 5,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to add stock of nets and window curtains. Her profits will be used to venture into a clothing business.

Her dream is to be successful in business.

loans.use: to buy stock of window curtains and nets

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 30-year-old environmentally conscious man from Kisumu City and is married to Maureen. They have two children aged six and three years.

John sells tree seedlings and owns a plantation. He has been in this business for the last two years and makes a monthly income of KES 10,000. He is now taking his second loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to add stock of a variety of tree seedlings. His profits will be used to open other businesses. 

His dream is to give his children the best education.

loans.use: to buy stock of tree seedlings for his plantation

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 47 years old, from Ndunyu Njeru, and is married to Lydia. They have five children who are all in school.

Joseph is a farmer and has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy a heifer. He will also buy fertilizers and seeds that will be used in his farm.

He hopes to become the leading dairy farmer in his area.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and a heifer

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is 31 years old from Panglao, Bohol. She is married with five children. Her eldest is 13 years old while her youngest is 3 months old. Jane is engaged in a sari-sari store business. She started this business 4 years ago. She sells basic household commodities like seasoning, canned goods, and items in sachets like coffee, soft drinks, snack foods, and candies. She is asking for a loan to buy additional stock of canned goods, noodles, and snack food. She will then use her profit to buy school supplies for her children and a healthy diet for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of canned goods, noodles, and snack food

loans.name: Pelagia

texts.en: From Dauis, Bohol Philippines, 68-year-old Pelagia makes and sells polvoron (powdered milk candy made of flour, sugar, butter and powdered milk) and tablea (cacao chocolate) to earn an income. She also raises hogs. Pelagia is requesting a loan to buy flour, cacao and piglets, saying that a loan will make a big difference in her business profits. She hopes to increase her productivity and to have a bigger market for her products in the future.

loans.use: to buy flour, cacao and piglets.

loans.name: Mwanapili

texts.en:
Mwanapili is married and a mother to four sons and three daughters. Her husband is a worker who earns a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's needs.

Mwanapili operates a goat meat business and has a good reputation among her loyal customers. She wants to increase her monthly income, so she is requesting a Ksh 40,000 loan from Yehu to help her purchase goats for sale. This will offer Mwanapili and her family suitable living standards.
She currently lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

loans.use: to purchase goats for sale

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a 29-year-old lady from Kisumu, is married to Peter, and they have three children aged one, three, and nine years old.

Hellen sells items like carved soapstones, sculptures, and mats, a business she has been doing for the last 10 years and makes a monthly income of KES 20,000. She is now taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy beads for making bracelets.

Her dream is to be successful in her business.

loans.use: to buy beads for making bracelets

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 40-year-old lady from Nyalenda Kisumu and is married to Joseph. They have five children aged between four to 18 years old.

Alice is a fish monger, a business she has been doing for the last eight years and makes a monthly income of KES 12,000. She is now taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy stock of fresh fish for sale.

She will use the profits to open a clothes-selling business. Her dream is to be a successful business lady.

loans.use: to buy stock of fresh fish for sale

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en: Jonathan is 33 years old and married with two children. The eldest child is 7 years old and the youngest is 5. He runs a small piggery business in Corella, Bohol. He started his livelihood just last year. He dreams of prospering in his business. He also hopes to have a bigger barn and raise more pigs for an income. At the moment, he would like to start and concentrate on his small barn and take care of his animals. He is asking for a loan to buy supplements and feed necessary for his hogs to be healthy. Whatever income he gets from growing pigs will benefit his family in terms of food and his children's educations.

loans.use: to buy supplements and feed for his pigs

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is a 23-year-old lady from Kisumu and is married to Amos. They have four children aged between ten months and seven years.

Doris sells household items like wall nets and window curtains, a business she has done for the last five years and makes a monthly income of KES 12,000. 

She is currently taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy more stock of window curtains and nets. She plans to use her profits to open a fish-selling business. Her dream is to be a successful business lady.

loans.use: to buy stock of wall nets and curtains

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence, a married mother of four children who all attend school, also takes care of her sister and brother. She resides in her own house, but the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

A seller of bananas for 10 years, Florence generates additional income selling cabbages. Working seven days a week, her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves.

Florence is now requesting a loan of 800000 from MCDTSACCO to buy more bunches of bananas. She aspires to see her business grow bigger so that she can start selling to neighboring villages and educate her children to university level.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en: Magdalena is 38 years old and from Corella, Bohol. She is married with five children. Her husband works as a farmer and a carpenter. Magdalena helps in their household by farming coconuts and by cooking rice cakes for sale. She then sells her food in the neighborhood for a profit. She is asking for a loan to buy firewood, charcoal, rice, and sugar. The income that she generates from her business will be used for the family's daily consumption and school feedings. In the future, she hopes to have other business options so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy firewood, charcoal, rice, and sugar

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is a single mother of six children and all her children go to school. She has a business of selling used clothes and sells to all categories of people through retail. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes.  

She has been in this business for two years. She generates additional income by selling piped water and poultry farming. Her major business challenges include seasonality and paying school fees for her children. She is aspiring to import used clothes and also to build her own house. The family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Sussan

texts.en:
Sussan is 43 years old, married, and has three sons and three daughters. She lives in the neighborhood of Tiribe.

For more than four years, she has managed her own business of selling vegetables in a small stall, which is located in her home. Sussan has always enjoyed the trade and previously farmed for a living.

She is requesting a loan of 10,000 KES so that she can invest in the purchase of tomatoes, cabbages, onions, etc. This will help maintain the inventory of her business and result in more earnings. Her goal is to continue working so that her business can grow and she can later open a kiosk. On a personal level, she hopes to develop as a businesswoman and have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, cabbages, onions, etc. for selling

loans.name: Tsuma

texts.en:
Tsuma makes a living selling cows at the market. He lives with his wife and six children and has been in this business for three years.

Currently he is requesting a loan to buy two cows for his business. Tsuma's goals are to improve his business and open a shop so he can help his family get ahead. Tsuma lives in his own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Thanks to his efforts, he has managed to take his children to school. Thanks for your support.

loans.use: to buy a cow for his business

loans.name: Renalwa

texts.en: Renalwa is 62 years old from Baclayon, Bohol. She is married with two grown children. Her husband is a fisherman, while Renalwa attends to her store. Her business has been in existence for quite some time. She is asking for a loan to buy items like bread, sugar, seasoning, toiletries, detergent, and canned goods. She knows that an increase to her business will produce a better profit for her business. The income will support her household needs like payment of electricity and food for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like bread, sugar, seasoning, toiletries, detergent, and canned goods

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is married and the mother of three children who go to school. They live comfortably in their own house, though it has no electricity, nor does it have piped water. She doesn't support anyone besides her immediate family. She operates a motorcycle business and has hired someone to operate her motorcycle. Her challenges are the high cost of living and paying for her children's education.

Saumu will use this loan to buy spare parts and do general servicing of her motorcycle. In the future, she hopes to open a retail shop and also make sure that she has educated all her children. To do this, she promises to make payments on time so she can request more loans from Yehu.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and do general servicing of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Thon

texts.en:
Thon is a widow with eight children, six of whom depend on her. Some of her children are helping the family's business, while some are working for others for a fee.

Thon has a two hectare area of farmland for growing rice and planting cassava. It has been 26 years that she has been involved in this business and she is able to earn about 73,000 Cambodia Riels (KHR) per day.

This is the third loan for Thon with KIVA partner VisionFund. The past two loans that she successfully repaid back enabled her to support her family with daily expenses better than before. Now she, in a confident manner, is seeking a new loan of 4,000,000 KHR to lease an additional plot of land to grow cassava as well as buying cassava plants. Moreover, she will also use some portion of her loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to grow her cash crop healthfully so that she receives more crop yield to sell.

loans.use: To buy an additional plot of land for growing cassava; cassava plants; and fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is 44 years old and has a fish selling business. Since she got married, this has been her source of livelihood. Her husband works hard as a fisherman, and to be a good partner to him Estela sells what he catches. Estela needs to support her 11 children out of her income.

Estela is asking for a loan to buy gasoline and to repair their fishing net. Her income from fish vending will support her childrens' needs like food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and repair her fishing net.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi resides in Coast Province, Kenya. She has been selling milk for some time. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Umazi is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to purchase more milk for resale. This money will help her generate additional income to support their family. 

In the future, she would like to open a milk depot and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for her family. This is her second loan with both Yehu and Kiva, and she hopes to pay it on time and secure another one so as to move forward.

loans.use: to purchase more milk for resale.

loans.name: Marcia

texts.es:
Marcia forma parte del Banco Comunal “Esperanza Requinoa” perteneciente a la ciudad de Rancagua.
Ella se dedica al rubro de arrendar habitaciones, específicamente a empresas y turistas. Se dedica desde hace 3 años, comenta que trabaja sola de lunes  a domingo y su horario de trabajo lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad. Arrienda 7 habitaciones y se encarga de mantener las habitaciones y baños limpios, para cuando lleguen los arrendatarios que en algunas oportunidades se quedan semanas.
Su mercadería e insumos que va necesitando para la ropa de cama los compra en la ciudad de Santiago a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente, y los muebles como veladores, camas, en la ciudad de Rancagua
Con el crédito comprará sabanas, frazadas, plumones, veladores, lámparas, toallas, para abastecer su negocio.
Una de las metas de Marcia es hacer un hospedaje, donde pueda recibir a más gente y agregar a cada habitación televisores, y también hacer mas baños, para generar más ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Marcia vive junto a su esposo quien la ayuda en los arriendos de las habitaciones. Sus sueños son poder ampliarse y sacar la patente correspondiente para empezar luego a funcionar con su hospedería.
Marcia está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito y servicios otorgados por Fondo Esperanza. Además comenta que se siente muy cómoda con las reuniones y grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que existe generosidad y unidad.
Rancagua pertenece a la región del Libertador Bernardo O´Higgins. Es una moderna ciudad que regula el principal proceso productivo y exportador agrofrutícola y vitivinícola de Chile. Es también una ciudad minera, debido a que en su cordillera se encuentra la mina subterránea más grande del mundo “El Teniente”, con 4.500 km. de túneles
texts.en:
Marcia is part of the communal bank “Esperanza Requinoa” in the city of Rancagua.
She makes her living renting rooms, specifically to business people and tourists.  She has been running her business for 3 years.  She works alone from Monday to Sunday but is able to spread out her working hours according to her availability.  She rents out 7 rooms, which she keeps made up, and she keeps the bathrooms clean for when the renters come, some of whom stay for weeks.
Marcia purchases her bed linen merchandise and supplies at low cost in Santiago, which is financially prudent.  The furniture, like night stands and beds, she purchases in Rancagua.
With the loan, Marcia will purchase sheets, blankets, quilts, night stands, lamps and towels to keep her business stocked.
One of her goals is to expand as an inn.  She would house more people, add TV sets to each room and have more bathrooms.  This would generate more income and allow her a better quality of life.
Marcia lives with her husband, who helps her make up the rooms.  Her dreams are to expand and register to function as an inn.  
Marcia is very happy and grateful about the loan and services granted by Fondo Esperanza.  In addition, she says that she feels very comfortable at the meetings and with the members of the communal bank, as there is a lot of generosity and unity.
Rancagua belongs to the "Libertador Bernardo O´Higgins" region of Chile.  It's a modern city that controls the main production process of Chile's export fruit and wine.  Rancagua is also a mining city.  Its mountain range holds the worlds largest subterranean mine, "El Teniente” (The Lieutenant), which has 4,5000 km. of tunnels.

loans.use: to purchase sheets, blankets, quilts, night stands, lamps and towels.

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es:
Fidel, se dedica a la siembra de maíz, desde hace 15 años está realizando labores agrícolas, además él es empleado de seguridad, realizando las dos actividades para un mejor funcionamiento en su hogar, él vive con su esposa y tres hijos de 17, 13 y 10 años de edad, el trabajo agrícola lo realiza a través de mozos.

Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de abonos y herbicidas, que son necesarios para aplicarlos al proceso de la siembra, ya que le previene las plagas y le ayuda a fortalecer la producción, este préstamo le dará los recursos necesarios para que Fidel realice la compra de los materiales y los aplique al tiempo debido.

Su aspiración es tener resultados positivos en las cosechas, que sea abundante y sana, que le permita realizar ventas para obtener ganancias.
texts.en:
Fidel devotes himself to corn planting and he has been doing agricultural work for the last fifteen years.  Additionally, he works in security, working two jobs for the better functionality of his home.  He lives with his wife and three children ages 17, 13 and 10 years old.  The children take part in the agricultural work.

He requests a loan for the purchase of fertilizers and herbicides, which are necessary to implement the planting process since they prevent pests and help to strengthen the corn production.  This loan will give him the necessary resources so that Fidel can purchase the materials and apply them within the proper time frame.

His aspiration is to have positive results with the crops so that they are abundant and healthy, which will enable him to make sales for profit.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides and herbicides.

loans.name: Ivania Del Rosario

texts.es: Ivania del Rosario de 41 años de edad, casado con dos hijos menores de edad, tinene por actividad economica  servicio de videos juegos ubicado en su casa de habitacion desde hace 8 años,herramienta de trabajo que la incio buscando un medio de cómo subsitir y poder ayudar con los gastos de la familia, en la actulidad el negocio le ha sido rentable, gracias a su esfuerzo y tenacidad y el apoyo que leon 2000 y el programa kiva le brinda a personas de escasos recursos para tener un medio de vida. El fiannciamiento lo quiere para invertir y compra equipo de trabajo como: televisores, nintendo, DVD, mueble de televisores, playstatay, entre otros.
texts.en: Ivania del Rosario is 41 years old, married and has two dependent children.  Her business for the last 8 years has been running a video game service out of her home.  She uses her tools of the trade as a way to subsidize and to help with the family expenses.  The business is currently profitable, thanks to her efforts and tenacity and to the help Leon 2000 and the Kiva Program offer to low-income people so they can earn a living.  She wants to invest the loan in the purchase of equipment for her business, like televisions, Nintendo, DVDs, TV stands, Play Stations and other items.

loans.use: to purchase:  televisions, Nintendo, DVDs, TV stands, Play Stations and other items.

loans.name: Sojida

texts.ru:
Сочида жительница района А. Джоми. Ей 53 года. Она живет вместе с мужем. У нее трое сыновей. Сыновья Сочиды работают и проживают в городе Кургантюбе. 
Сама Сочида вместе с мужем зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Она более 18 лет занимается этим видом деятельности. 
Сочида берет кредит для закупа телят и коров.
texts.en: Sojida lives in the A. Jomi Region. She is 53 years old. She lives together with her husband. She has three sons. Sojida's sons live and work in the town of Kurgan-tube. Sojida and her husband earn a living by raising cattle. Sojida has been in this line of business for several years. She is taking out a loan to buy calves and cows.

loans.use: to buy several heads of cattle.

loans.name: Boboali

texts.ru:
Бобоали родился 1959 году в районе А. Джоми. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Старшие сыновья Бобоали находятся на заработках за рубежом. 
Бобоали шесть лет проработал таксистом и водителем грузовых автомобилей. Он получал небольшую прибыль. Таким образом он занялся животноводством.
Бобоали уже 18 лет как занимается скотоводством. В основном он разводит крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. 
Бобоали берет кредит для закупа несколько голов бычков с целью увеличения поголовья крупного рогатого скота.
texts.en: Boboali was born in the A. Jomi region in 1959. He his married, with five children. His older sons are temporarily working abroad. For six years, Boboali used to work as a taxi and truck driver. His revenue was small. Then he turned to raising livestock. He has been in this line of business for 18 years now. He mainly raises cattle for later resale. Boboali is taking out a loan in order to buy several bulls so as to expand his livestock.

loans.use: to buy several bulls.

loans.name: Ndorna Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois de Ndorna a été créé le 17 Septembre 2011 lors l’inauguration du dit banc villageois. Il compte 45 femmes qui habitent toutes le même village. Elles  ont comme activité principale le petit comme, accompagné d’activité de maraichage durant l’hivernage.

Madame Kadia (assise à l’extrême droite dans la première rangée)  est l’emprunteuse vedette du  groupe. Elle est âgée de 28 ans, mariée et mère de 04 enfants : deux garçons et deux filles. Elle est vendeuse d’huile de palme, de sucre et de thé. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés hebdomadaires des villages environnants pour la revente en détail dans son village.

 Son nouveau prêt va lui permettre d’acheter du thé et sucre d’une valeur de 10 000 FCFA de l’huile de palme d’un montant de 25 000 FCFA. Que je renouvelle en augmentant la quantité achetée.

Les bénéfices lui permettront de subvenir en plus de ses propres besoins à celui de sa famille.
texts.en:
The Ndorna [group] was created on September 17, 2011, at the opening of its banc villageois. It includes 45 women living in the same village. The mainly work as vendors and also grow crops during the rainy season.

Mrs. Kadia (seated on the far right in the first row) is the group’s star borrower. She is 28 years old, married and has four children, two boys and two girls. She sells palm oil, sugar and tea. She stocks up a the local markets in nearby villages and then retails in her village.
Her new loan will allow her to purchase tea and sugar for 10,000 West African francs and palm oil for 25,000 francs. [She] needs to replenish and expand her stock. The revenues will allow her to take care not only of her own needs, but also of those of her family.

loans.use: to purchase tea and sugar for 10,000 West African francs and palm oil for 25,000 francs.

loans.name: Ma. Noemi

texts.en: Ma. Noemi is a resident of Baclayon, Bohol, a province in the Philippines. She is 43 years old, married and has two children aged 10 and 12. She is currently engaged in selling home-cooked food. She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients like meat, seasoning and vegetables. This way, she can help her husband, who is working in a printing business. Ma. Noemi is determined to make her business a success so that her children can have a better future. Her income will be for school fees and food for the family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, seasoning and vegetables

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 38 years old and lives in Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and blessed with four children.

She has been selling charcoal for more than four years, earning approximately Ksh 250 per day. Her husband is employed in the private sector.

Monica wants to restock her business. With this goal in mind, she is requesting a loan of Ksh 50,000 to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale. This money will help her provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and open a retail shop.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Ma. Juna

texts.en: Ma. Juna is a married woman and a mother to two children aged 6 and 11 years old. She is from Baclayon, Bohol. While her husband earns a living driving their tricycle, she is also engaged in making barbecue food for sale. This has been going on for 10 years now. She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients like meat, soy sauce, other seasonings and skewers. Ma. Juna is motivated to work hard so that her children can have a better future. Her income will be used to pay for school fees and family daily consumption.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, soy sauce, other seasonings and skewers

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is married with three children, who all go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She has a retail shop business and has been in this business for 2 years. She has applied for a loan of 500000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt and boxes of soap. She works seven days a week and sells on retail only. Besides this retail shop business she also makes and sells   necklaces. Juliet's major business challenges include thieves and the increasing price of commodities in Uganda. She aspires to see her business grow so that she owns a fully stocked retail shop. Juliet resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees, rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt and boxes of soap

loans.name: Protaciah

texts.en: Protaciah is 26 years old and single. Her home is located in Tiribe, in the coastal part of Kenya. She lives in her own home together with her sister who helps her operate a kiosk. Protaciah has been running this business for two years, dreaming of opening a hotel in the future. In order to continue consolidating her business, she would like to invest in renovating the business premises. She would also like to pay her school fees since she is in college. Protaciah would like to continue growing her business and improving her standard of living.

loans.use: to renovate her business premises and pay school fees

loans.name: Muli

texts.en:
Muli is a farmer in Tiribe, age 30 and single. He has been farming for five years and raises poultry on his small farm.  He sells his products from home.

Muli has requested a loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings from KIva field partner Yehu to buy chicks and chicken feeds. He says there is ready market for his chicken and chicken products. His main desire remains to become a wholesaler in future.

He says that the poor road network in the region remains a challenge to many farmers. He appreciates Yehu's efficiency in loan processing and thanks Kiva for their support.

loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken feeds.

loans.name: Moneera

texts.en:
Moneera is a 32-year-old married woman with three children.  She cares for her children with the help of her husband who works as a guard for a  government organization.
 
Moneera started selling blankets a few months ago at her house to add to her family's income and help pay the household bills.
She plans to use the proceeds of this loan to buy more blankets and bed covers.

loans.use: to buy blankets and bed covers.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 32-year-old married woman. Her husband is serving in the military.

Nancy opened a small convenience store where she sells snacks, food products, and home products. 

So far, she has been bringing in goods by order to avoid loss in the first stage. But now Nancy wants to increase the quantity she has in her inventory and bring in more food products and home products to serve the customers faster and expand her business. For that she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to bring in more food products and home products to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married with two children who go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members.  She lives in her own house and her family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include her children's school fees and the cost of food to feed her family    

Sarah has been retailing charcoal five years and sells to all kinds of people. She has applied for this loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings to buy more bags of charcoal. Sarah works seven days a week and she says her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality.

She hopes to see her business grow big so that she woudl be able to buy a delivery van to ease her transportation woes.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Buthaina

texts.en: Buthaina is a 52-year-old married woman caring for two sons and one daughter. She started making pickles, cheese and yogurt to sell to neighbors and friends. She also makes olive oil soap which is used a lot in small neighborhoods. Now Buthaina is working on starting up a small catering business making small dishes by order. She has applied for this loan in order to buy more ingredients for making traditional dishes.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for making traditional dishes.

loans.name: Kalygul

texts.ru:
Калыгул 49 лет, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей. Калыгул в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи,  с 1995 года занимается животноводством и  заготовкой и реализацией  сельхозпродукции. Начав этот бизнес с суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS), на сегодняшний  день  хозяйстве Калыгул имеется 2 дойные коровы, 1 рабочий конь, 10 овцематок, 5 коз,  и 3,34 га орошаемой земли , где она выращивает фасоль и многолетние травы, ежемесячная выручка составляет 8,000 сом в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Калыгул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку овцематок.  Доходы от кредита Калыгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Kalygul is 49 years old, she is married and is raising three children. Kalygul has been doing animal husbandry and preparation and sales of agriculture produce since 1995 as a main source of income for her family. She started this business with an amount of 10,000 som (KGS) and today Kalygul has two milk cows, one working horse, ten ewes, five goats and 3.34 hectares of arable land where she grows beans and perennial grasses with a monthly income of 8,000 som.

With a goal to grow her business further Kalygul has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som to buy ewes. She plans to invest the income from the loan into further increase of her livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Ghadeer

texts.en: Ghadeer is a 34-year-old housewife caring for five children. She is starting a new business with a few cosmetic products to sell. She has applied for this loan to support her business and increase the quantity she has.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of cosmetic products

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 52-year-old married man. After his retirement he opened a small convenience store selling food products to support his nine sons and daughters. He has applied for this loan to bring in more goods for his store to support the business.

loans.use: to bring in more goods for his store

loans.name: Sare Souna Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sare Soune  a été créé le 12Juillet 2008 lors l’inauguration du dit banc villageois. Il compte 39 femmes qui habitent toutes le même village. Elles  ont comme activité principale le petit comme, accompagné d’activité de maraichage durant l’hivernage.

Madame Moumini (assise dans la première rangée à l'extrême droite)est l'emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 40 ans, mariée, la majorité de ses enfants ne sont plus à sa charge excepter un garçon de vingt cinq toujours en sa charge. elle détient une table au village où elle vend en détail du thé, du sucre,de l'oignon et des condiments. Chaque jour elle achète 40 pain à 80 FCFA l'unité qu'elle revend à 100 FCFA.
 
 Son nouveau prêt va lui permettre d’acheter en quantité des légumes dans la région Est du pays pour la revente dans son village et les marchés hebdomadaires des villages environnants.

Les bénéfices lui permettront d’augmenter son cheptel de moutons et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
The Sare Soune group was created on July 12, 2008 when their "banc villageois" formed. It consists of 39 women who all live in the same village. They have small businesses and do truck farming in the winter. 

Mrs. Moumini (sitting in the first row all the way to the right) is the top borrower of the group. She is 40 years old and married, and the majority of her children no longer depend on her, except her 25-year-old son. She keeps a table in the village where she sells retail tea, sugar, onions, and seasonings. Each day, she buys 40 loaves of bread for 80 FCFA each that she resells for 100 FCFA. 

Her new loan will allow her to buy a large quantity of vegetables in the east region of the country to resell in her village and in the weekly markets in neighboring villages. 

Her earnings will allow her to increase her sheep livestock and to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of vegetables in the east region of the country to resell in her village and in the weekly markets in neighboring villages and bread that she sells daily

loans.name: Adama's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été crée le 04 juin 2011 et est composé de membres du village et des villages environnants qui tiennent entre elles de bonnes relations. 

Debout à droite de la photo, la responsable est âgée de 18 ans. 

Elle est mariée et mère d'une fille de 09 mois. 

Avec le prêt reçu, elle va faire de l'embouche ovine. Elle achète des moutons qu'elle engraisse et revend après au niveau des marchés hebdomadaires. 

Avec les bénéfices, elle participe au renforcement des conditions de vie de sa famille .
texts.en: The group was created June 4, 2011, and is comprised of members of the village and neighboring villages with whom they have good relationships. Standing at the right of the photo, the leader is 18 years old. She is a married mother of a 9-month-old girl. With this loan, she is going to fatten sheep. She buys sheep which she fattens up and resells at the weekly markets. With her earnings, she will help support her family.

loans.use: to buy sheep that she will keep and fatten to resell

loans.name: Diouma's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été crée le 04 Juin 2011. Il est composé de femmes qui habitent toutes le même village et entretenant de bonnes relations. 

Debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, la responsable est âgée de 20 ans. 

Elle est mariée et mère de 02 garçons de 11 et 06 ans. 

Avec le prêt reçu, elle va faire de l'embouche ovine et bovine en achetant des moutons et un bœuf qu'elle engraisse, élève et revend après. 

Les recettes générées par son activité elle va renforcer l'activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et subvenir à ses besoins personnels.
texts.en: The group was created June 4, 2011. It is composed of women who live in the same village and who get along well. Standing at the right in the photo raising her hand, the leader is 20 years old. She is a married mother of two boys, 11 and 6 years old. With this loan, she is going to buy, fatten up, and sell sheep and steer. The earnings from her business will go back into her business and improve the living conditions of her family, as well as meet her personal needs.

loans.use: to buy sheep and steer to resell after a while

loans.name: Tanisha

texts.en:
Accion just financed a new business and the name says it all – “Tuff Chicks Painting”. Owner Tanisha began the company after working as a painter for several companies and experiencing discrimination as a women in this male-dominated industry. She created her business to be able to work with other women towards a common goal and to develop a positive relationship with the community she serves. Tuff Chicks Painting is growing quickly with their excellent interior painting services.

Since her business is in New York City, she had relied on public transportation and car rentals to get to and from her many jobs. As her business grew, it made more sense to purchase a vehicle. Just one thing stood in her way – she had never borrowed or established credit and was having difficulty getting a loan. Through Accion’s partnership with a great female business incubator called "In Good Company", Tanisha learned about Accion. A vehicle for her business recently became a reality after she was approved for her first business loan through Accion!

The potential to grow her business has never been greater. Now, she can pick up painting supplies instead of paying a delivery fee and can handle many more jobs. Her next goal? Hire more “tough chicks” to help her with her growing business!

loans.use: to purchase a vehicle for her painting business

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en: Sonia is a 36-year-old single lady. She is the oldest among five brothers and sisters. She works in a school, but she is still studying to become a certified teacher for primary school. She has applied for this loan to pay for her registration to get her certificate.

loans.use: to pay for her registration to get her certificate

loans.name: Faida Group

texts.fr: La cliente Simisi est la présidente du groupement d’affaire Faida, entrepreneur de hautement expérimentée,  elle est mariée et mère de 4 jeunes enfants et de nombreux petits fils et filles. Son mari est sans emploi et demeure trop maladif suite à l’état  vieillissement. La cliente est vendeuse de souliers. Elle commença son entreprise avec le crédit de l’IMF Hekima. Elle vient de réaliser 19 cycles dans le programme de micro crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec  40 paires de souliers. Les profits de sa micro entreprise lui servent de suppléer aux divers besoins  (scolarité, soins médicaux, aliment, habillement, etc.) de son ménage dit-elle. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son appui  et autonomisation des petits entrepreneurs femmes
texts.en: The customer, Simisi, is the president of the business group Faida. A highly experienced entrepreneur, she is a married mother of 4 young children and has numerous grandchildren. Her husband is unemployed and sickly due to age. The customer is a seller of shoes. She started her business with a loan from IMF Hekima. She just completed 19 cycles in Hekima's microloan program. This new loan will help her to stock up with 40 pairs of shoes. The earnings of her micro business will compensate for miscellaneous needs (school, medical care, food, clothing, etc.) of her family, she says. Thus, she thanks Hekima for its support and help in making women in small business independent.

loans.use: to buy 40 pairs of shoes

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Marcia

texts.es:
Marcia forma parte del Banco Comunal “Esperanza Requinoa” perteneciente a la ciudad de Rancagua.
Ella se dedica al rubro de peluquería y bazar, desde hace 20 años. Comenta que trabaja desde su casa de lunes a domingo desde las 9ºº hasta las 20ºº horas. Se desempeña en sus labores de peluquería específicamente en corte de pelo, peinados y tinturas y en la parte de bazar vende ropa para grandes y chicos, y algunos perfumes que su clientela le ha solicitado.
Su mercadería la compra en distribuidoras que se especializan en vender productos para el cabello, perfumerías, y la ropa la compra en la ciudad de Santiago por la gran variedad y a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará tinturas, líquidos, permanentes, guantes, chaquetas, camisetas, buzos, para abastecer su negocio.
Una de las metas de Marcia en su negocio, son ampliar su local y surtirlo con gran cantidad de artículos en perfumes y ropa, y en la parte de peluquería agregar una maquina depiladora.
Marcia vive junto a su esposo y 2 hijos quienes se encuentran estudiando. Sus sueños a nivel familiar son darle una estabilidad económica y que sus hijos termine sus estudios y a futuro sean grandes profesionales, y a nivel laboral agrandar su local que ya tiene establecido en su casa.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades, intereses.
Rancagua pertenece a la región del Libertador Bernardo O´Higgins. Es una moderna ciudad que regula el principal proceso productivo y exportador agrofrutícola y vitivinícola de Chile. Es también una ciudad minera, debido a que en su cordillera se encuentra la mina subterránea más grande del mundo “El Teniente”, con 4.500 km. de túneles.
texts.en:
Marcia is part of the “Esperanza Requinoa” communal bank, in the city of Rancagua. She has had a hair styling salon and variety shop for 20 years. She explains that she works from home, Monday through Sunday, from 9:00AM until 8:00PM. In her salon she takes care of her salon-related duties, which specifically are cutting, styling, and dyeing hair. In her variety shop she sells clothing for adults and children and some perfumes that her customers have requested. 

She buys her merchandise from distributors in Santiago that specialize in selling hair products, perfumes, and clothing because of their large variety and their low cost, which makes them economically convenient. 

With the loan, she will buy hair dyes, liquids, permanents, gloves, jackets, shirts, and sweaters to stock her business. 

Marcia’s goals for her business are to expand her store and to stock it with a large quantity of perfume and clothing items. In her salon she would live to add a hair removal machine. 

Marcia lives with her husband and 2 children who are studying. Her dreams for her family are to provide them with economic stability and for her children to finish their studies so they can become great professionals in the future. Her dream for her work is to expand the store that she already has in her house. 

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity that Fondo Esperanza has provided her because it has allowed her to invest in her business. She is also very comfortable in the company of the other entrepreneurs in the communal bank group because they all share their different businesses and interests.

Rancagua belongs to the Libertador Bernardo O’Higgens region. It is a modern city that processes the majority of the fruit and wine grape production and export in Chile. It’s also a mining city because the nearby mountains have the largest mine in the world, the “Lieutenant” mine, which has 4,500 kilometers of tunnels.

loans.use: tp buy hair dyes, liquids, permanents, gloves, jackets, shirts, and sweaters

loans.name: Faidayetu Group

texts.fr: La cliente Consolate est membre de l’association de crédit Faida kwetu, elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Son mari est un petit commerçant détaillant de divers. La cliente est vendeuse de boissons Primus, Fanta, etc. Elle est sociétaire d’un petit bistro. Elle commença son entreprise avec son fonds propre depuis de lors, qu’elle a contracté son mariage. Elle vient de réaliser 3 cycles dans le programme de microcrédit de Hekima. Elle ambitionne ouvrir un grand dépôt  susceptible de fournir des produits brassicoles. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec  4 casiers de Primus et 2 casiers d’Amstel et de 2 de Fanta. Les profits de cette entreprise lui servent à réaliser de petites épargnes, de payer  de scolarité, d’aliment pour son ménage. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son appui  et autonomisation des petits entrepreneurs femmes
texts.en: The customer, Consolate, is a member of the Faida Kwetu loan assocation. She is a married mother of seven. Her husband is a small business owner selling miscellaneous goods. The customer sells drinks like Primus, Fanta, etc. She is a member of a small bistro. He began her business with her own funds from her marriage contract. She just completed 3 cycles in the Hekima microloan program. She hopes to one day open a large store with brewery items. This new loan will help her to stock up with 4 cases of Primus, 2 cases of Amstel, and 2 cases of Fanta. The earnings from this business will help her to save a little and to pay for schooling and food her her household. Thus, she thanks Hekima for its support and help in making women in small business independent.

loans.use: to buy 4 cases of Primus, 2 cases of Amstel, and 2 cases of Fanta

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es:
Genoveva forma parte del Banco Comunal “La unión el Esfuerzo” perteneciente a la ciudad de Talca.
Ella se dedica al rubro de la peluquería y venta de ropa en la feria, desde hace 30 años. Realizo trabajo de peluquería como ayudante lo que le permitió perfeccionarse para emprender en su propio negocio, realiza corte de pelo, peinados y tinturas. Comenta que trabaja de lunes a viernes y 2 días de la semana los dedica en la venta de ropa en la feria.
Su mercadería e insumos que va necesitando los compra en distribuidoras que se especializan en vender productos para el cabello, ropa y artículos en general, en la ciudad de Santiago a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará ropa, juguetes, una silla de lava cabello, tinturas, descolorantes para el cabello entre otros. 
Una de las metas de Genoveva es seguir con su negocio, seguir creciendo como hasta ahora, para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
Genoveva vive junto a sus 2 hijos quienes se encuentran estudiando. Sus sueños es instalar un local para su peluquería y tener una persona que trabaje en el puesto que tiene en la feria, y a sus hijos darles un buen pasar y que sean unos grandes profesionales.
Ella se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Respecto al grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que en éste existe muy buena comunicación. Por otro lado las capacitaciones, le ha servido para aprender nuevas estrategias de venta y contabilidad. 
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. Constituye el centro administrativo, económico y cultural de la región, siendo la ciudad más importante del Valle Central chileno. Sobre Talca existe una curiosa referencia en Chile, la frase "Talca, París, y Londres". Entre los mitos al respecto, algunos dicen que es una derivación de la originalmente dicha por un inglés "Talca parece Londres", por la abundante neblina que cubre frecuentemente la ciudad en la temporada invernal, a semejanza de la capital del Reino Unido.
texts.en:
Genoveva is a member of the community bank "Unity is strength" that belongs to the city of Talca.
She works as a hair stylist and sells clothing at the market, has done for 30 years.  She first worked as an assistant in a hair salon which allowed her to get experience and start her own business.  She does hair cuts, hair dos and hair color.  She works from Monday to Friday and two days of the week are for clothing selling at the market.

She buys the merchandise and materials needed from distributors that specialize in selling hair products, clothing and general merchandise, she buys them in the city of Santiago at low prices which is financially convenient.

With the loan she will buy clothes, toys, a hair salon chair, hair dyes and other hair products.  One of Genoveva's goals is to continue with her business, growing it like she has been and give her family with a better quality of life.

Genoveva lives with her two children who are studying, her dream is to formally establish the hair salon and hire someone to assist with the clothing stand at the market, she wants to provide for her children so that they become great professionals.

She is very happy and thankful for the opportunity provided by Fondo Esperanza, because it will allow her to invest in her business.  In regards to the community bank that she belongs to, she mentions that there is good communication in it and the courses have helped her learn new sales strategies and accounting skills.

Talca is in the Maule region, located in the center of the country.  It is the administrative, economic and cultural center of the region, being the most important city of the Chilean Central Valley.  There is an interesting phrase about Talca: "Talca, Paris and London". In trying to explain this, people say that instead of Paris it was originally "Parece" which means "seems like" thus the original phrase would be "Talca seems like London" because of the large amounts of fog that frequently cover the city during winter, just like the capital of the United Kingdom.

loans.use: to buy clothing, toys, a hair salon chair, hair dyes and other hair products.

loans.name: Johanna

texts.es:
Johanna forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Estrellas” perteneciente a la ciudad de Temuco.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de ropa y confección, desde hace 10 años. Comenta que trabaja de lunes a sábados en su taller y los cursos que realizo la ayudo a perfeccionarse y emprender en su rubro, su horario de trabajo lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
Su mercadería la compra en la ciudad de Santiago en distribuidoras y bodegas que se especializan en ventas de ropa a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará específicamente telas y géneros para realizar faldas y sabanas.
Una de las metas de Johanna en su negocio, son tener la posibilidad de tener un local propio donde pueda instalar sus maquinas con las cuales confecciona y vende su ropa a su clientela, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Johanna vive junto a su esposo y 3 hijas de 12, 8 y 3 años de edad. Sus sueños son ser una buena emprendedora, adquirir más conocimientos y llegar a tener gente que trabaje para ella, así ella dedicarse a otros rubros que la motivan para brindarle a su familia un buen pasar a futuro.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades, y se siente en familia por el grato ambiente que hay cada vez que se reúnen.
Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera.
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
Johanna is a member of the “Las Estrellas” communal bank, in the city of Temuco. She has been in the business of selling clothing and tailoring for 10 years. She explains that she works Monday through Saturday in her shop. The classes she has taken have helped her to perfect her work. She arranges her work schedule according to her availability. 

She buys her merchandise in the city of Santiago from distributors and warehouses that specialize in selling clothing at low cost, which is economically convenient. 

With the loan she will buy fabrics and materials for making skirts and sheets. 

One of Johanna’s goals for her business is to have the possibility of opening her own shop where she could put the sewing machines that she uses to make her clothing and sell the clothes to her customers. This way she could have a better quality of life. 

Johanna lives together with her husband and their three daughters, who are 12, 8, and 3 years old. Her goals are to be a good entrepreneur, to become more knowledgeable, and to get to the point where she would have people working for her. This way she could also work in other businesses that interest her so that she could provide her family with good opportunities for the future. 

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity that Fondo Esperanza has provided her because it has allowed her to invest in her business.   She also feels very comfortable in the company of the other members of the communal bank group because they all share their different businesses. She feels as though she is among family because of the pleasant atmosphere that exists when they all meet.

As far as the trainings at the group’s meetings, she has learned to better manage her business.

Temuco is the capital of the region of Araucanía. The city is located 670 kilometers to the south of Santiago (the capital of Chile). Near the city are several lakeside resorts (Pucón and Villarrica) and also very interesting plants and animals that are found in the nearby nature parks. This is also the region where 50% of the Mapuche people live, who are an indigenous community in our country.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and materials for making skirts and sheets.

loans.name: Ana Betty

texts.es:
Ana, se dedica a la venta de tortillas, vive con su esposo, sus hijos, ella aprendió la elaboración de las tortillas cuando vivía con sus padres, hoy en día ya tiene un negocio establecido con varios clientes, además de esto ella administra una tienda de productos de primera necesidad, en la cual realiza las ventas a toda hora del día.

Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de leña, maíz, bolsas, mercadería para la tienda como pastas, embutidos, arroz aceite, ya que esto le permitirá incrementar el negocio, aumentar la producción de tortillas y mejorar la variación de los productos en la tienda, el credito le dará los recursos económicos necesarios para que ella pueda hacer la inversión correcta.

Objetivo es ir creciendo en el negocio agregando otro tipo de productos, ya que esto le permite tener varias entradas de dinero, también quiere a futuro realizar algunas mejoras a la vivienda.
texts.en:
Ana sells tortillas and lives with her husband and their children. She learned to make tortillas when she was living with her parents. Today, she already has an established business with several customers. In addition to this, she runs a store that sells basic household necessities, where she sells at all hours of the day.

She is requesting a loan to buy firewood, corn, bags, and merchandise for the store such as pastas, cold cuts, rice and cooking oil. This will allow her to increase her business, increase her tortilla production, and improve the variety of products in the store. The loan will give her the necessary financial resources, so that she can make the proper investment.

Her aim is to see her business gradually grow, by adding other kinds of products. This allows her to have several ways of bringing in money. She also wants to undertake a few improvements to her home someday.

loans.use: To buy firewood, corn, bags, pastas, cold cuts, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Oscar Mauricio

texts.es:
Oscar, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 15 años, trabajando todos los días desde las seis de la mañana hasta las tres de la tarde, hasta el momento no ha tenido ningún inconveniente en este trabajo. El vive con su esposa y tres hijos menores de edad de 10, 8, y 6 años.
El solicita un préstamo para realizar la compra de los materiales para aplicarlo en el cultivo de maíz y frijol, como lo es el abono y los herbicidas e insecticidas, que le ayuda a realizar su trabajo de mejor manera, el préstamo le ayudará a seguir trabajando en agricultura, propiciandole los insumos para sembrar maíz y frijol.

Su objetivo es ayudar a su familia, a sus hijos especialmente, para que éstos terminen sus estudios, con el préstamo espera recolectar una buena cosecha abundante y que le permita crear un buen historial de préstamos en la institución.
texts.en:
Oscar grows corn and beans. He has been carrying on his business for 15 years, working every day from six in the morning to three
in the afternoon. So far he has not had any problems in this work.

He lives with his wife and three minor children, ages 10, 8, and 6.

He is applying for a loan in order to purchase materials for applying to his corn and bean crops, such as fertilizer, herbicides and insecticides. These   help him to better carry out his work.

The loan will help him to keep farming, by providing him the supplies to grow corn and beans.

His objective is to help his family, especially his children, so that they complete their schooling. With the loan, he hopes to have a good and abundant  harvest, and that this will allow him to create a good credit history with the institution.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, herbicides and insecticides.

loans.name: Jesmily

texts.en:
Jesmily lives in the Changamwe area of Coast province. She is married and has one child who attends school. She owns a boutique for secondhand clothes, which she has been operating for two years now. She also earns part of her salary through hair dressing, where she is employed.

She learnt about Milango through a friend with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operation of the business. The challenges she faces are the increase of purchasing prices of the product and debt. Jesmily is applying for a loan of 83,450 Kenya shillings (KES) to purchase additional stock of clothes, e.g., bed sheets, curtains, etc. for her business to satisfy the demand of her customers. Her extra income from the loan will be added to savings to pay school fees. Her future plans are to expand the business and start her own saloon.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of clothes, e.g., bed sheets, curtains, etc.

loans.name: C5648 Kangukukore Group

texts.en:
Berthilde is 38 years old and is married with two children aged 8 and 10 years old. She also takes care of four relatives . Berthilde is the president of the group which called "C5648 KANGUKUKORE" in the local language, which means in English "WAKE UP AND WORK" and she is in the middle holding a paper. She sells various goods such as sugar, potatoes, beans, bananas, etc., and she has 8 years of experience in this work. She currently employs 1 person to help her. The hours of her business are from 5:30 a.m to 9:30 p.m daily each week. 

Berthilde has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy various goods such as sugar, potatoes, beans, bananas, etc., for resale. With any profits, she will be able to save money for her future and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy various goods such as sugar, potatoes, beans, bananas, etc., for resale.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki lives in the Changamwe area of Coast province. She has four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a restaurant which she has been operating for 22 years and she employs three staff in her business.

She learned about Milango through a friend with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. The challenges she is facing are debts from customers who take food on credit and the high cost of items for the restaurant.

Riziki is applying for a loan of 104,750 Kenyan shillings to buy more sauce pans, cereals, flour, cooking oil and other food stuff. Her extra income from the loan will be added to savings to start other businesses and to pay school fees. Her future plan is to start another businesses and expand the restaurant.

loans.use: to buy more sauce pans, cereals, flour, cooking oil and other food stuff.

loans.name: Jabes

texts.es:
El Señor Jabes  tiene 26 años, está casado hace 2 meses con la señora Leidi de 22 años, este joven matrimonio aun no tiene hijos, pero desean poder tenerlos.
El señor Jabes se dedica a la venta de calzados y también de prendas desde hace 4 años,  siendo soltero todavía. Tiene ya una clientela bien formada y cubre varias zonas de su ciudad, cuenta que para hacer su trabajo tiene una moto en la cual puede movilizarse todos los días.
Jabes solicita el préstamos para la compra de pantalones vaqueros para damas y caballeros, championes, polera, camperita, blusas,  y otros para  ofrecer variedad a todos sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe, ya que desea poder trabajar mucho y asi poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Jabes, 26, has been married to Leidi, 22, for two months.  This young couple have no children yet but they do want to form a family,

Jabes has been selling shoes and clothing for four years, and began when he was single.  He has a good customer base and covers different areas of the city.  He says he needs a motorcycle to do his work so he can go out every day.  He is requesting a loan to buy women's and men's jeans, t-shirts, polo shirts, blouses and other items to offer more variety to his customers.  He is grateful for this opportunity because he wants to work harder and be able to expand.

loans.use: To buy women's and men's jeans, t-shirts, polo shirts, blouses and other items.

loans.name: Bertha Lucrecia

texts.es: Bertha vive en Isla Trinitaria zona sur urbana de Guayaquil, el barrio donde está su domicilio no cuentan con alcantarillado ni camino pavimentado pero su casa es de cemento y cuenta con luz y agua. Bertha es soltera y no tiene niños por lo que se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catalogo, comenta que esta actividad la realiza por que gana bien y sobre todo que no tiene que movilizarse lejos a vender sus productos. Por su seguridad el recorrido que realiza es el mismo ya que visita a familiares, amigos, vecinos y recomendados de ellos los cuales en su mayoría viven por el sector. El trabajo lo realiza sola pasando un día y cuando la llaman solicitando ver las ofertas las cuales son mensuales para atraer a los clientes. Bertha menciona que tiene clientes tanto femeninos como masculinos por lo tanto lo que más vende es perfumes, cremas, desodorantes, maquillaje y joyas que también incluyen algunas marcas reconocidas. Con el crédito va a comprar mercaderia para tener en stock de esa manera poder mejorar sus ventas y ayudar a su familia económicamente. Su sueño es llegar a ser líder de ventas.
texts.en:
Bertha lives in Isla Trinitaria, an urban area in southern Guayaquil which does not have a sewer system nor paved roads.  Her house is made of concrete and has electricity and running water.  Bertha is single and has no children, and she sells cosmetics by catalogue for a living because she earns a good profit and does not have to go far to sell her products.  For her safety, she always runs the same route visiting family, friends, neighbors and other people who come through recommendation and live in the area.  She works alone on her visits and goes out to to show the monthly offers to attract customers.  

Bertha says she has both men and women customers, and her most popular sales items are perfumes, creams, deodorants, make-up and jewelry, including well-known brfands.  She plans to use the loan to buy merchandise to have in stock so she can increase sales and help her family economically.  Her dreams is to become a leader in sales.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, creams, deodorants, make-up and jewelry.

loans.name: Fatima De La Concepcion

texts.es: Fatima de la concepcion de 44 años de edad, casada, con dos hijos, con 15 años de experiencia tiene por activida economica una pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion , el cual lo inico con capital propio de los ingresos de su esposo  por la necesidad de tener un herramienta de trabajo para soventar gastos de su familia,  Fatiama ha tenido credito con fundacion los cuales le han ayudado   incrementar sus negocio para sastifacer a sus clientes, en la actulidad esta solicitando el prestamo para invertir en productos de consumo diario como: arroz, frijoles, azucar, aceite, pastas, verduras, condimentos, frutas, fosforo, cuajadas, huevos,
texts.en:
Fatima de la Concepcion, 44, is married and has two children.  She has 15 years' experience running a grocery store out of her house, which she set up with money earned by her husband so she could have a work tool to help cover family expenses.  Fatima has had loans through the Foundation which have helped expand her business and satisfy customers.

She is currently requesting a loan to buy daily consumption products such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, pasta, vegetables, condiments, fruit, matches, custards and eggs.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, pasta, vegetables, condiments, fruit, matches, custards, and eggs.

loans.name: Jose Candelario

texts.es:
José, vive con sus tres hijos de 8, 10 y 12 años de edad y con su esposa, él se dedica a la venta de pescado y camarones esta actividad la realiza desde hace 15 años, trabajando todos los días desde las cinco de la mañana hasta las tres de la tarde, hasta la fecha no ha tenido ningún inconveniente con el negocio.

Él solicita un préstamo para realizar la compra de pescados de varias clases y camarones de varios tamaños, para poder comercializarlos, este préstamo le brindará los recursos económicos necesarios ayudándole a fortalecer el negocio y a futuro poder obtener mejores ganancias para ayudar a su familia en los gastos cotidianos.

Su objetivo es a través del préstamo poder realizar una buena inversión en el negocio, ya que con esto le estará ofreciendo su familia mejores ingresos para el sustento diario, también apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios.
texts.en:
José lives with his three children, ages 8, 10 and 12, and his wife.  He has been selling fish and shrimp for 15 years, working every day from 5:00 a.m. until 3:00 p.m.  So far, he has not run into any inconveniences in his work.

He is requesting a loan to buy different kinds of fish and different sizes of shrimp to sell.  This loan will give him the economic resources he needs to strengthen his business so he can increase his earnings in the future and cover his family's daily expenses.

His goal is to use the loan to invest well in his business so he can offer his family a better daily income and give his children a good education.

loans.use: To buy fish and shrimp.

loans.name: Lucia Erlinda

texts.es: Lucia Erlinda, de 56 años de edad, soltero con 4 hijos, tiene por actividad economica la venta de  mercaderia en general, tiempo de tener el negocio 30 años de experiencia, el  negocio surgio por la necesidad de tener mejores ingresos para nuestro hogar, ya que mi esposo ganaba poco y juntos decidimos vender ropa ,en la actualidad no ha ido bien , y hemos crecido en clientela e ingresos, el negocio lo tenemos de forma ambulante  con clientes fijos y eventuales, con el financiamiento comprara mercaderia como: pantalones, blusas, shorts, vestidos, faldas, capris,  pescadores, camisetas, zapatos, sandalias entre otros.
texts.en: Lucia Erlina, 56, is single and has four children.  She earns a living selling general goods and has over 30 years experience.  She started the business because she needed to earn more income for the household because her husband did not earn enough.  Together they decided to sell clothing and, to date, business has been good.  They have increased their customer base and income, working as street vendors and selling to fixed and temporary customers.  The loan will be used to buy pants, blouses, shorts, dresses, skirts, capri pants, t-shirts, shoes and sandals.

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses, shorts, dresses, skirts, capri pants, t-shirts, shoes and sandals.

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, trabaja de lunes a sábado, por las mañanas, trasladándose a varias zonas, ella vive con solamente con dos hijos quienes trabajan y le ayudan económicamente con los gastos del hogar.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de variedad de frutas y verduras frescas, bananas, sandias, fresas, papas, güisquiles, plátanos, entre otras que son demandadas por los clientes, este crédito le ayudara a incrementar el negocio para mejorar su ofrecimiento a los clientes.
Su objetivo es fortalecer más el negocio, ya que depende de él para cubrirse sus gastos personales, además esto les traerá beneficios también a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María sells fruit and vegetables.  She works from Monday to Saturday, in the mornings, and travels to a number of different districts.  She lives with two of her children who work and help her financially with the household expenses.  

María is requesting a loan to buy a variety of fresh fruit and vegetables: bananas, watermelons, strawberries, potatoes, chayotes, plantains and others that her customer request.  This loan will help her to increase her business and improve her customer offerings.

María's aim is to further strengthen her business as she depends on it to cover her personal expenses.  It will also benefit her children.

loans.use: to buy bananas, watermelons, strawberries, potatoes, chayotes and plantains

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a resident of Likoni, Kenya. He owns a grocery shop which has been in operation for the last year. He has four children. Simon started the business from the savings he made out of the sale of maize harvested from his farm. The business now also sells vegetables and cereals.

Simon is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to purchase a stock of rice, beans and vegetables.
