The additional income from this loan will help Simon pay for his children’s school fees and also start other projects. His ambition is to purchase a piece of land and build rental houses in future.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of rice, beans and vegetables.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris lives in Mariakani area of Coast province. She is married and has five children. She owns a retail shop which has been operating for three years now. She started the business through the sale of some of her goats and chickens. Besides this business, Damaris also runs a clothes shop.

She learnt about Milango through friends with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operation of the business. The challenges she is facing are price fluctuation and inflation, seasonal weather, taxes and high transport cost and fuel.

Damaris is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to buy additional retail stock such as flour, salt, sugar etc. The extra income from this loan will help her purchase additional stock of clothes. Her future plans are to purchase a piece of land and build some rental houses.

loans.use: To buy additional retail stock such as flour, salt and sugar.

loans.name: Fermin

texts.en:
Fermin is an artisan who specializes in hand-loomed rugs. He would like to invest in the purchase of larger amounts of wool for production.

Fermin has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is his story:

"My two brothers and I learned to weave on a traditional loom. I was ten when I began to weave with my father, and I became independent when I was 14. We had small looms made to match our stature, and we used them to weave narrow textiles. Today, I weave rugs of wool and cotton and I have my own workshop at home where we all weave on handlooms powered by foot pedals. I enjoy designing and weaving new rug styles, a tradition in my town handed down for generations."

"Knowing that I have an opportunity to buy more wool for my rugs makes me so happy! I would like to thank you for making it easier for me to continue working through this interest-free microcredit, as there are times when I can't afford to buy large quantities of good quality wool."

Use the link below to view Fermin's hand-loomed rugs on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=7472

loans.use: to purchase wool in bulk.

loans.name: Laura Del Carmen

texts.en:
Laura del Carmen is an artisan who specializes in leather bags for women and men. She would like to invest in the purchase of quality leather, cotton fabric and threads to continue production.

Laura del Carmen has been selling through NOVICA since 2011. This is her story:

"When I was 11, I made my first purse as a birthday gift for my grandmother. It was a jute bag, embroidered by hand with a braided handle. My grandmother was thrilled and told me it was very pretty. I love my work. It is so satisfying to innovate, change, transform and see that there are people who like my designs and wear them. I'm pretty much self-taught, specifically in the area of handbags."

"Many thanks to all of you who are supporting me by financing this interest-free microcredit. It will allow me to purchase the necessary raw materials to continue crafting my bags. I will also be able to make the new styles that I've designed, but have been unable to craft for lack of capital. It is not always easy to find the funds required for my craft. Receive a big hug all the way from Guatemala!"

Use the link below to view Laura del Carmen's leather handbags on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=8109

loans.use: to purchase leather, cotton fabric and thread to craft her handbags.

loans.name: Iliana

texts.en:
Iliana is an artisan who specializes in handcrafted jewelry and dolls. She also shares her work with other women in her community who work from home. She would like to invest in the purchase of raw materials such as cotton canvas for the dolls and wood pendants for the jewelry.

Iliana has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is her story:

"What I like best about my work is that I can do it with my family around me and I can take care of my little boy. It is so satisfying to share what I've learned with other women so they can get ahead with their own children. My dream is to help more people with the work I can give them, to see my family grow, and also to grow this project my brother started. Through our work, I hope people are better able to know our rich culture and heritage."

"I'm excited about this new opportunity! Through this interest-free microcredit I'll be able to purchase the raw materials I need in larger quantities, thus reducing costs. It will allow me to continue developing and sharing my art. Thank you very much for your support!"

Use the link below to view Iliana's collectible dolls and jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=7755

loans.use: to purchase raw materials in larger quantities, thus reducing costs.

loans.name: Flor De Esperanza Group

texts.en:
In the small farming valley of Xenimajuyu, Guatemala, nine women have joined together to form the Flor de Esperanza (Flower of Hope) Trust Bank. Each of the women is the proprietor of a small business, specializing in weaving, animal husbandry, agriculture and selling food, among other trades. 

As treasurer, 34-year old Gladys has taken an active role in the success of the Trust Bank. A single mother of two girls who are currently going to school (5th grade and 1st grade), Gladys affirms that the continuation of her girls’ education is very important to her, as she was not able to attend school after 4th grade. Gladys has a great personality; she is fun, happy, and likes to help others and, above all else, she is a hard-working woman who not only sustains herself and her two girls but also her father who is sick. Gladys is involved in animal husbandry, and currently she has ten chickens, one pig and one bull. She has also established a small convenience store where she sells rice, eggs, beans, coffee, snacks, oil, candies, bread and other goods. The store is installed in half of her kitchen, and also she sells portions of food and snacks in the front yard of her house to local residents.  

With her previous loans Gladys has been able to increase her inventory, as well as buy her children’s school supplies to ensure that they are able to continue to receive the education that is so important to her. This will be Gladys’s third loan cycle, and she is excited to use the funds to expand her business. She will use the new loan to buy more items for her convenience store, and she also plans to buy two more pigs. When they are not in school, Gladys’ daughters help her with the animals and help her manage her store.

As one of the founders of the Flor de Esperanza Trust Bank, Gladys is invested in using her loan to make a better life for herself and her family and ensuring that the other eight women are able to do the same. For that reason, she opens her home every month for the group meeting with Friendship Bridge, where the women receive and participate in educational lessons on business, money management, self-esteem, women’s rights, health and how to support their children’s education. These lessons not only provide the women with valuable information regarding their businesses and their families’ health, but also foster a community of support among the women. One member of the group, Sandy, smiles as she says, "We are thankful for the opportunity of microloans as it helps us to promote our small businesses and improve our quality of life."

loans.use: To buy items for her convenience store, and to buy two more pigs.

loans.name: Salvador

texts.en:
Salvador is an artisan who specializes in the carving of fanciful figures from sustainably harvested wood. He would like to buy raw materials.

Salvador has been selling through NOVICA since 2011. This is his story:

"My first carving was done with a tree root. I loved discovering images in the natural shape of the wood. I think what I like best about my work is how you can make any kind of figure from an ordinary piece of wood. Images from Maya art are the most difficult to do but they're among my favorites. It's interesting to work in a craft that helps keep alive our culture, that of our Maya ancestors and all the animals of our land. Almost all of my carvings take the form of puzzles."

"I really appreciate the confidence that each of you has placed in me. This microcredit will be a huge help, because it will let me buy the materials I need to continue working and selling my sculptures. This is what I enjoy most in life. Thank you!"

Use the link below to view Salvador's wood sculptures and puzzle boxes on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=8237

loans.use: to purchase sustainably harvested wood for his carvings and sculptures.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.en:
Rocio specializes in mate gourd crafts and decor. She would like to purchase the raw materials needed to increase production.

Rocio has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is her story:

Peruvian artisan Rocio finds joy in living and creating. "My work strives to show the inherent goodness of artisan craftsmanship. I enjoy sharing and teaching something so closely tied to our own culture. Over the years, I've been able to form a small working community of artisan families," she says. Apart from working with gourds, Rocio designs unique home furnishings that bear her distinct mark, with an emphasis on the use of natural materials.

"I want to thank you beforehand for all your support. Sometimes we all need a helping hand and not all financial institutions are willing to work with artisans. This is why you and NOVICA are such a wonderful source of support."

Use the link below to view Rocio's gourds and home decor on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=2003

loans.use: to purchase the raw materials she needs to increase production.

loans.name: Isidoro

texts.en:
Isidoro specializes in alpaca apparel and accessories. He would like to create a stock of alpaca wool in the most popular colors.

Isidoro has been selling through NOVICA since 2006. This is his story:

Peruvian artisan Isidoro was forced to migrate in the 1970s when terrorist activities swept through his home region. "I found a job as a janitor in a textile factory. I was completely fascinated!" he says. "At night, when everyone had gone, I began to experiment with the looms. One night, the manager caught me and said I should start by learning how to assemble a loom. That was the beginning of a vocation, a great gift that I have now passed on to my children."

"Today I have a wide range of designs and I want to create even more. I was so pleased to hear about this interest-free microcredit program, as this will allow me to be prepared for the upcoming high season. I plan to stock up on alpaca wool in a variety of colors. My family and I thank you."

Use the link below to view Isidoro's alpaca apparel and accessories on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=5709

loans.use: to stock up on alpaca wool in a variety of colors ahead of the busy season.

loans.name: Adjowa Dite Judith

texts.fr: Mariée et mère cinq enfants scolarisés, Adjowa Judith a une baraque où elle vend de maïs, du haricot et du mil depuis quelques années. Elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin et sa clientèle est composée des usagers du marché et surtout des détaillants. Soucieuse de renforcer son pouvoir d'achat et de combler les attentes de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un financement à Finadev. Le bénéfice dégagé de ce financement lui permettra de renforcer son stock et de contribuer à la scolarisation de ses enfants. Elle souhaiterait s'abonner à la source d'eau potable du Bénin.
texts.en:
Adjowa Judith is married and the mother of five children who all go to school.  

She owns a stall where she has been selling maize, beans and millet for the past few years.

She buys her merchandise in a market in Benin; her customer base consists of people who shop at the same market, mostly retailers.  

Eager to strengthen her purchasing power and to satisfy her customers, she has requested and obtained a loan from Finadev.

Profits from this loan will help her to boost her stock of merchandise and to contribute to her children's education.  She would like to subscribe to Benin's drinking water distribution program.

loans.use: to buy 6 bags of maize, 3 bags of beans and 2 bags of millet.

loans.name: Maria Virginia

texts.es: La Sra. María tiene 47 años y es casada con 4 hijos que son de las edades de 25, 22, 10 y 7 años, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio que se encuentran ubicado en la zona  en la zona de Esmeralda,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. María va a usar este préstamo para la conexión de alcantarillado para tener un baño en su domicilio, ya que esto le permitirá contar con un servicio básico en su casa y así brindar mayor comodidad a su familia, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para adquirir lo necesario, la Sra. María enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia, y utilizara los beneficios para revestimiento y construcción de un baño y ducha, la Sra. María se siente feliz con esta oportunidad que le brindan, ya que hará su sueño realidad que es contar con un baño terminado. En la foto la Sra. Maria se encuentra en compañia de su esposo.
texts.en:
María is 47 years old, married, and has four children who are 7, 10, 22, and 25 years old.  She works selling staple products at her neighborhood store, which is located in the area of Esmeralda.  

This loan is her first with this institution.  María will use this loan to install the sewer connection so that she can have a bathroom in her home, since this will allow her to have this basic service in her house and provide more comfort for her family.   She is requesting this loan because she did not have sufficient funds to obtain the necessary items.

The challenge María faces in her business is competition, and she uses the benefits to reinvest and to construct a bathroom and shower.  María is happy with the opportunity provided, since she is realizing her dream of having a finished bathroom.  

María is pictured in the photo with her husband.

loans.use: to install a sewer connection and build a bathroom.

loans.name: Heberardo

texts.en:
Heberardo is 22 years old. He lives with his partner and one son. His home is located in the Caserío Platillos, Tambogrande district. His house has electricity and is located in a small community of approximately 150 families. He very recently took a loan with Edpyme with the support of Kiva, but was able to repay it extremely quickly and as a result of logistics, (it takes him too long to travel on a monthly basis to repay the old loan) he is now looking to take a 2000 soles with a payment structure that is more suitable to his situation. 
Heberardo makes a living raising and selling of small livestock (sheep, goats, pigs, goats and poultry), which after they have achieved exact size and weight, he sells in the local market. He has been doing this activity from 6 years ago approximately, the business is located in his home. He learned this activity from his parents, that is to say, that he knows it to the perfection. In addition he makes a living farming. He has one hectare of agricultural land that has been an inheritance of his parents, there he cultivates corn and rice which allows him to have additional income. The amount of the requested loan is 2000 new soles, which will be used to invest in the purchase of balanced food to feed his livestock and the purchase of zinc sheets for the roof of his barnyard, this investment will allow him to continue to grow.

loans.use: to purchase balanced food to feed his livestock and the purchase of zinc sheets for the roof of his barnyard

loans.name: Elias

texts.es:
Elías, es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de sus padres en ocupando una habitación pequeña, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Villa Cooperativa de la ciudad de El Alto.
El estudió solo hasta terminar la secundaria y actualmente percibe ingresos  trabajando por más de doce horas elaborando ropa de damas y varones (pantalones, chamarras); también cuenta con la renta de su vehiculo ya que trabaja los fines de semana durante toda la noche, ya que debe pagar los gastos de alimentación, servicios básicos y médicos de su familia pues no cuentan con seguro médico.
El crédito lo solicita para la compra de telas de diferentes colores para la elaboración de sus prendas  y así   aumentar su capital de operaciones.
El sueño de Elías, es mejorar sus ingresos para posteriormente independizarse y ampliara su taller de esta forma mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la tercera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Elías is single and has no children.  He lives in his parents’ house occupying one small room; the house is located in the city of El Alto’s Villa Cooperativa zone.

He studied until he finished secondary school and now earns income working more than 12 hours manufacturing clothes for women and men (pants, jackets).  He also earns rental fees for his car that works weekends and all night since he has to earn income to cover food, utilities and family medical costs since they don’t have medical insurance.

He requests this loan to buy fabric in various colors to make his articles of clothing and thus increase operational capital.  His dream is to improve his income so that he can become independent and expand his workshop and thus improve his quality of life.

This is the third time he’s worked with Impro and first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.es:
Jesusa esta casada y tiene cuatro hijos que están en etapa escolar, viven en casa propia ocupando cuatro habitaciones, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Tupac Amaru en la ciudad de La Paz.
Jesusa estudió solo hasta la primaria y actualmente trabaja vendiendo frutas y verduras en la calle ya que no cuenta con un puesto fijo; también percibe ingresos de su esposo por que el trabaja transportando carne a las carnicerías de barrios ya que los dos contribuyen en los gastos de alimentación, educación y servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de ladrillos, cemento y arena para la construcción de un muro  alrededor de su vivienda ya que desea dar más seguridad a su familia.
El sueño de Jesusa es construir más habitaciones y tener su tienda en su domicilio ya que en la calle debe soportar los cambios de clima y ella es una persona mayor, de esta forma mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la cuarta vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez junto a KVA.
texts.en:
Jesusa’s married and has four children who are school age.  They live in a house of her own occupying four rooms; the house is located in the city of La Paz’s Tupac Amaru zone.

Jesusa only completed elementary school and currently works selling fruit and vegetables in the street since she does not have a permanent stand.  
She also has income from her husband who works transporting meat to butcher shops in neighborhoods since they both contribute toward family basic food, education and utility costs.

Jesusa’s dream is to build more rooms and to have her store installed at home because in the street she has to withstand the weather changes and since she’s an older person she will improve her quality of life this way.

This is the fourth time she’s worked with Impro and first with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Fermin

texts.en:
Fermin designs and crafts silver jewelry, including some pieces adorned with gemstones. He'd like to purchase silver in bulk and also develop new collections.

Fermin has been selling through NOVICA since 2005. This is his story:

"After school, back when I was young, I'd rush to my father's workshop to practice creating my own jewelry pieces. Design and craft jewelry was all I ever wanted to do. My designs are inspired by everything I see around me and by our ancestors' jewelry."

"I'm really excited about this opportunity. With the microcredit, I'll be able to design new collections, something I have been eager to do. I plan to buy the raw materials that are essential to my work, the most important of which is silver. Thank you very much."

Use the link below to view Fermin's jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=5095

loans.use: to purchase silver in bulk for his jewelry designs

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Nilda tiene 28 años, está casada con Víctor; con quien tiene un hijo; José Manuel. Viven en la casa que cuidan, que es de su cuñada, quién se encuentra lejos de la ciudad.  

Ella espera con ansias el fine de semana, cuando alista sus cosas para trasladarse al anexo donde podrá ver sus terrenos agrícolas, cuidar de sus sembríos y sobre todo poder respirar el aire puro del campo. Ya que de lunes a viernes vive en la ciudad donde cuida de su hijo, que estudia allí. Su principal actividad económica desde hace 10 años es la agricultura, ella es una socia muy antigua de su banco comunal, siempre invirtió el dinero de manera sabia, ya que en ese tiempo decidió ayudar a su esposo, que es albañil, en los gastos del hogar. En cada cosecha obtiene ingresos considerables, que varía de acuerdo al precio del mercado. “Existen temporadas en las que obtengo ganancias favorables y otras no”, afirma Nilda. Por ello, su objetivo es lograr obtener productos de cantidad para que sus ingresos sean siempre estables. 

Este es su crédito número 12 con MFP, por lo que agradece el apoyo brindado, pues en todo ese tiempo logró incrementar sus ganancias, las que le sirvieron para adquirir mejoras en su negocio. Por esa razón promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Nilda invertirá este dinero en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus sembríos de papa y alverja.
texts.en:
Nilda, 28, is married to Victor, with whom she has a child, José Manuel. They live in a house they’re looking after for her sister-in-law, who is far from the city.

She is anxious for the weekend, when she’ll get her things in order to move to the annex where she can see her plots of agricultural land, take care of her plants and most of all, breathe in the fresh air of the country. Monday to Friday she lives in the city and takes care of her child who studies there. Her principal economic activity for the last 10 years is agriculture. She has been a member of the Communal Bank for a long time now, has always invested her money wisely back then when in that time she decided to help her husband, who is a bricklayer, with the household expenses. In each harvest that she has, she makes considerable financial gains, which vary with the price of the market. “There exist times when I make favourable financial gains and other times no”, Nilda affirms. For that reason, her objective is to always have lots of quantities of product so her income will always be stable.

This is her 12th loan with MFP and she is grateful for the support she’s been given, as in all of this time she’s been able to increase her earnings and improve her business. That’s why she promises to be punctual in her payments.

Nilda will invest the loan into buying natural fertilizers to spread between her potato and pea plants.

loans.use: buy natural fertilizers.

loans.name: Elcy

texts.es:
Elcy tiene 23 años. Vive en una casa alquilada en la localidad de Yanamarca, con su hijo Jean Franco. 
Desde niña ayudaba a sus padres en el campo. “Como hermana mayor tenía que ayudar a mi familia”, comenta. Cuando asumió la responsabilidad de ser madre, comenzó a incrementar su producción y venta. Por ese motivo trabajó con esfuerzo, su madre le proporcionó los terrenos en los que siembra diversas verduras y hortalizas, como también tubérculos, los que cuida con mucho cuidado, pues su secreto para poder obtener mayores ganancias es vender ella misma sus productos. Es decir, viaja dos veces a la semana a Lima (capital), donde lleva sus productos al mercado más grande. “A veces no me alcanza con los alimentos que siembro, por lo que tengo que comprar de otros agricultores”, menciona. Ahora se concentra en este mes, pues tendrá mayores ganancias, pues la demanda es mayor. 

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Corazón de Jesús” y este es su quinto crédito con MFP. Le gusta mucho el trabajo que realiza dentro de su asociación, pues recibe el apoyo de sus integrantes, quienes velan por el bienestar de cada uno. “En cada reunión siempre aportamos las cuotas con responsabilidad”, afirma.

Elcy invertirá este dinero en la compra de semilla de habas y maíz, además de fertilizantes naturales, la preparación de su terreno agrícola, y si el dinero le alcanza comprará también varias verduras para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Elcy is 23 years old.  She lives in the home she rented 11 years ago in the locality of Yanamarca with her son Jean Franco. 

Since she was a child, she helped her parents in the countryside.  "As the oldest sister, I needed to help my family," she commented.  When she assumed the responsibility of being a mother, she began to increase her production and sales.  For this reason, she worked hard.  Her mother provided her with the land on which she sows a variety of vegetables and garden produce, like tubers, which she carefully cares for.  Her secret for obtaining greater proceeds is to sell her own produce.  That is to say, she travels twice each week to Lima (the capital city), where she takes her produce to the largest market.  "Sometimes the produce I grow are not enough, so I have to buy from other farmers," she says.  She is now concentrating upon this month, since she will have higher profits because the demand is greater.

She is a member of the community bank “Corazón de Jesús” and this is her fifth loan with MFP.  She really likes the work that she does with the organization and the support she receives from the other members, who all look out for the welfare of each other.  "Every meeting, we make our payments responsibly," she affirms.

Elcy will invest her money in buying lima bean seeds and corn, as well as natural fertilizers, and in preparation of her growing plot, and if there is enough money she will also buy various vegetables to supply her business.

loans.use: to buy lima beans for planting, fertilizers, and to prepare her field.

loans.name: Asunta

texts.en:
Asunta is a master of the traditional Andean art of reverse-painted glass. With this loan, she will be able to expand production ahead of the upcoming high season by hiring more artisans for her workshop.

Asunta has been selling through NOVICA since 1999. This is her story:

"I first learned my craft from my husband's family. I realized that the more I practiced, the more this craft won me over, offering me tremendous gratification. Now I consider it a way of life. This whole process demands incredible patience and attention to detail. My designs are inspired by nature, and by traditional scenes from my town and region. I feel very proud of the works that I create."

"I was one of the first artisans to join NOVICA in Peru and, when I look back, it makes me smile to see how much I've been able to grow — not just me but my family, too. My sons are older now and I was able to pay for their college education through my work. My husband and I are very grateful to NOVICA and all of you for your support."

Use the link below to view Asunta's reverse-painted mirrors and home decor on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=1028

loans.use: to increase production by hiring more artisans for her workshop

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Xecam Group

texts.en:
Located in the village of Xecam, in a mountainous area in the western highlands of Guatemala, the Nuevo Amanecer Xecam Trust Bank is starting its second loan cycle with Friendship Bridge. The group has 14 members, four of whom are quite young and unmarried. These four young women did not have the opportunity to complete primary school, but their desire to succeed pushed them to to start their own businesses. Like the other ten women in the group, they strive every day in order to achieve their goals and create better lives for themselves. The businesses that the members of the group are engaged in are varied and include: weaving, embroidering, and animal husbandry, among others.

One of the members of the Trust Bank, Lucia, is 45 years old and has four children with her husband, Mason. Three of Lucia’s children are still in school, and the other just completed high school. Lucia joined the Nuevo Amanecer Xecam Trust Bank through an invitation from a friend who currently is a FB client. Lucia and her family are dedicated to their animal husbandry business, which includes four pigs and 24 chickens (most of which are roosters). She joined Friendship Bridge so she could expand her business.

Lucia is very excited for the opportunity provided by her Trust Bank and by Friendship Bridge to obtain a loan, which will serve to buy hens. She hopes to take advantage of raising more chickens and selling eggs. Lucia's long-term dream is to obtain her own farm, because she is currently renting. Her short-term goal is to see her second child graduate from high school next year. Through the participatory non-formal education lessons provided by Friendship Bridge at the monthly loan repayment meetings, Lucia has learned how to effectively support her children’s education. She and the other women have also benefited from lessons on business practices, money management, self-esteem, women’s rights and health. These lessons not only provide the women with valuable information regarding their businesses and their families’ health, but also foster a community of support among the women.

Lucia and the other 13 women in the Trust Bank are both surprised and grateful that people from elsewhere have focused their attention on their small village and have given them the opportunity to make their dreams a reality.

loans.use: To buy hens.

loans.name: Rexie

texts.en:
Rexie is 41 years old and lives in Caticugan, Larena, Siquijor.  She is married with six children. 

To earn a living, Rexie has a business selling food in the market.  She earns about PHP 1,500 PHP each month doing this type of work.   Rexie has a requested a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase assorted ingredients for her food business.

Rexie is a member in good standing and has no history of delayed payments from her previous loan.  In the future, Rexie hopes to have a good return of income from her business so that she can provide anytime the daily needs of her children in school.

loans.use: To purchase assorted ingredients for food vending business

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is married with two children.  Roselyn is 32 years old and lives in Caticugan, Siquijor, Siquijor.

Roselyn manages her own grocery store to earn a living and has has this business for five years.  Each month, she earns PHP 1,500 PHP doing this type of work.  She requested a loan of 5000 PHP to  purchase more stock for her grocery store.

Roselyn has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for more than one year.  In the future, Roselyn hopes to have savings for better education of her children.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her grocery store

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 63 years old and lives in Balikbalik, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with five children.

Rosalinda works in the fishing industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 26 years. She has requested a loan to buy a motor for their own fishing boat.

Rosalinda has been a member of PMPC for 6 months. In the future, Rosalinda hopes to have more fishing boats and own a fish carrier.

loans.use: to purchase a motor for their fishing boat

location.town: Liloy - Balikbalik, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del

loans.name: Haron

texts.en:
Haron  is a 35-year-old married man. He has seven children with ages ranging from 7 years to 17 years. He describes himself to be an honest and determined man. He operates a business where he sells loaves of bread. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located at a competitive business area and his primary customers are shopkeepers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for improving the business.

Haron will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more bread for resale. His business goal is to be a supplier of breads in major towns in Kenya  within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have expanded his business.

loans.use: to buy more bread for resale.

loans.name: Essowazou Group

texts.fr: Mr Komla est né en 1963. Il est père de 09 enfants dont 03 scolarisés. L’ainé a 27ans et le dernier 11ans. Sa femme est cultivatrice. Il est responsable du groupement nommé ESSOWAZOU constitué de femmes et d’hommes qui ont tous mis leur confiance à la terre. Ils sont tous dans l’agriculture et cultivent du mais, sorgho, riz et du niébé. Depuis 1995, Mr Komla est dans ce domaine et est aidé par 01 personne. Il veut construire une maison et prendre soin de la famille avec les profits réalisés.
texts.en:
Mr. Komla was born in 1963. He's the father of nine children, out of which three go to school. The eldest is 27 years old, the youngest is 11.

His wife is a cultivator. He's responsible for ESSOWAZOU Group, which is made up of women and men who all trust the earth. They are all farmers and grow corn, sorghum, rice, and black-eyed peas.

Mr. Komla has been in this business since 1995, and he gets help from one other person. He wants to buy a house and take care of his family with his profits.

loans.use: to buy work tools

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony  is a 37-year-old married man. He has three children with ages ranging from 1 year to 8 years old. He describes himself to be a religious man. He operates a retail store where he sells kerosene. Antony has been  in this business for 5 months and has one staff member. His business is located at a viable business area and his primary customers are local residents. 

Anthony describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough kerosene for resale. In addition, Anthony runs a hardware store to increase his income. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more kerosene for resale. His business goal is to own permanent kerosene retail store premises  within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will buy a plot of land with the profit he will get from the business.

loans.use: to buy more kerosene for resale to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy farm supplies

loans.name: Lubov'

texts.ru:
Любовь, предприниматель со стажем. Основной доход получает от торговли, которая осуществляется в собственном магазине. В течение последних нескольких лет и в настоящее время управление работой магазина передала дочери. Сама же занята развитием агробизнеса. Получает консультации от невестки - Татьяны, планируется их консолидированная реализация продукции.
Вдова, живет одна – семья дочери живет отдельно.
Планируемый кредит необходим для установки еще одной теплицы, в которой ожидается выращивание овощей.


Нуждается в вашей помощи для финансирования пленки и капельного полива.
texts.en:
Lubov is an experienced entrepreneur. Her main source of income is selling produce in her own store. Over the last couple of years, she transferred the responsibility of managing the store to her daughter. Lyubov herself now focuses on developing her agricultural business. She receives consultations from Tatyana, her sister-in-law. They plan to consolidate their selling operations.

Lubov is a widow and lives alone. Her daughter’s family lives separately.
This loan is needed in order to install an additional greenhouse foreseen for growing vegetables.

Lubov needs your support to finance the purchase of greenhouse film and mist sprayers.

loans.use: to purchase farming equipment.

loans.name: Tat'yana

texts.ru:
Татьяна занята работой в сельском хозяйстве на протяжении многих лет. Основной доход получает от овощей тепличного производства. В открытом грунте развивает производство ягод. Тепличные овощи ее производства пользуются спросом – покупатели приезжают на место производства и выполняют закупку по предварительной договорённости.
Вдова, живет с сыном и его семьей. В агробизнесе занята вся семья.
Планируемый кредит необходим для установки еще одной теплицы, в которой ожидается выращивание зелени.

Нуждается в вашей помощи для финансирования капельного полива и сетки.
texts.en: Tat'yana has been involved in agricultural work for many years.  She earns her primary income from vegetables grown in greenhouses.  She cultivates berries in open soil.  Greenhouse vegetables produced by her are in demand - customers come to the place of production and make purchases in accordance with previous agreements.  Tat'yana is a widow and lives with her son and his family.  The entire family is involved in the agricultural business.  The planned loan is needed to install another greenhouse, which will be used to grow greens.  She needs your help to finance a drip irrigation system and a net.

loans.use: to purchase a drip irrigation system and a net

loans.name: Evgeniya

texts.ru:
Евгения украинский фермер, работала диспетчером в колхозе. В 1990-х годах с мужем решили заняться фермерством. Взяли в аренду 12 га земли, на которых работают и сейчас. Евгения с мужем выращивают расторопшу, тыкву, лен. И что примечательно, у них есть переработка, где они производят масло данных культур. Рынок сбыта на данную продукцию фермер нашла в Крыму.
В последние 2 года благодаря информации, которую предоставляет Украинский проект развития плодоовощеводства и общественная организация «Совет женщин-фермеров» в Запорожской области стала выращивать виноград, заинтересовалась и производством земляники. В работе на земле Евгении помогает муж, который многие годы работал главным инженером колхоза. У семьи есть взрослый сын, который живет в другом регионе. Он работает агроном, чем может оказывать родителям большую помощь в плане консультаций.
Евгения Панкеева очень активный и целеустремленный человек. Несмотря на трудности, которые возникают, она всегда стремится вперед к развитию. Большинству мелким и средним фермерам очень сложно в Украине получить кредит, кроме того процентные ставки таких кредитов очень высоки. Благодаря ожидаемому кредиту на агроволокно, мульчирующую пленку, насос и капельное оборудование, Евгения может заложить ягодник земляники в соответствии со всеми современными требованиями. Евгения понимает, что соблюдение всех агротехнологических норм, является залогом успеха и получения качественной продукции.
Евгения стремиться не стоять на месте, поэтому посещает различные учебные мероприятия для повышения уровня своих знаний. Мечтает о благоустроенном доме. Понимает, что одной из важных составляющих жизни является социальная ответственность человека, поэтому благотворительная помощь региональному сельскому дому также имеет место в ее жизни.
Нуждается в вашей помощи для финансирования агроволокна, мульчирующуе пленки, насоса и капельного оборудования, а также шпалеры для виноградника.
texts.en:
Evgeniya is a Ukrainian farmer, who used to work as a dispatcher at a collective farm.  She and her husband decided to get involved in farming in the 1990s.  They leased 12 hectares of land, which they work on now.  Evgeniya and her husband grow thistle, pumpkins and flax.  What is noticeable about them is that they have a processing facility, where they make oil from these crops.  The farmer found a market to sell these products in the Crimea.  During the last two years, thanks to the information, provided by the Ukrainian horticultural development project and by public organization, called "The Union of Women-Farmers" in the Zaporozhskaya area, Evgeniya started to grow grapes and became interested in growing strawberries.  Her husband, who has worked as a chief engineer at a collective farm, helps her to work on the land.  The family has a grown son, who lives in another region.  He works as an agronomist and can provide his parents with a lot of help through consultations.  Evgeniya is a very active and goal-oriented person.  Despite difficulties that arise, she always strives to move forward.  It is difficult for the majority of small and medium farmers to obtain financing in Ukraine, and interest rates for these loans are very high.  Thanks to the expected loan for soil cover, mulching plastic, pump and a drip irrigation system, Evgeniya can now start planting strawberries according to all of the contemporary requirements.  Evgeniya understands that following all of the agricultural norms is a start to success and getting quality produce.  

Evgeniya tries not to be stagnant and visits various educational events to increase the level of her knowledge.  She dreams of a comfortable home.  She understands that a person's social responsibility is one of the important components of life, and this is why helping the regional village house has a place in her life.  She needs your help to finance a soil cover, mulching plastic, pump and a drip irrigation system, and also espaliers for grape vines.

loans.use: to purchase farming equipment to cultivate strawberries

loans.name: Saeed

texts.en:
Saeed is 56 years old and married with 12 children. He works very hard to provide for them. He runs a general store in Aden, Yemen, and requested a loan of 300,000 YER from AMB to buy more stock to sell.

He has been in this business for 14 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, milk, spices, canned goods, soft drinks, etc. In the future, he would like to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk, spices, canned goods, soft drinks, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en: Ahmed is a married man with six children. He is a farmer who provides for his family. He lives in Ibb, Yemen. This business provides him with a sufficiently consistent income that allows him to provide for himself and his family. Currently he is seeking a loan of YER 70,000 to buy a motorcycle. In the future, he plans to establish a transport-motorcycle park and renew his house.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for transportation

loans.name: Valentin

texts.en:
Valentin is single. He has been a maize farmer for 10 years. He would like to get this loan to buy more seeds and support labor costs to get the best harvest. With the profits, he wants to buy more plots of land to increase his maize growing capacity.
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more seeds and support labor costs.

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en: Francoise is 42 years old. She has three children and is married to a tailor. She has spent 15 years in the business of selling clothes. She wants this Kiva loan to add more types of clothes to her inventory. She plans to use the profits to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene, a married mother of ten children, six of whom attend school, has operated a restaurant seven days a week for the last six years. She generates additional income through part-time teaching. Her major business challenges include defaulters and seasonality. She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

Irene is requesting a loan of 2000000 Uganda shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more bunches of bananas, beef, chicken, Irish and sweet potatoes and rice. She aspires to see her business grow bigger, her ultimate goal being a fully-stocked restaurant. She also wants to educate her children to the university level.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas, beef, rice, and chicken.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is married. She has two children, ages three and five. Neither of them attend school yet. She wants the loan to buy more seeds, for seed multiplication, and to support labor costs to get the best harvest. She plans to use the profits to build a house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more seed, in seed multiplication, and to support labor costs.

loans.name: Alphonse

texts.en:
Alphonse is single. He has been a maize farmer for seven years. He would like to get this loan to buy more seeds, for seed multiplication, and to support labor costs to get the best harvest. With the profits, he wants to renovate the house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more seeds, in seed multiplication, and to support labor costs.

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en:
Celestin is married and has six children. His wife is also a maize farmer. He has been a maize farmer for three years. He would like to get this loan to buy more seeds, for seed multiplication, and to pay for labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he wants to build a house and pay the school fees for his children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more seeds, in seed multiplication, and to support labor costs.

loans.name: Immaculate

texts.en:
Immaculate is 52 years old and married to a businessman. They have eight children, and all eight are enrolled in school.  

Her husband has been selling shoes and Immaculate has shifted from selling plastic products to selling shoes. With this loan, she wants to buy more shoes to sell. She will use the profits from her business to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Maria Lucia

texts.es:
María, vive con su familia, es madre soltera de dos niñas de 15 y 6 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de ropa, esto lo puso por iniciativa propia para mantener a sus hijos.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de blusas, faldas, ropa interior para ambos sexos, esto le ayudara a mejorar la disponibilidad para ofertar a los clientes, exhibiendo nuevos estilos y colores.
La aspiración de María para continuar trabajando por sus hijas, por quienes trabaja para cubrir sus necesidades y prioridades, con el fin de que se puedan superar.
texts.en:
María lives with her family. She is a single mother of two daughters, aged 15 and 6. She works selling clothing. She set up this business on her own initiative to support her children. 

She is requesting a loan to buy blouses, skirts and men's and women's underwear. This will help her improve the availability of merchandise to offer her customers, presenting new styles and colors. 

María's aspiration is to keep working for the sake of her daughters, for whom she works to cover their needs and priorities, with the aim of helping them get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts and men's and women's underwear.

loans.name: Ayaba Victoire's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe de deux personnes en caution solidaire. Agée de 55 ans, Ayaba Victoire, la responsable, est mariée et mère de quatre enfants dont deux vont encore à l'école. Spécialisée dans la vente des chaussures et des sacs depuis quelques années. Elle fait ses approvisionnements dans l'un des marchés de la sous région et sa clientèle est composée des habitants du quartier. En vue de renforcer son fonds de roulement et de satisfaire la demande de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit à Finadev. L'intérêt généré par le présent crédit lui permettra de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants et d'améliorer le régime alimentaire de sa famille. Ayaba Victoire se retrouve à gauche de la photo.
texts.en: It's about a group of two people in surety. 55 years old, Ayaba Victoire, the one in charge, is married and mother to four children of whom two still go to school. Specialized in the sale of shoes and bags for a few years, she gets her supplies in one of the markets of the subregion and her clientèle consists of neighborhood inhabitants. In order to strengthen her working capital and to satisfy the demands of her clients, she has requested and obtained a loan from Finadev. The interest generated by the present loan will allow her to participate in schooling her children and to improve her family's diet. Ayaba Victoire is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to buy 15 pairs of shoes and 8 bags.

loans.name: Jemimah

texts.en:
Jemimah is a 34-year-old married woman. She has a child who is four years old. She describes herself to be a hardworking woman. She operates a retail business where she sells items such as curtains, wedding decorations, seat covers, etc. She has been involved in this business for three years and employs two staff members. Her primary customers are hotels and tourists. She describes her biggest business challenge to be delay of payments from customers. 

She will use the 20,000 Kenyan Shilling (KES) loan to buy more decorations such as curtains, wedding decorations etc. Her business goal is to expand her business internationally within five years.

loans.use: to buy more curtains, wedding decorations etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fruits.

loans.name: Marte

texts.en:
Marte is married and has two children in their twenties, and all of them reside in a rocky village of the mountain region of northern Albania, an area consistently poorer than the rest of the country according to all definitions of poverty. Marte is extremely poor; despite her efforts to make a better life, she and her family are still struggling.

For the past ten years Marte has owned two milking cows. Like so many other farmers in this region who sell in the city, every morning Marte arises very early, pays for transportation and sells milk in the city’s streets to earn a profit of not more than $5.

She is now requesting a loan to repair her stable. Knowing that this is a Kiva loan, she wants to thank all lenders and ensure them that she will repay on time.

loans.use: to repair the stable.

loans.name: Dédé

texts.fr: Dédé est une coiffeuse de profession. Agée de 43 ans, elle est mariée à un menuisier et est mère de 3 enfants. Le premier a 20ans et le dernier 04ans. Elle revend également des mèches et tout article entrant en relation avec son domaine d’activité notamment les shampooings et démêlant. Dédé fait confiance à WAGES et sollicite un second crédit dans le but de s’approvisionner en mèches et en démêlant. Elle souhaite réinvestir les profits supplémentaires dans l’activité. Elle espère avoir à l’avenir un grand atelier pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Notons qu'elle a démarré en 1990.
texts.en:
Dédé works as a hairdresser. She is 43 years of age, married to a carpenter, and has three children. The oldest of her children is 20, while the youngest is 4 years of age. In addition to hairdressing, she also sells hair extensions and all manner of items related to her business, particularly shampoo and conditioner. 

Dédé relies upon WAGES, and has requested a second loan to buy supplies of hair extensions and conditioner. She plans to reinvest her additional profits in her business, and in the future would like to have a large workshop to meet her family’s needs. It should be noted that Dédé started her business in 1990.

loans.use: To buy hair extensions and conditioner.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora 2 Group

texts.es:
El comité Maria Auxiliadora II se formo con la union de varias vecinas de la comunidad de la ciudad de Santaní. El grupo está en el sexto Ciclo con 11  integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unido, solidario y responsable.
Mercedes es la presidenta del grupo, ella se dedica a la costura y comenta que gracias a su trabajo ha podido salir adelante y hacerse de su propia clientela. Es una persona con muchas ansias de salir adelante y ser una microempresaria exitosa.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, gomas y demás insumos para poder seguir trabajando y cumpliendo con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Maria Auxiliadora II Committee was created when several neighbors from a community in Santaní got together. With 11 members, this group is now on its sixth cycle and stands out in their neighborhood because of its cohesiveness, solidarity and accountability. 
Mercedes is the president of the group. She makes a living as a seamstress and says that thanks to her work she has been able to move forward and develop her own clientele. She is someone with a strong desire to progress and become a successful entrepreneur. 
Mercedes is requesting this loan in order to purchase fabrics, threads, glue and other supplies that will enable her to keep on working and responding to her customers' requests on time.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, threads, glue and other supplies.

loans.name: Celestin  Thierry

texts.fr:
Celestin  thierry est un jeune Camerounais age de 28 ans,fiancé et père de 02 enfants dont l'age varie entre
02 et 05 ans et parmi lesquels 01 va déjà à l'école. comme activité, il a un salon de coiffure pour homme dans un quartier de la ville dans lequel il vend également des crédits de communication depuis 03 ans. Avec ce crédit, il voudrait acheter des produits cosmétiques tels que le gel, les défrisants, la poudre, l'huile de cheveux pour les clients qui souhaitent en plus de la coiffure défriser leurs cheveux. il voudrait également acheter des crédits de communication pour les revendre. avec les bénéfices, il compte mieux assurer l'éducation des ses enfants.
texts.en:
Celestin Thierry, age 28, is a young Cameroonian who's engaged and the father of two children, age 2 and 5. One of them already goes to school.

He has a barbershop in one of the city's neighborhoods, where he's also been selling telephone cards for three years.

With his loan, he would like to buy cosmetics such as gel, hair relaxer, powder, and hair oil for customers who wants to straighten their hair in addition to getting a haircut.

He would also like to buy telephone cards to resell them. With his profits, he intends to better ensure his children's education.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and telephone cards

loans.name: Noutogbessi Group

texts.fr: NOUTOGBESSI est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies et appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante du groupe Fifamè Christelle (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 31 ans et est mariée à un transitaire du nom de Vincent. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et trois restent à leur charge. Fifamè Christelle vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis six ans Fifamè Christelle vend des vêtements , des mèches, des chaussures et divers articles dans sa région. Fifamè Christelle achète ses produits dans une vile du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Fifamè Christelle et les autres membres du groupe NOUTOGBESSI sollicitent l’appui financier de  ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
NOUTOGBESSI is a group of three friends who all belong to the same tontine group. Fifamè Christelle (who is raising her hand in the photo) is the group's representative. She is 31 years old and married to a forwarding agent named Vincent. The couple has four children, some of whom have received schooling. Three of their children still live in their care. Fifamè Christelle lives with her husband and her children. The couple covers the various household expenses together.

Fifamè Christelle has been selling clothing, hair extentions, shoes, and various other items in her region for the past six years now. Fifamè Christelle buys her products in a town in Benin.

This is the first time that Fifamè Christelle and the other members of the NOUTOGBESSI group have sought financial support from ALIDé, in order to increase their working capital, expand their business, and better respond to the needs of their customers.

loans.use: to buy shoes and clothing

loans.name: Efficacité Plus Group

texts.en:
Horace is the president of the Community Bank “Efficacité Plus” group, which is composed of 15 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through MFI HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Horace runs a telephone booth to the west of Kinshasa. He began his business in 1998. His beginning capital was US $100. With hard work and determination, his business has prospered. Horace is now well known and liked in this area because of his good service. He is a trustworthy client who has received three loans from MFI HOPE DRC and fully repaid them. The loans he has received have helped him rent a well located business place. He makes US $100 profit each week. Horace intends with the next loan to purchase more prepaid phone cards to meet customers' demand and generate additional profits. 

Horace is 38 years old, married, and the father of five children between the ages of 1 and 10, two of whom go to school. His ambition is to open another telephone booth in another area.

loans.use: to buy more prepaid phone cards to meet customers' demand and generate additional profits.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Kokouvi

texts.fr: Kokouvi est un homme célibataire de 37 ans. Revendeur de profession il est spécialisé dans l’achat et  vente de chaussures depuis 1991. Il fait partie  de l’aimable clientèle de WAGES et sollicite un crédit dans le but d’agrandir son activité. Avec ce crédit, kokouvi compte s’approvisionner en stock de marchandises afin d’améliorer son présentoir. Il espère que ce montant lui permettra de fonder lui aussi à l’avenir une famille.
texts.en:
Kokouvi is 37 years old and single.  A reseller by profession, he specializes in shoe sales and has been buying and selling shoes since 1991.  

He is a member of WAGES' obliging client base and he is requesting a loan in order to increase the size of his business.

With this loan, Kokouvi is planning to replenish his stock of merchandise and improve his display. 

He hopes that this loan amount will one day enable him to have a family.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.fr: Adjowa est une femme mariée de 47 ans et mère de 3 enfants âgés de 14, 17, 22 ans(02 sont scolarisés). Son conjoint exerce la profession de chauffeur tandis qu’elle pratique le commerce. Elle achète et revend du maïs et du riz. Elle est très souvent confrontée au problème de fluctuation de prix des produits sur le marché. Adjowa fait partie de l’aimable clientèle de WAGES et elle sollicite un crédit dans le but de réaliser de l’approvisionnement en marchandises. Elle espère que ce crédit permettra l’éclosion de son activité et l’épanouissement de sa famille.
texts.en: Adjowa is 47 years old, married, and a mother of 3 children aged 14, 17 and 22 (two of whom attend school). Her partner is a chauffeur, while she is a business woman. She buys and sells corn and rice. She is often confronted with the challenge of price fluctuations of products sold at the market. Adjowa is a member of WAGES and is asking for a loan in order to stock up on merchandise. She hopes that this loan will allow for the growth of her business and the happiness of her family.

loans.use: purchase bags of corn and rice

loans.name: Evelyne

texts.en:
Evelyn is a married woman and blessed with two children, both below the age of 15 years. The entire family lives in a four room apartment house at Mankon, Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon.

As could be expected, she has gone through some ups and downs which have been challenging to her well being. These problems include the difficult task of child upbringing, that is providing proper health care, education of the children and better living standards. The issues have been felt more with the deaths of her father, elder sister and father-in-law. These are the many problems she has faced, though a sigh of relief can be felt with her joining the GHAPE program.

With this loan she plans to expand her restaurant and her farm. That is, she plans to buy flour, seedlings and fuel wood. This activity will help the community because it is going to increase access to food thereby relieving hunger, especially with the ever increasing urban population. She thinks her business will succeed because she has a good site for her restaurant and a piece of land where she will grow flowers for sale. Also, she is an expert in these activities because she has been doing them for a very long time. The profits from this loan will assist her to improve the standards of living of her family, that is health care, education, housing and lots more. Part of the profits will be reinvested back into the business.

loans.use: to pay for flour, seedlings and fuel wood

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: Kokou est  un jeune homme célibataire sans enfants de 29 ans frigoriste de profession et exerçant principalement l’activité  d'achat et vente de pièces détachées à une clientèle diverse et variée.  Souffrant de manque d’argent, il lui devient difficile de s’approvisionner en marchandises. Kokou effectue des opérations financières avec WAGES il y a un moment. Il sollicite ce premier crédit qui lui permettra de s’approvisionner en pièces détachées. Il veut avoir une boutique et multiplier les points de service.
texts.en:
Kokou is a young single man. He is 29 year of age, has no children, and works in refrigerator repairs. His main business is the sale and purchase of spare parts, and his customers come from diverse backgrounds. 

As he lacked financial resources, Kokou started to find it difficult to buy his supplies. He recently started to carry out his financial operations with WAGES. This first loan will allow him to buy supplies of spare parts. In the future he would like to have a store and increase the number of points where he provides his services.

loans.use: To buy spare parts.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú, nuestra socia se sigue dedicando a su trabajo en un club nocturno como guarda ropas,actividad muy sacrificada por el horario que debe cumplir por las noches. La socia invertirá el préstamo solicitado para construir su casa, ella está poco a poco comprando materiales de construcción para poder comenzar a construir su casa.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle comenzar a costruir su vivienda y por apoyarla con su familia.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to Mujeres Emprendedoras (Entrepreneurial Women) Communal Bank in Cusco City, Perú. She still works at a nightclub's coat check service, a very hard job considering the working schedule. She will invest her loan in building her house. She is buying construction materials little by little in order to start the construction.
She is very thankful to KIVA for enabling her to start building her house and support her family. 
She appreciates this loan and commits to make her installment payments on time, according to the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Akouavi Florence

texts.fr: Akouavi Florence est mariée et mère de trois enfants scolarisés dont l'aîné et le benjamin ont respectivement 15 ans et 10 ans. Spécialisée dans la vente des chaussures depuis des années, Akouavi Florence se ravitaille dans l'un des marchés du Bénin et sa clientèle est composée essentiellement des femmes. Expérimentée dans le commerce, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un concours auprès de Finadev afin de répondre favorablement aux exigences de sa clientèle et de maximiser son intérêt. Le surplus généré lui permettra de fournir des soins médicaux adéquats pour ses enfants et de subvenir à ses propres besoins.
texts.en:
Akouavi Florence is a married mother of three children aged 10 to 15 who all go to school. A long-time specialist in the sale of footwear, Akouavi Florence buys her stock at a market in Benin, and her customer base consists mainly of women. 

Given her experience, she requested and obtained financial assistance from Finadev to better meet the needs of her clientele and to maximize interest in her merchandise. 

The profits earned will allow her to provide her children with adequate healthcare and to support her own needs.

loans.use: to buy 15 pairs of shoes and 8 bags of different grades.

loans.name: Ararati Group

texts.fr: La cliente Masika est membre du groupement  d’affaire Ararati, elle est mariée, âgée de 46 ans et mère de 7 enfants. Son mari est un agriculteur. La cliente est infirmière de formation et  vendeuse de médicaments en détails. Elle est sociétaire d’une petite officine pharmaceutique. Elle commença son entreprise avec son fonds propre, alors issu de son salaire. Plus tard, elle sollicita le soutien de l’IMF Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec  des produits pharmaceutiques (2 boites de paracétamols, 2 boites de chloramphénicols, des antis paludéens, des antis diarrhéiques, des antis inflammatoires, et autres médicaments génériques.). La cliente est confortable avec son entreprise. Le défi majeur pour son travail, c’est surtout les taxes et l’insuffisance de produits en stock. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son appui  et autonomisation des petits entrepreneurs femmes.
texts.en: The client Masika is a member of the business group Ararati, she is married, 46 years old and mother to 7 children. Her husband is a farmer. The client is a nurse by training and sells medication retail. She is a member of a small pharmaceutical office. She began her business with her own funds, so stemming from her salary. Later, she requested support from the IMF Hekima. This new loan will let her stock up in pharmaceutical products (2 boxes of paracetamol, 2 boxes of chloramphenicol, anti-paludals, anti-diarrheals, anti-inflammatories, and other generic medications). The client is comfortable with her business. The major challenge for her work is mostly taxes and having insufficient products in stock. Thus, she thanks Hekima for its support and empowerment of female entrepreneurs with small businesses.

loans.use: to buy pharmaceutical products (2 boxes of paracetamol, 2 boxes of chloramphenicol, anti-paludals, anti-diarrheals, anti-inflammatories, and other generic medications).

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en:
Lillian is married with four children, three of whom go to school. She has a business of selling used clothes. She has been in this business for 10 years and sells to a variety of people at retail. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes.

She works six days a week in a shop. She generates additional income through rental rooms. Her major business challenges include the ever-increasing prices of used clothes and thieves. She aspires to see her business grow big so that she starts importing used clothes, and also wants to build more rental rooms.

She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity but not piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is widowed with six children and only two of her children go to school.  She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). 

Florence has a business of selling charcoal and sells to all categories of people at retail prices.  She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal.  She generates additional income by selling piped water and hiring out a motorcycle. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves who always break into her charcoal store.  Florence aspires to see her business grow big so that she can become a wholesaler and also build rental rooms.  She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school for the remaining children and paying utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Hamida

texts.en:
Hamida is a single mother of five children and all her children go to school. She has restaurant business and sells to all categories of people at retail prices. She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas, beef, rice, and chicken. Hamida has had this restaurant business for ten years. Besides this business, she also generates additional income by selling bunches of raw bananas. Her major business challenges include seasonality, thieves, and defaulters. 

Hamida aspires to see her business grow big so that she owns a fully-stocked restaurant and also can educate her children up to the university level.  She works seven days a week and works at the market. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, beef, chicken, and rice.

loans.name: Ivo

texts.en:
Ivo is a widower with five children, two of them below the ages of 15 years. He lost his wife sometime ago. The entire family lives in a two bedroom apartment at the Mile four Nkwen district of Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon. 

He has been facing challenges in life such as his son's denial to attend school, another bad moment came went the son had a snake bite, the death of his father and to worsen the situation the death of his wife. It was like the whole world had come to end. But light was once again in the horizon when he learned of GHAPE. 

This loan will be used in the buying and selling of palm wine, the acquisition of benches, a musical set for the relaxation of customers, cups and glasses and jars. This loan will help the community by providing natural palm wine for relaxation and also it is a common practice in our traditional activities of marriage and death celebrations to have it for drinking. The business will be successful because demand for it is all year due to the numerous death celebrations, child naming ceremonies, village meetings, traditional marriages and lots more. The profits will be used to educate his children and improve on their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for benches, musical set, cups and jars

loans.name: Anastia

texts.en:
Happily married and blessed with a child below the age of 15 years, Anastia lives with her family in a two bedroom house located at Nkwen quarters of the North West Region of Cameroon.

Lots of challenges have been encountered by this lady, such as the lack of adequate finance to start up a business, low incomes within the family, making it difficult to even take care of some basic needs, and not having a proper education as she dropped out of school due to lack of school fees. The death of her elder brother further compounded the situation. However, joining GHAPE in 2010 made her see light on the horizon due to their numerous offers like cheap and affordable business financing, loan payment duration, training in life skills and business/marketing techniques.

The loan is going to assist her to expand her business as she will add the quantity of all the food items in her catering business by buying wheat in bags, beans in bags and vegetable oil in tins. She will repair her dilapidated structure and buy new chairs and more plates and cups, as well as generally increasing the food items. Her activity will help the community in which she operates since it is a business district. The business will succeed because of the high demand from the workers around this business zone. The profits will be used to assist her husband in improving their housing situation, provide better health care for her family and also increase the size of her restaurant. She is positive about the whole venture.

loans.use: to pay for wheat in bags, beans in bags, vegetable oil in tins, chairs, cups and general repairs.

loans.name: Bulqeyis

texts.en:
Bulqeyis is a 39-year-old married woman with two children ages 18 and 20. She is engaged in an agricultural business. She sells milk products, like yogurt, cheese and butter at the village where they live. 

She plans to expand her business, to build a new stable for animals. Also in the future she wants to rebuild her house from brick with stone. She is a very responsible and kind woman. She has applied for the loan of 1500 Azerbaijanian Manat (AZN) to buy sheep.

loans.use: To buy sheep.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a single mother of three children and one of her children goes to school. She also takes care of additional family members (a sister and brother). She has a tailoring business and has been in this business for 10 years.  She has applied for a loan of 800,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more rolls of clothing materials, thread, and an electric sewing machine.  Margaret works seven days a week from her home and sells to all categories of people.  Her major business challenges include the rainy season, which hinders her customers in reaching out to her, and defaulters. She aspires to build her own house and rental houses and also to own a tailoring school. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity, but no piped water.  Her monthly expenses include house rent, school fees, and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of clothing materials, thread, and an electric sewing machine.

loans.name: Phearun

texts.en:
Phearun, a young 26-year-old mother of one dependent son, has been growing cassava on three hectares of farmland to support her family. To better feed the entire household, her husband runs a small store for fixing motorbikes in the village. They have been with these business for two years and can earn about 51,000 KHR. 

Phearun just joined VisionFund. She is seeking a loan of 2,000,000 KHR to buy rubber plants, as this will generate more income for her in the future, and to buy equipment for her husband's motorbike repair business. She hopes to earn more income from these businesses so as to maintain her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy rubber plants and motorbike repair equipment

loans.name: Suong's Group

texts.en:
Suong, 51, is a mother of four children, one of whom still needs her support and is helping the family's business. To meet the family's basic needs, Suong has been working on one-and-a-half hectares of farmland each for growing cassava and soybeans. She has been involved in these businesses for seven years and is able to earn about 23,000 KHR per day. 

Suong's group consists of two members. Suong has just joined VisionFund for this loan cycle, as has her fellow group member. They are requesting a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and to hire laborers to pull the grass from her cassava field. She hopes to earn more profits so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to hire laborers to pull the grass from her cassava field

loans.name: Al-Asdqa Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Asdqa. It consists of four women, Qamr, Huda, Hayah and Nabila. They are hardworking and have applied for a loan of 200,000 YER.

Hayah is 29 years old, married and has two children. She lives in Taiz, Yemen. She faces several challenges. She has a house. She has requested a youth loan of 50,000 YER to buy an electric meter for her home. She hopes to improve her living conditions and raise her children so that she can enroll them in private schools.

loans.use: to buy an electric meter for her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetic products and bowls in order to boost her business.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LOS SOLIDARIOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio se dedica al negocio de transporte,el tiene un carro que hace servicio urbano de la ruta Cusco y Urubamba,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a su hijo,el sueño del socio es mejorar el negocio de transporte.El socio solicita el credito para comprar llantas y repuestos para su carro.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the "Los Solidarios" communal bank. The communal bank is located in the district of Urubama, in the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco.
