The borrower works in transport and has a car with which he provides urban taxi services on the Cusco and Urubamba routes. He works from 8am to 6pm and through this business he is able to help his son get ahead. His dream is to improve his transport business. The borrower is requesting a loan to purchase tires and spare parts for his car.

The borrower is grateful for this loan and is committed to making the payments.

loans.use: to purchase tires for his car.

loans.name: El Milagro 3 Group

texts.en:
Felicia is the group coordinator for El Milagro (The Miracle) 3. This group is composed of five women entrepreneurs.  Felicia lives in a rural area near the city of Hato Mayor, a city surrounded by rural areas, because of her agricultural activities.  She is a married women with seven children, but only one of them lives with her husband and her. Felicia is receiving her 13th loan and she is very excited. She started her business almost 7 years ago with her first Esperanza loan.

Felicia sells charcoal, fruits, and vegetables in her stand in front of her home. She would like to continue expanding her business by adding more products like meats. She will use this loan to buy charcoal, fruits, vegetables, chicken, and beef. She likes to work and to do business and she will use her business profits to expand her business into a grocery store. She thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: To buy meat, charcoal, fruits, and vegetables.

loans.name: Kimyan's Group

texts.en:
Kimyan is the breadwinner of a family of eight kids, five of whom are still his responsibility as they are still in school. He is 61 years old and lives in one of the remote areas of Dambae district, Cambodia. To earn a living for this big family, he grows rice on one hectare of land and plants cassava on two hectares of farmland. He has been with these businesses for 15 years. 

This is the first loan for Kimyan as well as his group, which consists of three members. They are requesting a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the group leader, he will use his loan portion to buy fertilizers for his cassava field and to buy rubber plants to generate additional income in the future. He hopes to earn more income in order to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his cassava field and to buy rubber plants to generate additional income in the future.

loans.name: Kry's Group

texts.en:
Aged 41 years old, Kry is a mother of three dependent children who are students. To make a living, she has been growing rice and planting cassava for 20 years and is able to earn about 25,000 KHR. 

Kry has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle already. She used the loan successfully and it helped her to maintain her household and keep her children in school. Now Kry is leading a group of three to request a new loan. She and one member are requesting for 1,200,000 KHR, whilst the third member is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. Kry will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her rice farm and cassava field. She hopes to make more profits and to stabilize her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her rice farm and cassava field

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en: Srey is one of the villagers of Sa Ang district, Kandal province. As a 51-year-old mother of seven children, six of whom are under her care (some of them are students and some are garment factory workers), she has been planting paddy rice and growing edible arum for 31 years to cover the family's basic needs. Srey took out her first loan with VisionFund in 2011. With success, she paid the loan, which has enabled her to keep her children in school. She has now formed a group consisting of two in order to request a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the group leader, she is going to use her portion to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farmland. She expects to receive higher crop yields and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Sokheang's Group

texts.en: Sokheang is 29 years old, the mother of a three-year-old daughter, living in a remote area of Sa Ang district, Cambodia. For 8 years, she has been growing rice and edible arum for her family's sake. She manages to earn about 17,000 KHR per day. This is the second loan cycle for Sokheang and her fellow group member. She is requesting a new loan of 1,000,000 KHR in a confident manner, as she successfully paid back the first loan which has made her a better living. She, as the group leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer for farmland. She hopes that she will receive higher crop yields.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for farmland

loans.name: Mujeres Capaces Group

texts.es:
El comité está compuesto por 12  integrantes en la ciudad de Encarnación  todas ellas son jefas de familia que ayudan a sus familiares e hijos a salir adelante por medio de su trabajo. El grupo lleva ese nombre ya que ellas son personas capaces que por medio de su trabajo desean poder sobresalir.
Una de las integrantes, Teresa, quien está casada y tiene 3  hijos. Ella vende ropas de toda clase y marcas, cuenta que gracias a la variedad que tiene ha podido formarse una buena clientela que siempre acude hasta ella para comprar sus prendas. Cuenta que su mayor sueño es poder seguir creciendo y tener una gran tienda.
Solicita la ayuda de Kiva y fundación paraguaya, para la compra de remeras, jeans, pantalones, camperas y demás insumos con los que quiere surtirse y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
This committee consists of 12 members from the city of Encarnación. All of them are the heads of their households and they help their relatives and children get ahead through their work. This group chose their name because they are capable individuals who want to excel in their work.

One of the members is Teresa, who is married and has three children. She sells clothing of all types and brands. Thanks to the variety of items that she offers, she has been able to establish a good customer base to the point that she always has people that want to buy her clothes. She says that her greatest wish is to continue growing so that she can have a large store.

Teresa is requesting assistance from Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya so that she can buy T-shirts, jeans, trousers, jackets, and other products because she wants to be restocked and be able to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: to buy T-shirts, jeans, trousers, jackets, and other products.

loans.name: Irene Elizabeth

texts.es:
Irene, vive con su familia y sus hijos, quienes son independientes, ella administra un local de venta de varios productos como juguetería, floristería, piñatas, bicicletas, y más, este surgió por iniciativa propia, siendo una persona emprendedora.
Ella solicita un préstamo porque necesita realizar la inversión en el negocio, comprándose una variedad de mercadería, piñatas, peluches, bicicletas, y ferretería, esto le ayudara a crecer abasteciéndose de mas artículos, para lograr la fidelidad de los clientes.
El objetivo de Irene es realizar una buena inversión con este préstamo, logrando crecer en mercadería y clientes, además desea seguir contando con este servicio.
texts.en:
Irene lives with her family and her children, who all support themselves. She runs a store where she sells various products such as toys, flowers, pinatas, bicycles and more. She started this business on her own initiative because she is an enterprising woman.

She is requesting a loan because she needs to invest in her business. She will buy various merchandise such as pinatas, stuffed animals, bicycles and hardware goods. This will help her to grow her business by stocking up with more items so that she can gain the loyalty of her customers.

Irene's goal is to make a good investment with this loan in order to increase her merchandise and customers. In addition she hopes to continue to rely on this service.

loans.use: to purchase pinatas, stuffed animals, bicycles and hardware goods.

loans.name: Ps 3 Mbousnakh Group

texts.fr:
Madame Aissatou est une femme mari de 42 ans et de 10 enfants dont 2 garçons. Elle est membre du banc 

villageois depuis le 24/05/2001  et elle est liée par de bonne relations sociale  avec ses camarades. Elle est 

debout à droite de la photo habillé meuve. Aissatou s’active dans le commerce de céréales depuis longtemps et 

dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine . 

Avec son nouveau crédit 425000 francs elle va se procurer de la marchandise (10 fuis mil et 2 fuis de 50 kilos 

arachide et haricots). Les bénéfices générés par cette activité lui permettent d'aider son mari dans la prise 

en charge alimentaire et scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aissatou is a 42-year old married woman. She has 10 children, two of whom are boys. She has been a member of the banc villageois since May 24, 2001 and maintains good social relations  in her community. On the photo she is standing on the right  dressed in a mauve outfit. Aissatou has been selling cereals for a long time and has plenty of experience in this work.

With her new loan of 425,000 West African francs she will stock up on goods (10 loads of millet and two 50-kg loads of peanuts and beans). 
The revenues generated by this business will allow her to help her husband provide for the food and education of their children.

loans.use: to buy millet, peanuts and beans.

loans.name: Chaen's Group

texts.en:
Chaen is 45 years old and lives in a rural village in Dambae district, Battambang. She is married and has only one daughter who is still in school. The main sources of income for her family are cassava planting and rice farming. Up to now, she can earn about 36,000 KHR from the current businesses that she has been with for 20 years. 

As a second-loan-cycle client, Chaen and her group member are seeking a loan of 1,200,000 KHR each. The first loan, which she completely repaid, has helped her manage her household as well as her businesses. With the new loan, she is going to buy fertilizers for her field. She hopes to improve her living conditions with the profits that she earns.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her field

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers, rice seeds, and a cow for her farmland

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en:
Jesca is married with four children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. 

She has a business of selling charcoal and has been in this business for nine years. She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal.  She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity.    

Jesca sells charcoal at the markets and works six days week. She sells both wholesale and retail to all categories of people.  Her major business challenges include transportation and rain, which makes roads impassable. She is aspiring to buy a delivery van to ease in transportation and also to build herself rental houses.  

The family resides in their own house and has access to electricity but no piped water.  Her monthly expenses are paying for electricity and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is married and the mother of five children, all of whom are enrolled in school. For the last seven years, she has earned a living by running a beauty salon. She works on all categories of hair and is at her shop seven days a week. Joyce is requesting a loan for 500,000 UGX from MCDTSACCO to buy more supplies for her salon, which is located in her home. Her major business challenges are seasonality and an unreliable supply of electricity. Someday she hopes to own a bridal salon and educate her children through the university level. She lives in a rented house and has access to electricity and piped-in water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and utilities.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a beauty salon.

loans.name: Amir

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client, age 20 years old. He is married and has one child.

Amir has owned a food market since 2009, selling soft drinks, juices, groceries, cheese, frozen beef, chicken and fish, and dairy products. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knowledge about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting $2,340 as a youth loan in order to buy a refrigerator and increase his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and increase his inventory.

loans.name: Fuad

texts.en: Fuad is 32 years old, married, and has two children. He lives in Ibb, Yemen.  He has a bus that he bought a year ago. His intention in starting this business was to improve his family's quality of life and cover household expenses.  He says that he feels comfortable because he can attend to his business without having to sacrifice the time he needs to devote to his family. He applied for a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to buy spare parts for his bus. He hopes to have a cars auction.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his bus

loans.name: Mahammadali

texts.en:
Mahammadali is a 51-year-old man on a pension, married with four children. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) and lives with his family on the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement.   He breeds cattle and sells milk and milk products as well as cattle for meat purposes to local butchers. Mahammadali has more than 20 years of experience in this field, thanks to his father who taught him how best to look after cattle. He receives a pension from the government each month, but this is too low to cover the family's needs.

Mahammadali usually buys small cattle, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months and resells them for a profit in the local livestock bazaar.  Milk and yoghurt he sells to the neighbors. Milk and meat-selling brings an income of 180 AZN per month. Milk and yoghurt, as well as meat, are very popular products in Azerbaijan. People use meat in everyday national dishes as pilau and dolma and always use yoghurt sauce. Milk products are considered very healthy and are also present in everyday life.  
 
This is only one income in his family and it is not enough to cover basic needs of his beloved children. Mahammadali applied for 1000 AZN to purchase one cow and one milk cow.  This will be his second loan from AqroInvest and Mahammadali has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy one cow and one milk cow

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is a 39-year-old man, an internally displaced person (IDP) who lives in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement with his wife and three children. He is a farmer and has raised seasonal fruit and vegetables for the last 12 years. He chose this business because it is profitable and because fresh crops are in high demand. People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy.  Many national dishes made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruit is served at every table in Azerbaijan families and it is also used to make fresh punch.

Jamal sells his crop in the Bilasuvar Settlement and sometimes at the bazaar. His monthly income is 120 AZN. His wife actively helps him to raise crops.

As these products are in high demand, Jamal wants to expand his business and produce more fruit and vegetables to cover market demand. For this purpose he applied for a loan of 1000 AZN. He will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizer. This will be his second loan and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Teyfa

texts.en:
Teyfa is a 34-year-old woman. She is divorced and raising two children. She is an IDP and lives with her family in a Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. She breeds cows and calves and then sells the milk and milk products, as well as cattle meat to the local butchers. She also raises sheep for meat. Teyfa has more than 10 years of experience in this field, thanks to her father, who taught her the best way to look after cattle. 

Teyfa usually buys calves, raises them, and fattens them. After 5-6 months, she sells them for a more profitable price at a local livestock bazaar. She sells milk and yoghurt to her neighbors. Selling the milk and meat brings in 220 AZN per month. Milk and yoghurt, as well as beef and mutton, are very popular products in Azerbaijan. People use meat in everyday national dishes like pilau and dolmas, and they always use a yoghurt-based sauce. Milk products are considered to be very healthy and are also present in everyday life. Her brother helps her to run the business.   

This is the only source of income for her family, and it is not enough to cover the basic needs of her beloved children. Teyfa applied for a 1,000 AZN loan to purchase one calf and one cow. This will be her second loan, and she has a good client history.

loans.use: To buy one calf and one cow

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.en: Zulfiya is a young woman who likes to work very hard. Five years ago she began own business with her father. She grows tomatoes, rice, corn, and cucumber. Her business has been developing day by day as she has enough experiences and skills in business. She has not married and lives with her parents. Her parents love her and are proud of her. In business, Zulfiya is helped by her father and sister. They want to develop the business and that’s why they are asking for a loan to buy mineral fertilizers. Zulfiya awaits your help and mercy.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Blanca Doris

texts.es:
La señora Blanca, tiene 43 años de edad, es madre soltera ella tiene 4 hijos pero solamente vive con dos de ellos en  la ciudad de San Pedro Sula.
Doña Blanca hace 4 años estableció su propio negocio en el mercado local donde vende golosinas como ser: refrescos, dulces, churros, algunos productos de abarrotería etc. Este negocio va en crecimiento, las ventas han aumentado, le han ayudado los préstamos a mantenerlo con variedad de productos. Actualmente está solicitando el segundo préstamo a ODEF y lo va invertir en más productos de golosinas para surtir el negocio. Su meta es ahorrar, hacer más negocios y tener solvencia económica.
texts.en:
Blanca, age 43, is the single mother of four children.  However, she only lives with two of them in the city of San Pedro Sula.

Four years ago Blanca established her own business at the local market.  She sells sweets like soft drinks, candy, churros, and some grocery products.  This business is growing, and the sales have increased.

The loans have helped her to maintain a variety of products.  She is currently requesting the second loan from ODEF.  She will use the loan to buy more candy products in order to stock the business.  Her goal is to save, to create more businesses, and to have financial solvency.

loans.use: to buy sweets like soft drinks, churros, candy, and cookies, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú, nuestra socia se sigue dedicando a la venta de productos de belleza y joyería, La socia invertirá el préstamo solicitado para comprar mercadería como cosméticos y bisutería que le permitirá cumplir con las solicitudes de sus clientes.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle segur creciendo en su actividad y por apoyarla con su familia.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "Mujeres Emprendedoras" in the city of Cusco, Peru.  She sells beauty products and jewelry.  She will invest this loan in the purchase of merchandise such as cosmetics and accessories so that she can supply the demand of her customers.

She is very thankful that Kiva provides her with the opportunity to continue growing her business and for helping her support her family.  She is thankful for the loan and promises to comply with the payment schedule in accordance with her contract.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as cosmetics and accessories.

loans.name: Phoeurng's Group

texts.en:
Phoeurng lives in the Mongkul Borey district of Battambang Province, Cambodia. She is 55 years old and has five children. 

Her main sources of income for supporting this household are rice farming and fishing. In addition, to earn extra income, she also works for others for fees. 

Phoeurng is leading a group of four other members to request a loan of the same amount each, KHR 1,000,000. This is the second cycle for Phoeurng and two other members, while another two just joined VisionFund this cycle. 

With success, the first loan was paid and has helped to improve her household in a better living condition. As the group leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and a fishing net. 

She hopes to earn more income so as to expand her businesses and live in a good living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland and a fishing net.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Meshal

texts.en: Meshal is 24 years old, single and the youngest of five siblings. He is currently a university student majoring in Islamic banking. He has applied for this loan to pay his registration fees for next semester.

loans.use: to pay his registration fees for next semester.

loans.name: Javier Fabian

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal 4 De Noviembre.

Aquí conocimos al Señor Javier, él es un joven muy trabajador que espera con su trabajo ofrecer algo  a su familia cuando decida formarla, tiene 25 años de edad, está soltero y en la actualidad aun vive en la casa de sus padres.

Nuestro amigo se dedica al comercio, vende frutas y para esto el primero se desplaza a los campos a recolectar de los agricultores sus productos para luego llevarlos al mercado de Manta donde vende sus productos a las personas que asisten todos los días hasta este lugar para realizar sus compras diarias, esto lo realiza los fines de semana. También en su casa el elabora figuras en tagua, las mismas que luego las lleva a vender en las playas de Manta y también viaja hasta Ambato donde vende sus productos a turistas y personas de estos lugares que aprecian sus obras.

Este crédito es para comprar naranjas, papayas, tagua y otros materiales que utiliza para elaborar sus obras. Lleva un año   en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan con los créditos. 

Sus sueños son tener su casa propia y seguir trabajando para tener un mejor porvenir.
texts.en:
The members of the November 4th Communal Bank meet every 15 days in the lowlands of Montecristi, a city that is known for a large diversity of traditional products such as the Panama hats that are famous both within and outside of the country.

It is here that one can meet Sr. Javier. He is a hardworking young man who hopes to provide for a family of his own someday. He is 25 years old, single, and currently lives at his parents’ house.

Javier engages in trade, specifically the sale of fruit. This involves going out to the fields to collect his inventory from the farmers and taking it to a market in Manta, where people come every day to shop. He conducts this business on the weekends.

Javier also works from home making figurines out of tagua (a natural substitute for ivory). He then sells these items at the beaches of Manta, but he also travels to Ambato to sell his products to tourists and people from other places who appreciate this type of work.

This loan will be used to buy oranges and papayas, as well as tagua and other materials for making his figurines. Javier has been with the Communal Bank for one year and enjoys being a member because of the assistance the loans have provided. His dreams are to own a home and to continue working in order to have a better future.

loans.use: to buy oranges and papayas, as well as tagua and other materials.

loans.name: Silvia Argentina

texts.es:
Silvia, vive con su familia sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas, atol, tamales y administra una tienda de productos domésticos, con este negocio ha logrado mantener a su familia, lo aprendió de su madre.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz, leña, arroz, frijoles, aceite, pan, boquitas, gaseosas, entre otros productos que son necesarios para la tienda y para la preparación de los tamales, tortillas, atol, este préstamo le ayudara a brindarle los materiales para que continúe trabajando, también realizara la compra al por mayor de los productos para obtener mejor precio.
La aspiración de Silvia es sacar el mejor provecho de la inversión con el préstamo, ya que le dará la oportunidad de crecimiento.
texts.en:
Silvia lives with her family, including 3 children, and sells tortillas, cornflower drink, and tamales. She runs a comestic products store. With this store she has managed to maintain her family. She learned the business from her mother.

Silvia is requesting a loan to buy corn, firewood, rice, beans, cooking oil, bread, snacks, and soft drinks, among other products, necessary to supply the store and to prepare tamales, tortillas, and cornflower drink. The loan will help her by providing the materials she needs to continue working. it will also enable her to buy at wholesale, obtaining a better price.

Silvia's aspiration is to obtain more profit from her investment with the loan, since it will provide an opportunity to grow.

loans.use: buy corn, firewood, rice, beans, cooking oil, bread, snacks, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
La socia Mónica nació en la ciudad de Cusco, ella tiene 25 años de edad y tiene un hijo, ella es profesora y trabaja en un colegio de la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son cuatro años que enseña en el nivel primario y le va muy bien, ella también se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. En esta oportunidad la socia Mónica requiere el préstamo para comprar más perfumes y aretes. 

La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Unión Latina” y le va muy bien pues es una persona responsable y puntual.
texts.en:
Member Monica was born in the city of Cusco. She is 25 years old and has a son. She is a teacher and works in a Cusco city school. She has been teaching at the primary level for four years now and it is going very well. She also works selling cosmetics. In this opportunity, Monica needs the loan to buy more perfumes and earrings. 

Monica belongs to the communal bank "Unión Latina" and it is going very well for her given that she is a responsible and punctual person.

loans.use: to buy more perfumes and earrings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides and insecticides.

loans.name: Kuysun

texts.en: A woman with a beautiful name and kind heart, Kuysun is a perfect business lady. For several years, she has been with dried fruits. She has a garden full of apricot trees which produce abundant sweet fruit. She makes ‘kuraga’ from fresh apricots and then sells it to local people. She has enough experience for developing her business. Her family is big. She has 5 children and a lovely husband. Her husband went to Russia to find a job. That’s why Kuysun is the only earner in the family. Her daughters help her with business. She wants to buy goods for developing her business. She awaits your help.

loans.use: to buy goods for developing business.

loans.name: Akbar

texts.en: If you want to buy the best boots or clothes you can, visit Akbar’s selling place at the local market. For more than 17 years Akbar has been busy with selling of boots and clothes. He is a man of taste and fashion and that’s why his goods have wide assortments and attract a lot of customers. He has a friendly family and wants to do the best for them. His wife and 3 children love him very much. For developing his business Akbar needs to buy new goods but his money is not enough for it. You are the only ones who can help him. He hopes for your support.

loans.use: buy clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Zulhumor

texts.en: Zulhumor is a very beautiful woman. Fifteen years ago she began her own business. Her business was sewing national dresses for women and children but she got married and stopped her activity. She devorceed and organized her business again with the help of her father. She has her own workshop in the centre of her town. She has two little children and must comfort them with all the modern conveniences. She is going to repair her living house because her house is in bad condition. She is asking for a loan to buy building materials for repairing her house. She awaits your help.

loans.use: To buy building materials

loans.name: Nasrullo

texts.en:
Nasrullo is a man who likes to work very hard. He is kind, cute, and good-natured. For more than 15 years, he has been busy with his grocery store. He sells all things that people need for living as ariston, cooker, stewpan, pan and etc. He has many customers and his own store. 

Nasrullo has a big family. He has a lovely wife and six smart children. He loves his family very much. Nasrullo runs his business by himself. He is the only bread winner in the family. He is asking for a loan to buy goods for widening the assortment of goods he carries. He waits your help and mercy.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for his store and carry a wider assortment of goods

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a single mother of four children; three of them go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). She has a business of poultry farming and has been in this business for three years. 

She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of chicken feed. She works seven days a week and sells to all categories of people but on retail. In addition to the poultry farming business she also generates additional income through a small retail shop. 

Her major business challenges include seasonality and poultry diseases. She aspires to becoming a large poultry farmer, owning 3,500 chickens and also to build rental rooms.  She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of chicken feed.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a single mother of one child. This child goes to school. She has a mini-bakery business and has been in this business for 10 years. She goes from door-to-door selling snacks and sells to all categories of people but on retail. 

She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more cooking oil, baking flour and cowpeas. Her major business challenges include   seasonality and transportation. She works seven days a week. 

She aspires to own a fully stocked bakery, to become a wholesaler and also to get permanent business premises. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more baking flour, cowpeas and cooking oil.

loans.name: Dilara

texts.en:
Dilara is 46, she sells milk products, meat and wool in the bazaar. The scope of her business is agriculture. She lives with her husband and her two children. 

Dilara works at a bread shop and receives a salary. She wants to make repairs to their house so as to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: To make repairs to her house.

loans.name: Petua

texts.en:
Petua is a single mother of three children and all her children go to school. She has a business selling charcoal and sells by means of retail to all categories of people. 

She has applied for loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings to buy more bags of charcoal. She has been in this business for the last six years and works seven days a week at the market.  Her major business challenges include stiff competition and thieves. She aspires to seeing her business grow big so that she can become a wholesaler and can also build her own house. She resides in her rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Odai

texts.en: Odai is 22 years old, single and the youngest of four brothers. After both of their parents passed away, each brother started depending on himself, so Odai got a job working as a salesman in a clothing shop. He also registered at a local university to get a bachelor's degree in managerial information systems. He is requesting this loan to pay for next semester's registration fees.

loans.use: to pay next semester's registration fees

loans.name: Fikrat

texts.en: Fikrat is 46 years old, married and the father of two children who are 14 and 16 years old. Both of his children attend public school. Fikrat earns a living by selling milk products. He has been in the livestock business for more than 20 years and is his family's sole means of support. His goal is to grow his business and earn enough money to pay his children's school expenses. He has applied for a loan for 1,300 AZN to buy more cattle.

loans.use: to buy more cattle.

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es:
Blanca, se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, tiene 39 años de edad, vive con sus dos hijos de 10 y 15 años de edad, su esposo vive en el exterior, pero le apoya económicamente para la alimentación y gastos del hogar. Ella realiza las ventas de frutas y verduras en los alrededores de la ciudad, su horario es por las mañanas de lunes a sábado.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de verduras y frutas frescas de las que podernos mencionar: papas, zanahorias, remolachas, repollo, bananos, peras, uvas, sandia, entre otra variedad que existen, esta inversión le ayudara a mejorar e incrementar el negocio, para poder obtener una mejor rentabilidad.
La aspiración de Blanca es fortalecer más el negocio, ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Blanca sells fruits and vegetables.  She is 39 years old and lives with her two children that are 10 and 15 years old.  Her husband does not live with them but he helps support them economically by helping pay for their food and household expenses.  She sells fruits and vegetables in the towns surrounding the city.  She works in the mornings, from Monday until Saturday.

She is seeking a loan for the purchase of fresh fruits and vegetables including potatoes, carrots, beets, cabbage, bananas, pears, grapes, watermelon, and others.  This loan will help her improve and grow her business so that she can increase her income.

Blanca aspires to strengthen her business and provide a better quality of life for her children.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, carrots, beets, cabbage, bananas, pears, grapes, and more.

loans.name: Joyeuse Group

texts.fr: La cliente Victorine est conseillère dans le groupe  de crédit Joyeuse, entrepreneur très ambitieux expérimentée. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 jeunes enfants. Son mari  est un chauffeur mécanicien. La cliente est vendeuse de fretins (localement appelé Ndagala). Elle étale ses marchandises au marché central de Virunga. Elle commença son entreprise avec son fonds propre. Plus tard, elle sollicita le soutien de l’IMF Hekima. Environs 13 ans, elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec  5 sacs de fretins.  Cette cliente est confortable avec son business. dans le futur, elle compte acheter une parcelle et construire une maison d'habitation. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son appui  et autonomisation des petits entrepreneurs femmes.
texts.en: The client Victorine is a councillor in the loan group Joyeuse, a very ambitious and experienced entrepreneur. She is married and mother to 2 young children. Her husband is a driver mechanic. The client sells small fish (locally called Ndagala). She lays out her merchandise at the central market of Virunga. She began her business with her own funds. Later, she requested support from the IMF Hekima. She has been practicing this business for about 13 years. The new loan will allow her to stock up with 5 bags of small fish. This client is comfortable with her business. In the future, she plans to buy a plot of land and build a house to live in. Thus, she thanks Hekima for its support and empowerment of women in small business.

loans.use: to buy 5 bags of small fish.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is married with four children. Only two of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She has a tailoring business and has been in this business for 40 years. 

She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more rolls of cloth and thread. In addition to this tailoring business she also sells second hand shoes at the market. Divina works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to owning a tailoring school and also to building rental rooms and to seeing her two children graduating. Divina resides in her own house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of cloth and thread.

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es: En la ciudad de Playas vive Rosa de 30 años, está casada y su esposo se dedica a la pesca juntos tienen dos niños quienes estudian en la escuela fiscal. Su casa es de cemento y cuenta con los servicios básicos pero le falta alcantarillado y pavimentación. Rosa se dedica a la venta de suntuarios , cosméticos y cría de pollos, su vida de negociante la empezó vendiendo suntuario los cuales son productos de lujo como perfumes, joyas, maquillaje de un marca reconocida. Como el esposo de Rosa trabaja en una embarcación pesquera de alta mar, se va a trabajar por 22 días seguidos por lo que se sentía sola y decidió ocupar su tiempo en algo productivo por lo que empezó la crianza de pollos. El trabajo lo realiza sola desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche recorriendo su sector o visitando a sus clientes. Entre los productos que oferta están los perfumes, cremas, desodorantes y pollos, con el crédito va a comprar estos productos para tener en inventario y animales para la crianza. A futuro a Rosa le gustaría seguir con el negocio por lo que le gustaría construir otro galpón para incrementar sus ventas y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 30, lives in the city of Playas.  She is married, and her husband is a fisherman.  Together they have two children, who attend public school.  Her house is made of cement, and she does have the basic services.  However, they do not have sewers or paved roads.

Rosa sells “suntuarios” and cosmetics, and she raises chickens.  Her life as a businesswoman started by selling “suntuario”, which are luxury products like perfume, jewelry, and brand name make-up.

As Rosa’s husband works on a fishing boat in the high sea, he goes to work for 22 days in a row.  She felt lonely, and she decided to occupy her time doing something productive.  Therefore, she started raising chickens.  She does this work alone from seven in the morning until eight at night, covering her sector or visiting her customers.  Among the products that she sells are perfumes, creams, deodorants, and chickens.  

She will use the loan to buy these products to have in her inventory.  She will also buy animals to raise.  In the future Rosa would like to continue in the business.  Consequently, she would like to build another shed in order to increase her sales and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, and deodorants.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia tiene 28 años, es una mujer trabajadora y muy decidida, además de amable y cordial. Está casada con Enrique, quien se dedica a la construcción civil y es el padre de su único hijo. La casa donde viven es propia, la compraron a base de mucho esfuerzo.

Su actividad es la venta de bebidas (gaseosas), para esto cuenta con una refrigeradora y una congeladora que compró con sus ahorros, donde tiene guardada, a baja temperatura, sus bebidas, al gusto de sus clientes. También vende refrescos de sabores regionales como “chicha morada” y “cocona”. Se inició con un préstamo de MFP hace 3 años y desde entonces atiende sola a sus clientes. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable, por las buenas ganancias que le deja, pues tiene una constante clientela y los productos tiene bastante acogida por lo calurosa de la región. Además, le gusta lo que hace, pues le permite estar en casa y cuidar a su pequeño hijo, al que quiere mucho, además de los ingresos económicos que le genera para pagar los gastos de su hogar. El problema es cuando llueve muy seguido, pues dificulta la venta, pero eso no la desanima. Por tanto, tiene planes de seguir creciendo y abrir una tienda donde venda abarrotes y comestibles.

Este es el préstamo número 4 que tiene con la institución MFP. Por tanto cuenta con este préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Promete que será responsable con el pago de sus cuotas, como en créditos anteriores.

Con el monto solicitado, de 2000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de más gaseosas de diversas marcas y presentaciones, en mayor volumen. También en los ingredientes e insumos para la preparación de los refrescos, como frutas regionales (cocona) y maíz morado, en mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
Lucia is 28 years old, she is a hard-worker and very dedicated.  She is also friendly and respectful.  She is married to Enrique who works in construction and he is the father of their only son.  They live in their own house that they struggled to buy.

She sells soft drinks and uses a refrigerator and freezer that she bought with her savings so that she can keep her drinks cold, just the way her customers like them.  She also sells other refreshments from the region such as "chicha morada" and "cocona."  She received her first loan three years ago from MFP and since then she has served her customers well.  Her business is profitable because she constantly has customers and her products are well-known in the region.  She is happy with how things are going as it allows her to be home and care for her young son, whom she loves a lot, and the income she generates helps them pay their household expenses.  The problem is that when there are heavy rains it is difficult to make any sales, but this doesn't discourage her.  She has plans to continue growing her business and to open a store to sell snacks and groceries.

This is her fourth loan from MFP.  With this loan she will be able to meet her objectives.  She promises to be responsible with her payments, as she was with her previous loans.

With this loan for 2000 nuevos soles she will buy more soft drinks of various brands and sizes, and she will buy them in bulk.  She will also buy the ingredients and supplies that she needs to prepare her refreshments, such as regional fruits (like cocona) and blue corn.  She will also buy them in bulk.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks for sale and the necessary ingredients to prepare her refreshments.

loans.name: Jose Edilio

texts.es:
Don José Edilio tiene 58 años de edad, vive en  una Colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula junto a su conyugue y sus 6 hijos.
El tiene más de 30 años de dedicarse a realizar esta actividad de reparar y vender Marimbas musicales y vaquetas y de hacer presentaciones musicales en orquesta. Este negocio ha sido su fuente de ingresos de donde ha mantenido estable a su familia.  Esta solicitando 15,000.00 Lempiras para la compra de madera acústica y accesorios que necesita para reparar, elaborar vaquetas y marimbas musicales. Este préstamo le ayudara a tener materiales disponibles y otras herramientas de trabajo. Su meta es crecer en el negocio y comprar un vehículo de trabajo.
texts.en:
José Edilio, 58, lives in a suburban neighborhood in San Pedro Sula with his spouse and six children.  He’s been working repairing and selling musical marimbas and drumsticks and also giving musical performances with his orchestra.  This business has been his source of income that’s kept his family stable.  

He’s asking for 15,000 lempiras to buy acoustic wood and accessories he needs to repair and manufacture drumsticks and marimbas.  This loan will help him have supplies and other work tools on hand.  His goal is to grow in business and to buy a vehicle for work.

loans.use: to buy acoustic wood and accessories to repair marimbas.

loans.name: Erdenebaatar

texts.en:
Erdenebaatar, 34, lives with his wife and two children in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Hovd province, Mongolia. His two children are secondary school students. His wife sews traditional clothes and also has a small food shop, where she sells organic dairy products. Erdenebaatar runs a garment and meat retail business. He has been running his meat retail business since 2009.  His business is sustainable and has many regular customers and suppliers. He is a hardworking man. 

In the summer, the demand for the summer style garments Erdenebaatar sells is high.  Therefore, he needs to purchase summer clothes to sell in his retail store in order to increase his business income. He is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to buy some summer style garments and organic milk for his wife's business.

loans.use: To buy some summer style garments and organic milk for his wife's business

loans.name: Numan Elias

texts.es:
Numan, se dedica a un taller de mecánica, está soltero vive con su familia, la vivienda en la que reside es familiar, el taller lo inicio hace 10 años trabajando con su padre en este oficio, actualmente lo ejerce sólo.

Está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materiales y accesorios para el taller, comprando una mica, llaves, empaques, entre otros que son necesarios mantener en el taller para atender las necesidades de los clientes, con este crédito estará fortaleciendo el negocio a través de la inversión.

El objetivo de él es establecer un número mayor de clientes y ofrecer una atención más personalizada, que le permita mantener la preferencia de ellos.
texts.en:
Numan works in an auto repair shop.  He’s single and lives with his family.  The house he lives in is the family home.  He opened the shop ten years ago working in this occupation with his father but currently works by himself.

He’s asking for a loan to buy supplies and accessories for his shop.  He will buy a light cover, wrenches and seals among others he needs to have in the shop to take care of customers’ needs.  He will be strengthening the business by means of this investment.  His goal is to acquire a larger number of customers and offer more personalized service that will guarantee their loyalty.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.
